item.description: And when affliction touches man, he calls upon Us, whether lying on his side or sitting or standing; but when We remove from him his affliction, he continues [in disobedience] as if he had never called upon Us to [remove] an affliction that touched him. Thus is made pleasing to the transgressors that which they have been doing

item.title: Al-Quran-10:11
item.description: And We had already destroyed generations before you when they wronged, and their messengers had come to them with clear proofs, but they were not to believe. Thus do We recompense the criminal people

item.title: Al-Quran-10:12
item.description: Then We made you successors in the land after them so that We may observe how you will do.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:13
item.description: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, those who do not expect the meeting with Us say, "Bring us a Qur'an other than this or change it." Say, [O Muhammad], "It is not for me to change it on my own accord. I only follow what is revealed to me. Indeed I fear, if I should disobey my Lord, the punishment of a tremendous Day."

item.title: Al-Quran-10:14
item.description: So who is more unjust than he who invents a lie about Allah or denies His signs? Indeed, the criminals will not succeed

item.title: Al-Quran-10:15
item.description: And mankind was not but one community [united in religion], but [then] they differed. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them [immediately] concerning that over which they differ.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:16
item.description: But when He saves them, at once they commit injustice upon the earth without right. O mankind, your injustice is only against yourselves, [being merely] the enjoyment of worldly life. Then to Us is your return, and We will inform you of what you used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:17
item.description: The example of [this] worldly life is but like rain which We have sent down from the sky that the plants of the earth absorb - [those] from which men and livestock eat - until, when the earth has taken on its adornment and is beautified and its people suppose that they have capability over it, there comes to it Our command by night or by day, and We make it as a harvest, as if it had not flourished yesterday. Thus do We explain in detail the signs for a people who give thought.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:18
item.description: And Allah invites to the Home of Peace and guides whom He wills to a straight path

item.title: Al-Quran-10:19
item.description: For them who have done good is the best [reward] and extra. No darkness will cover their faces, nor humiliation. Those are companions of Paradise; they will abide therein eternally

item.title: Al-Quran-10:20
item.description: But they who have earned [blame for] evil doings - the recompense of an evil deed is its equivalent, and humiliation will cover them. They will have from Allah no protector. It will be as if their faces are covered with pieces of the night - so dark [are they]. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:21
item.description: And [mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will gather them all together - then We will say to those who associated others with Allah, "[Remain in] your place, you and your 'partners.' " Then We will separate them, and their "partners" will say, "You did not used to worship us,

item.title: Al-Quran-10:22
item.description: There, [on that Day], every soul will be put to trial for what it did previously, and they will be returned to Allah, their master, the Truth, and lost from them is whatever they used to invent.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:23
item.description: For that is Allah, your Lord, the Truth. And what can be beyond truth except error? So how are you averted?

item.title: Al-Quran-10:24
item.description: Thus the word of your Lord has come into effect upon those who defiantly disobeyed - that they will not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:25
item.description: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who begins creation and then repeats it?" Say, "Allah begins creation and then repeats it, so how are you deluded?"

item.title: Al-Quran-10:26
item.description: Say, "Are there of your 'partners' any who guides to the truth?" Say, "Allah guides to the truth. So is He who guides to the truth more worthy to be followed or he who guides not unless he is guided? Then what is [wrong] with you - how do you judge?"

item.title: Al-Quran-10:27
item.description: And most of them follow not except assumption. Indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:28
item.description: And it was not [possible] for this Qur'an to be produced by other than Allah, but [it is] a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of the [former] Scripture, about which there is no doubt, from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:29
item.description: Rather, they have denied that which they encompass not in knowledge and whose interpretation has not yet come to them. Thus did those before them deny. Then observe how was the end of the wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:30
item.description: And of them are those who believe in it, and of them are those who do not believe in it. And your Lord is most knowing of the corrupters

item.title: Al-Quran-10:31
item.description: And among them are those who listen to you. But can you cause the deaf to hear, although they will not use reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-10:32
item.description: And among them are those who look at you. But can you guide the blind although they will not [attempt to] see?

item.title: Al-Quran-10:33
item.description: Indeed, Allah does not wrong the people at all, but it is the people who are wronging themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:34
item.description: And on the Day when He will gather them, [it will be] as if they had not remained [in the world] but an hour of the day, [and] they will know each other. Those will have lost who denied the meeting with Allah and were not guided

item.title: Al-Quran-10:35
item.description: And whether We show you some of what We promise them, [O Muhammad], or We take you in death, to Us is their return; then, [either way], Allah is a witness concerning what they are doing

item.title: Al-Quran-10:36
item.description: And for every nation is a messenger. So when their messenger comes, it will be judged between them in justice, and they will not be wronged

item.title: Al-Quran-10:37
item.description: Then is it that when it has [actually] occurred you will believe in it? Now? And you were [once] for it impatient

item.title: Al-Quran-10:38
item.description: And if each soul that wronged had everything on earth, it would offer it in ransom. And they will confide regret when they see the punishment; and they will be judged in justice, and they will not be wronged

item.title: Al-Quran-10:39
item.description: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth. Unquestionably, the promise of Allah is truth, but most of them do not know

item.title: Al-Quran-10:40
item.description: He gives life and causes death, and to Him you will be returned

item.title: Al-Quran-10:41
item.description: O mankind, there has to come to you instruction from your Lord and healing for what is in the breasts and guidance and mercy for the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:42
item.description: And, [O Muhammad], you are not [engaged] in any matter or recite any of the Qur'an and you [people] do not do any deed except that We are witness over you when you are involved in it. And not absent from your Lord is any [part] of an atom's weight within the earth or within the heaven or [anything] smaller than that or greater but that it is in a clear register.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:43
item.description: Unquestionably, [for] the allies of Allah there will be no fear concerning them, nor will they grieve

item.title: Al-Quran-10:44
item.description: Those who believed and were fearing Allah

item.title: Al-Quran-10:45
item.description: For them are good tidings in the worldly life and in the Hereafter. No change is there in the words of Allah. That is what is the great attainment.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:46
item.description: And let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, honor [due to power] belongs to Allah entirely. He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:47
item.description: It is He who made for you the night to rest therein and the day, giving sight. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:48
item.description: [For them is brief] enjoyment in this world; then to Us is their return; then We will make them taste the severe punishment because they used to disbelieve

item.title: Al-Quran-10:49
item.description: And they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship and made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:50
item.description: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before. Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors

item.title: Al-Quran-10:51
item.description: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people

item.title: Al-Quran-10:52
item.description: But no one believed Moses, except [some] youths among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors

item.title: Al-Quran-10:53
item.description: Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters?

item.title: Al-Quran-10:54
item.description: So today We will save you in body that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless

item.title: Al-Quran-10:55
item.description: And We had certainty settled the Children of Israel in an agreeable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until [after] knowledge had come to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ

item.title: Al-Quran-10:56
item.description: So if you are in doubt, [O Muhammad], about that which We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:57
item.description: And never be of those who deny the signs of Allah and [thus] be among the losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:58
item.description: Indeed, those upon whom the word of your Lord has come into effect will not believe,

item.title: Al-Quran-10:59
item.description: Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:60
item.description: Then has there not been a [single] city that believed so its faith benefited it except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:61
item.description: And had your Lord willed, those on earth would have believed - all of them entirely. Then, [O Muhammad], would you compel the people in order that they become believers?

item.title: Al-Quran-10:62
item.description: And it is not for a soul to believe except by permission of Allah, and He will place defilement upon those who will not use reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-10:63
item.description: Then We will save our messengers and those who have believed. Thus, it is an obligation upon Us that We save the believers

item.title: Al-Quran-10:64
item.description: And [commanded], 'Direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth, and never be of those who associate others with Allah;

item.title: Al-Quran-10:65
item.description: And do not invoke besides Allah that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed you would be of the wrongdoers.'"

item.title: Al-Quran-10:66
item.description: And if Allah should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful

item.title: Al-Quran-10:67
item.description: And follow what is revealed to you, [O Muhammad], and be patient until Allah will judge. And He is the best of judges.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book whose verses are perfected and then presented in detail from [one who is] Wise and Acquainted.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:2
item.description: Unquestionably, they the disbelievers turn away their breasts to hide themselves from Him. Unquestionably, [even] when they cover themselves in their clothing, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:3
item.description: And there is no creature on earth but that upon Allah is its provision, and He knows its place of dwelling and place of storage. All is in a clear register.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:4
item.description: And if We give man a taste of mercy from Us and then We withdraw it from him, indeed, he is despairing and ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:5
item.description: Except for those who are patient and do righteous deeds; those will have forgiveness and great reward.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:6
item.description: And if they do not respond to you - then know that the Qur'an was revealed with the knowledge of Allah and that there is no deity except Him. Then, would you [not] be Muslims?

item.title: Al-Quran-11:7
item.description: Whoever desires the life of this world and its adornments - We fully repay them for their deeds therein, and they therein will not be deprived.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:8
item.description: Those are the ones for whom there is not in the Hereafter but the Fire. And lost is what they did therein, and worthless is what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:9
item.description: So is one who [stands] upon a clear evidence from his Lord [like the aforementioned]? And a witness from Him follows it, and before it was the Scripture of Moses to lead and as mercy. Those [believers in the former revelations] believe in the Qur'an. But whoever disbelieves in it from the [various] factions - the Fire is his promised destination. So be not in doubt about it. Indeed, it is the truth from your Lord, but most of the people do not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:10
item.description: Who averted [people] from the way of Allah and sought to make it [seem] deviant while they, concerning the Hereafter, were disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:11
item.description: Those were not causing failure [to Allah] on earth, nor did they have besides Allah any protectors. For them the punishment will be multiplied. They were not able to hear, nor did they see.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:12
item.description: Those are the ones who will have lost themselves, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:13
item.description: Assuredly, it is they in the Hereafter who will be the greatest losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:14
item.description: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds and humbled themselves to their Lord - those are the companions of Paradise; they will abide eternally therein.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:15
item.description: The example of the two parties is like the blind and deaf, and the seeing and hearing. Are they equal in comparison? Then, will you not remember?

item.title: Al-Quran-11:16
item.description: And O my people, I ask not of you for it any wealth. My reward is not but from Allah. And I am not one to drive away those who have believed. Indeed, they will meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people behaving ignorantly.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:17
item.description: And O my people, who would protect me from Allah if I drove them away? Then will you not be reminded?

item.title: Al-Quran-11:18
item.description: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal to you, [O Muhammad]. You knew it not, neither you nor your people, before this. So be patient; indeed, the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:19
item.description: And to 'Aad [We sent] their brother Hud. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. You are not but inventors [of falsehood].

item.title: Al-Quran-11:20
item.description: O my people, I do not ask you for it any reward. My reward is only from the one who created me. Then will you not reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-11:21
item.description: Other than Him. So plot against me all together; then do not give me respite.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:22
item.description: And when Our command came, We saved Hud and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us; and We saved them from a harsh punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:23
item.description: And that was 'Aad, who rejected the signs of their Lord and disobeyed His messengers and followed the order of every obstinate tyrant.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:24
item.description: And they were [therefore] followed in this world with a curse and [as well] on the Day of Resurrection. Unquestionably, 'Aad denied their Lord; then away with 'Aad, the people of Hud.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:25
item.description: And O my people, this is the she-camel of Allah - [she is] to you a sign. So let her feed upon Allah 's earth and do not touch her with harm, or you will be taken by an impending punishment."

item.title: Al-Quran-11:26
item.description: So when Our command came, We saved Salih and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us, and [saved them] from the disgrace of that day. Indeed, it is your Lord who is the Powerful, the Exalted in Might.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:27
item.description: And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone

item.title: Al-Quran-11:28
item.description: As if they had never prospered therein. Unquestionably, Thamud denied their Lord; then, away with Thamud.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:29
item.description: And his Wife was standing, and she smiled. Then We gave her good tidings of Isaac and after Isaac, Jacob.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:30
item.description: And when the fright had left Abraham and the good tidings had reached him, he began to argue with Us concerning the people of Lot.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:31
item.description: Indeed, Abraham was forbearing, grieving and [frequently] returning [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-11:32
item.description: So when Our command came, We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of layered hard clay, [which were]

item.title: Al-Quran-11:33
item.description: Marked from your Lord. And Allah 's punishment is not from the wrongdoers [very] far.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:34
item.description: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb. He said, "O my people, worship Allah; you have no deity other than Him. And do not decrease from the measure and the scale. Indeed, I see you in prosperity, but indeed, I fear for you the punishment of an all-encompassing Day.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:35
item.description: And O my people, give full measure and weight in justice and do not deprive the people of their due and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:36
item.description: They said, "O Shu'ayb, does your prayer command you that we should leave what our fathers worship or not do with our wealth what we please? Indeed, you are the forbearing, the discerning!"

item.title: Al-Quran-11:37
item.description: And O my people, let not [your] dissension from me cause you to be struck by that similar to what struck the people of Noah or the people of Hud or the people of Salih. And the people of Lot are not from you far away.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:38
item.description: They said, "O Shu'ayb, we do not understand much of what you say, and indeed, we consider you among us as weak. And if not for your family, we would have stoned you [to death]; and you are not to us one respected."

item.title: Al-Quran-11:39
item.description: And when Our command came, We saved Shu'ayb and those who believed with him, by mercy from Us. And the shriek seized those who had wronged, and they became within their homes [corpses] fallen prone

item.title: Al-Quran-11:40
item.description: As if they had never prospered therein. Then, away with Madyan as Thamud was taken away.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:41
item.description: And We did certainly send Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

item.title: Al-Quran-11:42
item.description: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they followed the command of Pharaoh, and the command of Pharaoh was not [at all] discerning.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:43
item.description: He will precede his people on the Day of Resurrection and lead them into the Fire; and wretched is the place to which they are led.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:44
item.description: And they were followed in this [world] with a curse and on the Day of Resurrection. And wretched is the gift which is given.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:45
item.description: That is from the news of the cities, which We relate to you; of them, some are [still] standing and some are [as] a harvest [mowed down].

item.title: Al-Quran-11:46
item.description: And We did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves. And they were not availed at all by their gods which they invoked other than Allah when there came the command of your Lord. And they did not increase them in other than ruin.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:47
item.description: And thus is the seizure of your Lord when He seizes the cities while they are committing wrong. Indeed, His seizure is painful and severe.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:48
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign for those who fear the punishment of the Hereafter. That is a Day for which the people will be collected, and that is a Day [which will be] witnessed.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:49
item.description: And We do not delay it except for a limited term.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:50
item.description: The Day it comes no soul will speak except by His permission. And among them will be the wretched and the prosperous.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:51
item.description: As for those who were [destined to be] wretched, they will be in the Fire. For them therein is [violent] exhaling and inhaling.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:52
item.description: [They will be] abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will. Indeed, your Lord is an effecter of what He intends.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:53
item.description: And as for those who were [destined to be] prosperous, they will be in Paradise, abiding therein as long as the heavens and the earth endure, except what your Lord should will - a bestowal uninterrupted.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:54
item.description: So do not be in doubt, [O Muhammad], as to what these [polytheists] are worshipping. They worship not except as their fathers worshipped before. And indeed, We will give them their share undiminished.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:55
item.description: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture, but it came under disagreement. And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, it would have been judged between them. And indeed they are, concerning the Qur'an, in disquieting doubt.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:56
item.description: And indeed, each [of the believers and disbelievers] - your Lord will fully compensate them for their deeds. Indeed, He is Acquainted with what they do.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:57
item.description: So remain on a right course as you have been commanded, [you] and those who have turned back with you [to Allah], and do not transgress. Indeed, He is Seeing of what you do.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:58
item.description: And do not incline toward those who do wrong, lest you be touched by the Fire, and you would not have other than Allah any protectors; then you would not be helped.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:59
item.description: And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with misdeeds. That is a reminder for those who remember.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:60
item.description: And be patient, for indeed, Allah does not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:61
item.description: So why were there not among the generations before you those of enduring discrimination forbidding corruption on earth - except a few of those We saved from among them? But those who wronged pursued what luxury they were given therein, and they were criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:62
item.description: And your Lord would not have destroyed the cities unjustly while their people were reformers.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:63
item.description: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:64
item.description: And each [story] We relate to you from the news of the messengers is that by which We make firm your heart. And there has come to you, in this, the truth and an instruction and a reminder for the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-11:65
item.description: And to Allah belong the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth and to Him will be returned the matter, all of it, so worship Him and rely upon Him. And your Lord is not unaware of that which you do.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the clear Book.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:2
item.description: Indeed, We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an that you might understand.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:3
item.description: We relate to you, [O Muhammad], the best of stories in what We have revealed to you of this Qur'an although you were, before it, among the unaware.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:4
item.description: Certainly were there in Joseph and his brothers signs for those who ask,

item.title: Al-Quran-12:5
item.description: Send him with us tomorrow that he may eat well and play. And indeed, we will be his guardians.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:6
item.description: And they came to their father at night, weeping.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:7
item.description: And they sold him for a reduced price - a few dirhams - and they were, concerning him, of those content with little.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:8
item.description: And when Joseph reached maturity, We gave him judgment and knowledge. And thus We reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:9
item.description: And she certainly determined [to seduce] him, and he would have inclined to her had he not seen the proof of his Lord. And thus [it was] that We should avert from him evil and immorality. Indeed, he was of Our chosen servants.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:10
item.description: So when her husband saw his shirt torn from the back, he said, "Indeed, it is of the women's plan. Indeed, your plan is great.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:11
item.description: And women in the city said, "The wife of al-'Azeez is seeking to seduce her slave boy; he has impassioned her with love. Indeed, we see her [to be] in clear error."

item.title: Al-Quran-12:12
item.description: So his Lord responded to him and averted from him their plan. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:13
item.description: Then it appeared to them after they had seen the signs that al-'Azeez should surely imprison him for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:14
item.description: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob. And it was not for us to associate anything with Allah. That is from the favor of Allah upon us and upon the people, but most of the people are not grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:15
item.description: O [my] two companions of prison, are separate lords better or Allah, the One, the Prevailing?

item.title: Al-Quran-12:16
item.description: You worship not besides Him except [mere] names you have named them, you and your fathers, for which Allah has sent down no authority. Legislation is not but for Allah. He has commanded that you worship not except Him. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:17
item.description: Then will come after that seven difficult [years] which will consume what you saved for them, except a little from which you will store.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:18
item.description: Said [the king to the women], "What was your condition when you sought to seduce Joseph?" They said, "Perfect is Allah! We know about him no evil." The wife of al-'Azeez said, "Now the truth has become evident. It was I who sought to seduce him, and indeed, he is of the truthful.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:19
item.description: That is so al-'Azeez will know that I did not betray him in [his] absence and that Allah does not guide the plan of betrayers.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:20
item.description: And thus We established Joseph in the land to settle therein wherever he willed. We touch with Our mercy whom We will, and We do not allow to be lost the reward of those who do good.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:21
item.description: And the reward of the Hereafter is better for those who believed and were fearing Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:22
item.description: And the brothers of Joseph came [seeking food], and they entered upon him; and he recognized them, but he was to them unknown.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:23
item.description: And when they opened their baggage, they found their merchandise returned to them. They said, "O our father, what [more] could we desire? This is our merchandise returned to us. And we will obtain supplies for our family and protect our brother and obtain an increase of a camel's load; that is an easy measurement."

item.title: Al-Quran-12:24
item.description: And when they entered from where their father had ordered them, it did not avail them against Allah at all except [it was] a need within the soul of Jacob, which he satisfied. And indeed, he was a possessor of knowledge because of what We had taught him, but most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:25
item.description: They said, "We are missing the measure of the king. And for he who produces it is [the reward of] a camel's load, and I am responsible for it."

item.title: Al-Quran-12:26
item.description: So he began [the search] with their bags before the bag of his brother; then he extracted it from the bag of his brother. Thus did We plan for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother within the religion of the king except that Allah willed. We raise in degrees whom We will, but over every possessor of knowledge is one [more] knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:27
item.description: They said, "O 'Azeez, indeed he has a father [who is] an old man, so take one of us in place of him. Indeed, we see you as a doer of good."

item.title: Al-Quran-12:28
item.description: So when they entered upon Joseph, they said, "O 'Azeez, adversity has touched us and our family, and we have come with goods poor in quality, but give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."

item.title: Al-Quran-12:29
item.description: That is from the news of the unseen which We reveal, [O Muhammad], to you. And you were not with them when they put together their plan while they conspired.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:30
item.description: And most of the people, although you strive [for it], are not believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:31
item.description: And you do not ask of them for it any payment. It is not except a reminder to the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:32
item.description: And how many a sign within the heavens and earth do they pass over while they, therefrom, are turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:33
item.description: And most of them believe not in Allah except while they associate others with Him.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:34
item.description: Then do they feel secure that there will not come to them an overwhelming [aspect] of the punishment of Allah or that the Hour will not come upon them suddenly while they do not perceive?

item.title: Al-Quran-12:35
item.description: And We sent not before you [as messengers] except men to whom We revealed from among the people of cities. So have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? And the home of the Hereafter is best for those who fear Allah; then will you not reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-12:36
item.description: [They continued] until, when the messengers despaired and were certain that they had been denied, there came to them Our victory, and whoever We willed was saved. And Our punishment cannot be repelled from the people who are criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-12:37
item.description: There was certainly in their stories a lesson for those of understanding. Never was the Qur'an a narration invented, but a confirmation of what was before it and a detailed explanation of all things and guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Meem, Ra. These are the verses of the Book; and what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, but most of the people do not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:2
item.description: It is Allah who erected the heavens without pillars that you [can] see; then He established Himself above the Throne and made subject the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. He arranges [each] matter; He details the signs that you may, of the meeting with your Lord, be certain.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:3
item.description: And it is He who spread the earth and placed therein firmly set mountains and rivers; and from all of the fruits He made therein two mates; He causes the night to cover the day. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:4
item.description: And within the land are neighboring plots and gardens of grapevines and crops and palm trees, [growing] several from a root or otherwise, watered with one water; but We make some of them exceed others in [quality of] fruit. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:5
item.description: They impatiently urge you to bring about evil before good, while there has already occurred before them similar punishments [to what they demand]. And indeed, your Lord is full of forgiveness for the people despite their wrongdoing, and indeed, your Lord is severe in penalty.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:6
item.description: Allah knows what every female carries and what the wombs lose [prematurely] or exceed. And everything with Him is by due measure.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:7
item.description: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Grand, the Exalted.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:8
item.description: It is the same [to Him] concerning you whether one conceals [his] speech or one publicizes it and whether one is hidden by night or conspicuous [among others] by day.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:9
item.description: For each one are successive [angels] before and behind him who protect him by the decree of Allah. Indeed, Allah will not change the condition of a people until they change what is in themselves. And when Allah intends for a people ill, there is no repelling it. And there is not for them besides Him any patron.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:10
item.description: It is He who shows you lightening, [causing] fear and aspiration, and generates the heavy clouds.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:11
item.description: And the thunder exalts [Allah] with praise of Him - and the angels [as well] from fear of Him - and He sends thunderbolts and strikes therewith whom He wills while they dispute about Allah; and He is severe in assault.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:12
item.description: To Him [alone] is the supplication of truth. And those they call upon besides Him do not respond to them with a thing, except as one who stretches his hands toward water [from afar, calling it] to reach his mouth, but it will not reach it [thus]. And the supplication of the disbelievers is not but in error [i.e. futility].

item.title: Al-Quran-13:13
item.description: And to Allah prostrates whoever is within the heavens and the earth, willingly or by compulsion, and their shadows [as well] in the mornings and the afternoons.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:14
item.description: He sends down from the sky, rain, and valleys flow according to their capacity, and the torrent carries a rising foam. And from that [ore] which they heat in the fire, desiring adornments and utensils, is a foam like it. Thus Allah presents [the example of] truth and falsehood. As for the foam, it vanishes, [being] cast off; but as for that which benefits the people, it remains on the earth. Thus does Allah present examples.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:15
item.description: For those who have responded to their Lord is the best [reward], but those who did not respond to Him - if they had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby. Those will have the worst account, and their refuge is Hell, and wretched is the resting place.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:16
item.description: Then is he who knows that what has been revealed to you from your Lord is the truth like one who is blind? They will only be reminded who are people of understanding -

item.title: Al-Quran-13:17
item.description: Those who fulfill the covenant of Allah and do not break the contract,

item.title: Al-Quran-13:18
item.description: And those who join that which Allah has ordered to be joined and fear their Lord and are afraid of the evil of [their] account,

item.title: Al-Quran-13:19
item.description: And those who are patient, seeking the countenance of their Lord, and establish prayer and spend from what We have provided for them secretly and publicly and prevent evil with good - those will have the good consequence of [this] home -

item.title: Al-Quran-13:20
item.description: Gardens of perpetual residence; they will enter them with whoever were righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their descendants. And the angels will enter upon them from every gate, [saying],

item.title: Al-Quran-13:21
item.description: But those who break the covenant of Allah after contracting it and sever that which Allah has ordered to be joined and spread corruption on earth - for them is the curse, and they will have the worst home.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:22
item.description: Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. And they rejoice in the worldly life, while the worldly life is not, compared to the Hereafter, except [brief] enjoyment.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:23
item.description: Those who have believed and done righteous deeds - a good state is theirs and a good return.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:24
item.description: And if there was any qur'an by which the mountains would be removed or the earth would be broken apart or the dead would be made to speak, [it would be this Qur'an], but to Allah belongs the affair entirely. Then have those who believed not accepted that had Allah willed, He would have guided the people, all of them? And those who disbelieve do not cease to be struck, for what they have done, by calamity - or it will descend near their home - until there comes the promise of Allah. Indeed, Allah does not fail in [His] promise.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:25
item.description: And already were [other] messengers ridiculed before you, and I extended the time of those who disbelieved; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My penalty.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:26
item.description: For them will be punishment in the life of [this] world, and the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe. And they will not have from Allah any protector.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:27
item.description: The example of Paradise, which the righteous have been promised, is [that] beneath it rivers flow. Its fruit is lasting, and its shade. That is the consequence for the righteous, and the consequence for the disbelievers is the Fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:28
item.description: And thus We have revealed it as an Arabic legislation. And if you should follow their inclinations after what has come to you of knowledge, you would not have against Allah any ally or any protector.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:29
item.description: And We have already sent messengers before you and assigned to them wives and descendants. And it was not for a messenger to come with a sign except by permission of Allah. For every term is a decree.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:30
item.description: Allah eliminates what He wills or confirms, and with Him is the Mother of the Book.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:31
item.description: And whether We show you part of what We promise them or take you in death, upon you is only the [duty of] notification, and upon Us is the account.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:32
item.description: Have they not seen that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? And Allah decides; there is no adjuster of His decision. And He is swift in account.

item.title: Al-Quran-13:33
item.description: And those before them had plotted, but to Allah belongs the plan entirely. He knows what every soul earns, and the disbelievers will know for whom is the final home.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Ra. [This is] a Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that you might bring mankind out of darknesses into the light by permission of their Lord - to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy -

item.title: Al-Quran-14:2
item.description: Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. And woe to the disbelievers from a severe punishment

item.title: Al-Quran-14:3
item.description: The ones who prefer the worldly life over the Hereafter and avert [people] from the way of Allah, seeking to make it (seem) deviant. Those are in extreme error.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:4
item.description: And We did not send any messenger except [speaking] in the language of his people to state clearly for them, and Allah sends astray [thereby] whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:5
item.description: And [remember] when your Lord proclaimed, 'If you are grateful, I will surely increase you [in favor]; but if you deny, indeed, My punishment is severe.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-14:6
item.description: Has there not reached you the news of those before you - the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud and those after them? No one knows them but Allah. Their messengers brought them clear proofs, but they returned their hands to their mouths and said, "Indeed, we disbelieve in that with which you have been sent, and indeed we are, about that to which you invite us, in disquieting doubt."

item.title: Al-Quran-14:7
item.description: And they requested victory from Allah, and disappointed, [therefore], was every obstinate tyrant.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:8
item.description: Before him is Hell, and he will be given a drink of purulent water.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:9
item.description: He will gulp it but will hardly [be able to] swallow it. And death will come to him from everywhere, but he is not to die. And before him is a massive punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:10
item.description: The example of those who disbelieve in their Lord is [that] their deeds are like ashes which the wind blows forcefully on a stormy day; they are unable [to keep] from what they earned a [single] thing. That is what is extreme error.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:11
item.description: Have you not seen that Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth? If He wills, He can do away with you and produce a new creation.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:12
item.description: And that is not difficult for Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:13
item.description: Have you not considered how Allah presents an example, [making] a good word like a good tree, whose root is firmly fixed and its branches [high] in the sky?

item.title: Al-Quran-14:14
item.description: It produces its fruit all the time, by permission of its Lord. And Allah presents examples for the people that perhaps they will be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:15
item.description: And the example of a bad word is like a bad tree, uprooted from the surface of the earth, not having any stability.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:16
item.description: Allah keeps firm those who believe, with the firm word, in worldly life and in the Hereafter. And Allah sends astray the wrongdoers. And Allah does what He wills.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:17
item.description: Have you not considered those who exchanged the favor of Allah for disbelief and settled their people [in] the home of ruin?

item.title: Al-Quran-14:18
item.description: [It is] Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the settlement.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:19
item.description: [O Muhammad], tell My servants who have believed to establish prayer and spend from what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, before a Day comes in which there will be no exchange, nor any friendships.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:20
item.description: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and sent down rain from the sky and produced thereby some fruits as provision for you and subjected for you the ships to sail through the sea by His command and subjected for you the rivers.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:21
item.description: And He subjected for you the sun and the moon, continuous [in orbit], and subjected for you the night and the day.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:22
item.description: And He gave you from all you asked of Him. And if you should count the favor of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, mankind is [generally] most unjust and ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:23
item.description: My Lord, indeed they have led astray many among the people. So whoever follows me - then he is of me; and whoever disobeys me - indeed, You are [yet] Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:24
item.description: Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in an uncultivated valley near Your sacred House, our Lord, that they may establish prayer. So make hearts among the people incline toward them and provide for them from the fruits that they might be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:25
item.description: Our Lord, indeed You know what we conceal and what we declare, and nothing is hidden from Allah on the earth or in the heaven.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:26
item.description: Praise to Allah, who has granted to me in old age Ishmael and Isaac. Indeed, my Lord is the Hearer of supplication.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:27
item.description: My Lord, make me an establisher of prayer, and [many] from my descendants. Our Lord, and accept my supplication.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:28
item.description: And never think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. He only delays them for a Day when eyes will stare [in horror].

item.title: Al-Quran-14:29
item.description: Racing ahead, their heads raised up, their glance does not come back to them, and their hearts are void.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:30
item.description: And they had planned their plan, but with Allah is [recorded] their plan, even if their plan had been [sufficient] to do away with the mountains.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:31
item.description: So never think that Allah will fail in His promise to His messengers. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:32
item.description: [It will be] on the Day the earth will be replaced by another earth, and the heavens [as well], and all creatures will come out before Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:33
item.description: And you will see the criminals that Day bound together in shackles,

item.title: Al-Quran-14:34
item.description: Their garments of liquid pitch and their faces covered by the Fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:35
item.description: So that Allah will recompense every soul for what it earned. Indeed, Allah is swift in account.

item.title: Al-Quran-14:36
item.description: This [Qur'an] is notification for the people that they may be warned thereby and that they may know that He is but one God and that those of understanding will be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:2
item.description: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:3
item.description: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:4
item.description: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:5
item.description: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:6
item.description: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:7
item.description: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:8
item.description: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:9
item.description: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:10
item.description: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:11
item.description: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:12
item.description: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

item.title: Al-Quran-15:13
item.description: And We have placed within the heaven great stars and have beautified it for the observers.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:14
item.description: And We have protected it from every devil expelled [from the mercy of Allah]

item.title: Al-Quran-15:15
item.description: Except one who steals a hearing and is pursued by a clear burning flame.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:16
item.description: And the earth - We have spread it and cast therein firmly set mountains and caused to grow therein [something] of every well-balanced thing.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:17
item.description: And We have made for you therein means of living and [for] those for whom you are not providers.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:18
item.description: And there is not a thing but that with Us are its depositories, and We do not send it down except according to a known measure.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:19
item.description: And We have sent the fertilizing winds and sent down water from the sky and given you drink from it. And you are not its retainers.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:20
item.description: And indeed, it is We who give life and cause death, and We are the Inheritor.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:21
item.description: And We have already known the preceding [generations] among you, and We have already known the later [ones to come].

item.title: Al-Quran-15:22
item.description: And indeed, your Lord will gather them; indeed, He is Wise and Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:23
item.description: And We did certainly create man out of clay from an altered black mud.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:24
item.description: And the jinn We created before from scorching fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:25
item.description: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely,

item.title: Al-Quran-15:26
item.description: Except Iblees, he refused to be with those who prostrated.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:27
item.description: Indeed, My servants - no authority will you have over them, except those who follow you of the deviators.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:28
item.description: And indeed, Hell is the promised place for them all.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:29
item.description: Indeed, the righteous will be within gardens and springs.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:30
item.description: And We will remove whatever is in their breasts of resentment, [so they will be] brothers, on thrones facing each other.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:31
item.description: No fatigue will touch them therein, nor from it will they [ever] be removed.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:32
item.description: [O Muhammad], inform My servants that it is I who am the Forgiving, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:33
item.description: And that it is My punishment which is the painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:34
item.description: And inform them about the guests of Abraham,

item.title: Al-Quran-15:35
item.description: Except the family of Lot; indeed, we will save them all

item.title: Al-Quran-15:36
item.description: And when the messengers came to the family of Lot,

item.title: Al-Quran-15:37
item.description: And we have come to you with truth, and indeed, we are truthful.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:38
item.description: And We conveyed to him [the decree] of that matter: that those [sinners] would be eliminated by early morning.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:39
item.description: And the people of the city came rejoicing.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:40
item.description: By your life, [O Muhammad], indeed they were, in their intoxication, wandering blindly.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:41
item.description: So the shriek seized them at sunrise.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:42
item.description: And We made the highest part [of the city] its lowest and rained upon them stones of hard clay.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:43
item.description: Indeed in that are signs for those who discern.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:44
item.description: And indeed, those cities are [situated] on an established road.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:45
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:46
item.description: And the companions of the thicket were [also] wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:47
item.description: So We took retribution from them, and indeed, both [cities] are on a clear highway.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:48
item.description: And certainly did the companions of Thamud deny the messengers.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:49
item.description: And We gave them Our signs, but from them they were turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:50
item.description: And they used to carve from the mountains, houses, feeling secure.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:51
item.description: But the shriek seized them at early morning.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:52
item.description: So nothing availed them [from] what they used to earn.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:53
item.description: And We have not created the heavens and earth and that between them except in truth. And indeed, the Hour is coming; so forgive with gracious forgiveness.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:54
item.description: Indeed, your Lord - He is the Knowing Creator.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:55
item.description: And We have certainly given you, [O Muhammad], seven of the often repeated [verses] and the great Qur'an.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:56
item.description: Do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [certain] categories of the disbelievers, and do not grieve over them. And lower your wing to the believers

item.title: Al-Quran-15:57
item.description: Just as We had revealed [scriptures] to the separators

item.title: Al-Quran-15:58
item.description: Who have made the Qur'an into portions.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:59
item.description: So by your Lord, We will surely question them all

item.title: Al-Quran-15:60
item.description: About what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:61
item.description: Then declare what you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:62
item.description: Indeed, We are sufficient for you against the mockers

item.title: Al-Quran-15:63
item.description: Who make [equal] with Allah another deity. But they are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:64
item.description: And We already know that your breast is constrained by what they say.

item.title: Al-Quran-15:65
item.description: So exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord and be of those who prostrate [to Him].

item.title: Al-Quran-15:66
item.description: And worship your Lord until there comes to you the certainty (death).

item.title: Al-Quran-16:1
item.description: The command of Allah is coming, so be not impatient for it. Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:2
item.description: He created the heavens and earth in truth. High is He above what they associate with Him.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:3
item.description: He created man from a sperm-drop; then at once, he is a clear adversary.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:4
item.description: And the grazing livestock He has created for you; in them is warmth and [numerous] benefits, and from them you eat.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:5
item.description: And for you in them is [the enjoyment of] beauty when you bring them in [for the evening] and when you send them out [to pasture].

item.title: Al-Quran-16:6
item.description: And they carry your loads to a land you could not have reached except with difficulty to yourselves. Indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:7
item.description: And [He created] the horses, mules and donkeys for you to ride and [as] adornment. And He creates that which you do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:8
item.description: And upon Allah is the direction of the [right] way, and among the various paths are those deviating. And if He willed, He could have guided you all.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:9
item.description: It is He who sends down rain from the sky; from it is drink and from it is foliage in which you pasture [animals].

item.title: Al-Quran-16:10
item.description: He causes to grow for you thereby the crops, olives, palm trees, grapevines, and from all the fruits. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who give thought.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:11
item.description: And He has subjected for you the night and day and the sun and moon, and the stars are subjected by His command. Indeed in that are signs for a people who reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:12
item.description: And [He has subjected] whatever He multiplied for you on the earth of varying colors. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who remember.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:13
item.description: And it is He who subjected the sea for you to eat from it tender meat and to extract from it ornaments which you wear. And you see the ships plowing through it, and [He subjected it] that you may seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:14
item.description: And He has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it shift with you, and [made] rivers and roads, that you may be guided,

item.title: Al-Quran-16:15
item.description: And landmarks. And by the stars they are [also] guided.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:16
item.description: Then is He who creates like one who does not create? So will you not be reminded?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:17
item.description: And if you should count the favors of Allah, you could not enumerate them. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:18
item.description: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you declare.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:19
item.description: And those they invoke other than Allah create nothing, and they [themselves] are created.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:20
item.description: They are, [in fact], dead, not alive, and they do not perceive when they will be resurrected.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:21
item.description: Your god is one God. But those who do not believe in the Hereafter - their hearts are disapproving, and they are arrogant.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:22
item.description: Assuredly, Allah knows what they conceal and what they declare. Indeed, He does not like the arrogant.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:23
item.description: That they may bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection and some of the burdens of those whom they misguide without knowledge. Unquestionably, evil is that which they bear.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:24
item.description: Those before them had already plotted, but Allah came at their building from the foundations, so the roof fell upon them from above them, and the punishment came to them from where they did not perceive.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:25
item.description: Then on the Day of Resurrection He will disgrace them and say, "Where are My 'partners' for whom you used to oppose [the believers]?" Those who were given knowledge will say, "Indeed disgrace, this Day, and evil are upon the disbelievers" -

item.title: Al-Quran-16:26
item.description: So enter the gates of Hell to abide eternally therein, and how wretched is the residence of the arrogant.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:27
item.description: Gardens of perpetual residence, which they will enter, beneath which rivers flow. They will have therein whatever they wish. Thus does Allah reward the righteous -

item.title: Al-Quran-16:28
item.description: Do the disbelievers await [anything] except that the angels should come to them or there comes the command of your Lord? Thus did those do before them. And Allah wronged them not, but they had been wronging themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:29
item.description: So they were struck by the evil consequences of what they did and were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:30
item.description: [Even] if you should strive for their guidance, [O Muhammad], indeed, Allah does not guide those He sends astray, and they will have no helpers.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:31
item.description: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths [that] Allah will not resurrect one who dies. But yes - [it is] a true promise [binding] upon Him, but most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:32
item.description: [It is] so He will make clear to them [the truth of] that wherein they differ and so those who have disbelieved may know that they were liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:33
item.description: And those who emigrated for [the cause of] Allah after they had been wronged - We will surely settle them in this world in a good place; but the reward of the Hereafter is greater, if only they could know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:34
item.description: [They are] those who endured patiently and upon their Lord relied.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:35
item.description: And We sent not before you except men to whom We revealed [Our message]. So ask the people of the message if you do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:36
item.description: [We sent them] with clear proofs and written ordinances. And We revealed to you the message that you may make clear to the people what was sent down to them and that they might give thought.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:37
item.description: Then, do those who have planned evil deeds feel secure that Allah will not cause the earth to swallow them or that the punishment will not come upon them from where they do not perceive?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:38
item.description: Or that He would not seize them during their [usual] activity, and they could not cause failure?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:39
item.description: Or that He would not seize them gradually [in a state of dread]? But indeed, your Lord is Kind and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:40
item.description: Have they not considered what things Allah has created? Their shadows incline to the right and to the left, prostrating to Allah, while they are humble.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:41
item.description: And to Allah prostrates whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth of creatures, and the angels [as well], and they are not arrogant.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:42
item.description: They fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:43
item.description: And to Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him is [due] worship constantly. Then is it other than Allah that you fear?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:44
item.description: And whatever you have of favor - it is from Allah. Then when adversity touches you, to Him you cry for help.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:45
item.description: Then when He removes the adversity from you, at once a party of you associates others with their Lord

item.title: Al-Quran-16:46
item.description: So they will deny what We have given them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:47
item.description: And they assign to what they do not know a portion of that which We have provided them. By Allah, you will surely be questioned about what you used to invent.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:48
item.description: And they attribute to Allah daughters - exalted is He - and for them is what they desire.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:49
item.description: And when one of them is informed of [the birth of] a female, his face becomes dark, and he suppresses grief.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:50
item.description: He hides himself from the people because of the ill of which he has been informed. Should he keep it in humiliation or bury it in the ground? Unquestionably, evil is what they decide.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:51
item.description: For those who do not believe in the Hereafter is the description of evil; and for Allah is the highest attribute. And He is Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:52
item.description: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for their wrongdoing, He would not have left upon the earth any creature, but He defers them for a specified term. And when their term has come, they will not remain behind an hour, nor will they precede [it].

item.title: Al-Quran-16:53
item.description: And they attribute to Allah that which they dislike, and their tongues assert the lie that they will have the best [from Him]. Assuredly, they will have the Fire, and they will be [therein] neglected.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:54
item.description: By Allah, We did certainly send [messengers] to nations before you, but Satan made their deeds attractive to them. And he is the disbelievers' ally today [as well], and they will have a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:55
item.description: And We have not revealed to you the Book, [O Muhammad], except for you to make clear to them that wherein they have differed and as guidance and mercy for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:56
item.description: And Allah has sent down rain from the sky and given life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who listen.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:57
item.description: And indeed, for you in grazing livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from what is in their bellies - between excretion and blood - pure milk, palatable to drinkers.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:58
item.description: And from the fruits of the palm trees and grapevines you take intoxicant and good provision. Indeed in that is a sign for a people who reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:59
item.description: And Allah created you; then He will take you in death. And among you is he who is reversed to the most decrepit [old] age so that he will not know, after [having had] knowledge, a thing. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:60
item.description: And Allah has favored some of you over others in provision. But those who were favored would not hand over their provision to those whom their right hands possess so they would be equal to them therein. Then is it the favor of Allah they reject?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:61
item.description: And Allah has made for you from yourselves mates and has made for you from your mates sons and grandchildren and has provided for you from the good things. Then in falsehood do they believe and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:62
item.description: And they worship besides Allah that which does not possess for them [the power of] provision from the heavens and the earth at all, and [in fact], they are unable.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:63
item.description: So do not assert similarities to Allah. Indeed, Allah knows and you do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:64
item.description: Allah presents an example: a slave [who is] owned and unable to do a thing and he to whom We have provided from Us good provision, so he spends from it secretly and publicly. Can they be equal? Praise to Allah! But most of them do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:65
item.description: And Allah presents an example of two men, one of them dumb and unable to do a thing, while he is a burden to his guardian. Wherever he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, while he is on a straight path?

item.title: Al-Quran-16:66
item.description: And to Allah belongs the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and the earth. And the command for the Hour is not but as a glance of the eye or even nearer. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:67
item.description: And Allah has extracted you from the wombs of your mothers not knowing a thing, and He made for you hearing and vision and intellect that perhaps you would be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:68
item.description: Do they not see the birds controlled in the atmosphere of the sky? None holds them up except Allah. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:69
item.description: And Allah has made for you from your homes a place of rest and made for you from the hides of the animals tents which you find light on your day of travel and your day of encampment; and from their wool, fur and hair is furnishing and enjoyment for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:70
item.description: And Allah has made for you, from that which He has created, shadows and has made for you from the mountains, shelters and has made for you garments which protect you from the heat and garments which protect you from your [enemy in] battle. Thus does He complete His favor upon you that you might submit [to Him].

item.title: Al-Quran-16:71
item.description: But if they turn away, [O Muhammad] - then only upon you is [responsibility for] clear notification.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:72
item.description: They recognize the favor of Allah; then they deny it. And most of them are disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:73
item.description: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect from every nation a witness. Then it will not be permitted to the disbelievers [to apologize or make excuses], nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-16:74
item.description: And when those who wronged see the punishment, it will not be lightened for them, nor will they be reprieved.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:75
item.description: And they will impart to Allah that Day [their] submission, and lost from them is what they used to invent.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:76
item.description: Those who disbelieved and averted [others] from the way of Allah - We will increase them in punishment over [their] punishment for what corruption they were causing.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:77
item.description: And [mention] the Day when We will resurrect among every nation a witness over them from themselves. And We will bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over your nation. And We have sent down to you the Book as clarification for all things and as guidance and mercy and good tidings for the Muslims.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:78
item.description: Indeed, Allah orders justice and good conduct and giving to relatives and forbids immorality and bad conduct and oppression. He admonishes you that perhaps you will be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:79
item.description: And fulfill the covenant of Allah when you have taken it, [O believers], and do not break oaths after their confirmation while you have made Allah, over you, a witness. Indeed, Allah knows what you do.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:80
item.description: And do not be like she who untwisted her spun thread after it was strong [by] taking your oaths as [means of] deceit between you because one community is more plentiful [in number or wealth] than another community. Allah only tries you thereby. And He will surely make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection that over which you used to differ.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:81
item.description: And if Allah had willed, He could have made you [of] one religion, but He causes to stray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. And you will surely be questioned about what you used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:82
item.description: And do not take your oaths as [means of] deceit between you, lest a foot slip after it was [once] firm, and you would taste evil [in this world] for what [people] you diverted from the way of Allah, and you would have [in the Hereafter] a great punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:83
item.description: And do not exchange the covenant of Allah for a small price. Indeed, what is with Allah is best for you, if only you could know.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:84
item.description: Whatever you have will end, but what Allah has is lasting. And We will surely give those who were patient their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:85
item.description: Whoever does righteousness, whether male or female, while he is a believer - We will surely cause him to live a good life, and We will surely give them their reward [in the Hereafter] according to the best of what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:86
item.description: So when you recite the Qur'an, [first] seek refuge in Allah from Satan, the expelled [from His mercy].

item.title: Al-Quran-16:87
item.description: Indeed, there is for him no authority over those who have believed and rely upon their Lord.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:88
item.description: His authority is only over those who take him as an ally and those who through him associate others with Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:89
item.description: And We certainly know that they say, "It is only a human being who teaches the Prophet." The tongue of the one they refer to is foreign, and this Qur'an is [in] a clear Arabic language.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:90
item.description: Indeed, those who do not believe in the verses of Allah - Allah will not guide them, and for them is a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:91
item.description: They only invent falsehood who do not believe in the verses of Allah, and it is those who are the liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:92
item.description: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after his belief... except for one who is forced [to renounce his religion] while his heart is secure in faith. But those who [willingly] open their breasts to disbelief, upon them is wrath from Allah, and for them is a great punishment;

item.title: Al-Quran-16:93
item.description: That is because they preferred the worldly life over the Hereafter and that Allah does not guide the disbelieving people.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:94
item.description: Those are the ones over whose hearts and hearing and vision Allah has sealed, and it is those who are the heedless.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:95
item.description: Assuredly, it is they, in the Hereafter, who will be the losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:96
item.description: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who emigrated after they had been compelled [to renounce their religion] and thereafter fought [for the cause of Allah] and were patient - indeed, your Lord, after that, is Forgiving and Merciful

item.title: Al-Quran-16:97
item.description: On the Day when every soul will come disputing for itself, and every soul will be fully compensated for what it did, and they will not be wronged.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:98
item.description: And Allah presents an example: a city which was safe and secure, its provision coming to it in abundance from every location, but it denied the favors of Allah. So Allah made it taste the envelopment of hunger and fear for what they had been doing.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:99
item.description: And there had certainly come to them a Messenger from among themselves, but they denied him; so punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:100
item.description: Then eat of what Allah has provided for you [which is] lawful and good. And be grateful for the favor of Allah, if it is [indeed] Him that you worship.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:101
item.description: He has only forbidden to you dead animals, blood, the flesh of swine, and that which has been dedicated to other than Allah. But whoever is forced [by necessity], neither desiring [it] nor transgressing [its limit] - then indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:102
item.description: [It is but] a brief enjoyment, and they will have a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:103
item.description: And to those who are Jews We have prohibited that which We related to you before. And We did not wrong them [thereby], but they were wronging themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:104
item.description: Then, indeed your Lord, to those who have done wrong out of ignorance and then repent after that and correct themselves - indeed, your Lord, thereafter, is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:105
item.description: Indeed, Abraham was a [comprehensive] leader, devoutly obedient to Allah, inclining toward truth, and he was not of those who associate others with Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:106
item.description: [He was] grateful for His favors. Allah chose him and guided him to a straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:107
item.description: And We gave him good in this world, and indeed, in the Hereafter he will be among the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:108
item.description: Then We revealed to you, [O Muhammad], to follow the religion of Abraham, inclining toward truth; and he was not of those who associate with Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:109
item.description: The sabbath was only appointed for those who differed over it. And indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:110
item.description: Invite to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good instruction, and argue with them in a way that is best. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who has strayed from His way, and He is most knowing of who is [rightly] guided.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:111
item.description: And if you punish [an enemy, O believers], punish with an equivalent of that with which you were harmed. But if you are patient - it is better for those who are patient.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:112
item.description: And be patient, [O Muhammad], and your patience is not but through Allah. And do not grieve over them and do not be in distress over what they conspire.

item.title: Al-Quran-16:113
item.description: Indeed, Allah is with those who fear Him and those who are doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:1
