item.description: Exalted is He who took His Servant by night from al-Masjid al-Haram to al-Masjid al-Aqsa, whose surroundings We have blessed, to show him of Our signs. Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:2
item.description: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guidance for the Children of Israel that you not take other than Me as Disposer of affairs,

item.title: Al-Quran-17:3
item.description: O descendants of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah. Indeed, he was a grateful servant.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:4
item.description: So when the [time of] promise came for the first of them, We sent against you servants of Ours - those of great military might, and they probed [even] into the homes, and it was a promise fulfilled.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:5
item.description: Then We gave back to you a return victory over them. And We reinforced you with wealth and sons and made you more numerous in manpower

item.title: Al-Quran-17:6
item.description: Indeed, this Qur'an guides to that which is most suitable and gives good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a great reward.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:7
item.description: And that those who do not believe in the Hereafter - We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:8
item.description: And man supplicates for evil as he supplicates for good, and man is ever hasty.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:9
item.description: And We have made the night and day two signs, and We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible that you may seek bounty from your Lord and may know the number of years and the account [of time]. And everything We have set out in detail.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:10
item.description: And [for] every person We have imposed his fate upon his neck, and We will produce for him on the Day of Resurrection a record which he will encounter spread open.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:11
item.description: Whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul. And whoever errs only errs against it. And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And never would We punish until We sent a messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:12
item.description: And when We intend to destroy a city, We command its affluent but they defiantly disobey therein; so the word comes into effect upon it, and We destroy it with [complete] destruction.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:13
item.description: And how many have We destroyed from the generations after Noah. And sufficient is your Lord, concerning the sins of His servants, as Acquainted and Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:14
item.description: Whoever should desire the immediate - We hasten for him from it what We will to whom We intend. Then We have made for him Hell, which he will [enter to] burn, censured and banished.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:15
item.description: But whoever desires the Hereafter and exerts the effort due to it while he is a believer - it is those whose effort is ever appreciated [by Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-17:16
item.description: To each [category] We extend - to these and to those - from the gift of your Lord. And never has the gift of your Lord been restricted.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:17
item.description: Look how We have favored [in provision] some of them over others. But the Hereafter is greater in degrees [of difference] and greater in distinction.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:18
item.description: Do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity and [thereby] become censured and forsaken.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:19
item.description: Your Lord is most knowing of what is within yourselves. If you should be righteous [in intention] - then indeed He is ever, to the often returning [to Him], Forgiving.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:20
item.description: And give the relative his right, and [also] the poor and the traveler, and do not spend wastefully.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:21
item.description: Indeed, the wasteful are brothers of the devils, and ever has Satan been to his Lord ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:22
item.description: And if you [must] turn away from the needy awaiting mercy from your Lord which you expect, then speak to them a gentle word.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:23
item.description: And do not make your hand [as] chained to your neck or extend it completely and [thereby] become blamed and insolvent.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:24
item.description: Indeed, your Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]. Indeed He is ever, concerning His servants, Acquainted and Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:25
item.description: And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Indeed, their killing is ever a great sin.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:26
item.description: And do not approach unlawful sexual intercourse. Indeed, it is ever an immorality and is evil as a way.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:27
item.description: And do not kill the soul which Allah has forbidden, except by right. And whoever is killed unjustly - We have given his heir authority, but let him not exceed limits in [the matter of] taking life. Indeed, he has been supported [by the law].

item.title: Al-Quran-17:28
item.description: And do not approach the property of an orphan, except in the way that is best, until he reaches maturity. And fulfill [every] commitment. Indeed, the commitment is ever [that about which one will be] questioned.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:29
item.description: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is the best [way] and best in result.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:30
item.description: And do not pursue that of which you have no knowledge. Indeed, the hearing, the sight and the heart - about all those [one] will be questioned.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:31
item.description: And do not walk upon the earth exultantly. Indeed, you will never tear the earth [apart], and you will never reach the mountains in height.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:32
item.description: All that - its evil is ever, in the sight of your Lord, detested.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:33
item.description: That is from what your Lord has revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of wisdom. And, [O mankind], do not make [as equal] with Allah another deity, lest you be thrown into Hell, blamed and banished.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:34
item.description: Then, has your Lord chosen you for [having] sons and taken from among the angels daughters? Indeed, you say a grave saying.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:35
item.description: And We have certainly diversified [the contents] in this Qur'an that mankind may be reminded, but it does not increase the disbelievers except in aversion.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:36
item.description: Exalted is He and high above what they say by great sublimity.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:37
item.description: The seven heavens and the earth and whatever is in them exalt Him. And there is not a thing except that it exalts [Allah] by His praise, but you do not understand their [way of] exalting. Indeed, He is ever Forbearing and Forgiving.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:38
item.description: And when you recite the Qur'an, We put between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter a concealed partition.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:39
item.description: And We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Qur'an, they turn back in aversion.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:40
item.description: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:41
item.description: And tell My servants to say that which is best. Indeed, Satan induces [dissension] among them. Indeed Satan is ever, to mankind, a clear enemy.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:42
item.description: Your Lord is most knowing of you. If He wills, He will have mercy upon you; or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], over them as a manager.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:43
item.description: And your Lord is most knowing of whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And We have made some of the prophets exceed others [in various ways], and to David We gave the book [of Psalms].

item.title: Al-Quran-17:44
item.description: Those whom they invoke seek means of access to their Lord, [striving as to] which of them would be nearest, and they hope for His mercy and fear His punishment. Indeed, the punishment of your Lord is ever feared.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:45
item.description: And there is no city but that We will destroy it before the Day of Resurrection or punish it with a severe punishment. That has ever been in the Register inscribed.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:46
item.description: And nothing has prevented Us from sending signs except that the former peoples denied them. And We gave Thamud the she-camel as a visible sign, but they wronged her. And We send not the signs except as a warning.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:47
item.description: And [remember, O Muhammad], when We told you, "Indeed, your Lord has encompassed the people." And We did not make the sight which We showed you except as a trial for the people, as was the accursed tree [mentioned] in the Qur'an. And We threaten them, but it increases them not except in great transgression.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:48
item.description: Indeed, over My [believing] servants there is for you no authority. And sufficient is your Lord as Disposer of affairs.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:49
item.description: It is your Lord who drives the ship for you through the sea that you may seek of His bounty. Indeed, He is ever, to you, Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:50
item.description: And when adversity touches you at sea, lost are [all] those you invoke except for Him. But when He delivers you to the land, you turn away [from Him]. And ever is man ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:51
item.description: Then do you feel secure that [instead] He will not cause a part of the land to swallow you or send against you a storm of stones? Then you would not find for yourselves an advocate.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:52
item.description: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back into the sea another time and send upon you a hurricane of wind and drown you for what you denied? Then you would not find for yourselves against Us an avenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:53
item.description: And We have certainly honored the children of Adam and carried them on the land and sea and provided for them of the good things and preferred them over much of what We have created, with [definite] preference.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:54
item.description: [Mention, O Muhammad], the Day We will call forth every people with their record [of deeds]. Then whoever is given his record in his right hand - those will read their records, and injustice will not be done to them, [even] as much as a thread [inside the date seed].

item.title: Al-Quran-17:55
item.description: And whoever is blind in this [life] will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray in way.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:56
item.description: And indeed, they were about to tempt you away from that which We revealed to you in order to [make] you invent about Us something else; and then they would have taken you as a friend.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:57
item.description: And if We had not strengthened you, you would have almost inclined to them a little.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:58
item.description: Then [if you had], We would have made you taste double [punishment in] life and double [after] death. Then you would not find for yourself against Us a helper.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:59
item.description: And indeed, they were about to drive you from the land to evict you therefrom. And then [when they do], they will not remain [there] after you, except for a little.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:60
item.description: [That is Our] established way for those We had sent before you of Our messengers; and you will not find in Our way any alteration.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:61
item.description: Establish prayer at the decline of the sun [from its meridian] until the darkness of the night and [also] the Qur'an of dawn. Indeed, the recitation of dawn is ever witnessed.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:62
item.description: And from [part of] the night, pray with it as additional [worship] for you; it is expected that your Lord will resurrect you to a praised station.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:63
item.description: And We send down of the Qur'an that which is healing and mercy for the believers, but it does not increase the wrongdoers except in loss.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:64
item.description: And when We bestow favor upon the disbeliever, he turns away and distances himself; and when evil touches him, he is ever despairing.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:65
item.description: And if We willed, We could surely do away with that which We revealed to you. Then you would not find for yourself concerning it an advocate against Us.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:66
item.description: Except [We have left it with you] as a mercy from your Lord. Indeed, His favor upon you has ever been great.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:67
item.description: Say, "If mankind and the jinn gathered in order to produce the like of this Qur'an, they could not produce the like of it, even if they were to each other assistants."

item.title: Al-Quran-17:68
item.description: And We have certainly diversified for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind] of example, but most of the people refused [anything] except disbelief.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:69
item.description: Or [until] you have a garden of palm tress and grapes and make rivers gush forth within them in force [and abundance]

item.title: Al-Quran-17:70
item.description: Or you make the heaven fall upon us in fragments as you have claimed or you bring Allah and the angels before [us]

item.title: Al-Quran-17:71
item.description: And whoever Allah guides - he is the [rightly] guided; and whoever He sends astray - you will never find for them protectors besides Him, and We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection [fallen] on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf. Their refuge is Hell; every time it subsides We increase them in blazing fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:72
item.description: Do they not see that Allah, who created the heavens and earth, is [the one] Able to create the likes of them? And He has appointed for them a term, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers refuse [anything] except disbelief.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:73
item.description: So he intended to drive them from the land, but We drowned him and those with him all together.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:74
item.description: And with the truth We have sent the Qur'an down, and with the truth it has descended. And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:75
item.description: And [it is] a Qur'an which We have separated [by intervals] that you might recite it to the people over a prolonged period. And We have sent it down progressively.

item.title: Al-Quran-17:76
item.description: And they fall upon their faces weeping, and the Qur'an increases them in humble submission.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:1
item.description: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, who has sent down upon His Servant the Book and has not made therein any deviance.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:2
item.description: [He has made it] straight, to warn of severe punishment from Him and to give good tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds that they will have a good reward

item.title: Al-Quran-18:3
item.description: In which they will remain forever

item.title: Al-Quran-18:4
item.description: They have no knowledge of it, nor had their fathers. Grave is the word that comes out of their mouths; they speak not except a lie.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:5
item.description: Then perhaps you would kill yourself through grief over them, [O Muhammad], if they do not believe in this message, [and] out of sorrow.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:6
item.description: Indeed, We have made that which is on the earth adornment for it that We may test them [as to] which of them is best in deed.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:7
item.description: And indeed, We will make that which is upon it [into] a barren ground.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:8
item.description: Or have you thought that the companions of the cave and the inscription were, among Our signs, a wonder?

item.title: Al-Quran-18:9
item.description: So We cast [a cover of sleep] over their ears within the cave for a number of years.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:10
item.description: Then We awakened them that We might show which of the two factions was most precise in calculating what [extent] they had remained in time.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:11
item.description: It is We who relate to you, [O Muhammad], their story in truth. Indeed, they were youths who believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:12
item.description: And [had you been present], you would see the sun when it rose, inclining away from their cave on the right, and when it set, passing away from them on the left, while they were [laying] within an open space thereof. That was from the signs of Allah. He whom Allah guides is the [rightly] guided, but he whom He leaves astray - never will you find for him a protecting guide.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:13
item.description: And you would think them awake, while they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. If you had looked at them, you would have turned from them in flight and been filled by them with terror.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:14
item.description: And they remained in their cave for three hundred years and exceeded by nine.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:15
item.description: And recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book of your Lord. There is no changer of His words, and never will you find in other than Him a refuge.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:16
item.description: And keep yourself patient [by being] with those who call upon their Lord in the morning and the evening, seeking His countenance. And let not your eyes pass beyond them, desiring adornments of the worldly life, and do not obey one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance and who follows his desire and whose affair is ever [in] neglect.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:17
item.description: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - indeed, We will not allow to be lost the reward of any who did well in deeds.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:18
item.description: Those will have gardens of perpetual residence; beneath them rivers will flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade, reclining therein on adorned couches. Excellent is the reward, and good is the resting place.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:19
item.description: And present to them an example of two men: We granted to one of them two gardens of grapevines, and We bordered them with palm trees and placed between them [fields of] crops.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:20
item.description: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:21
item.description: But as for me, He is Allah, my Lord, and I do not associate with my Lord anyone.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:22
item.description: And why did you, when you entered your garden, not say, 'What Allah willed [has occurred]; there is no power except in Allah '? Although you see me less than you in wealth and children,

item.title: Al-Quran-18:23
item.description: It may be that my Lord will give me [something] better than your garden and will send upon it a calamity from the sky, and it will become a smooth, dusty ground,

item.title: Al-Quran-18:24
item.description: And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:25
item.description: There the authority is [completely] for Allah, the Truth. He is best in reward and best in outcome.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:26
item.description: And present to them the example of the life of this world, [its being] like rain which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it and [then] it becomes dry remnants, scattered by the winds. And Allah is ever, over all things, Perfect in Ability.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:27
item.description: Wealth and children are [but] adornment of the worldly life. But the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for [one's] hope.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:28
item.description: And [warn of] the Day when We will remove the mountains and you will see the earth prominent, and We will gather them and not leave behind from them anyone.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:29
item.description: I did not make them witness to the creation of the heavens and the earth or to the creation of themselves, and I would not have taken the misguiders as assistants.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:30
item.description: And [warn of] the Day when He will say, "Call 'My partners' whom you claimed," and they will invoke them, but they will not respond to them. And We will put between them [a valley of] destruction.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:31
item.description: And the criminals will see the Fire and will be certain that they are to fall therein. And they will not find from it a way elsewhere.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:32
item.description: And We have certainly diversified in this Qur'an for the people from every [kind of] example; but man has ever been, most of anything, [prone to] dispute.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:33
item.description: And nothing has prevented the people from believing when guidance came to them and from asking forgiveness of their Lord except that there [must] befall them the [accustomed] precedent of the former peoples or that the punishment should come [directly] before them.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:34
item.description: And We send not the messengers except as bringers of good tidings and warners. And those who disbelieve dispute by [using] falsehood to [attempt to] invalidate thereby the truth and have taken My verses, and that of which they are warned, in ridicule.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:35
item.description: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord but turns away from them and forgets what his hands have put forth? Indeed, We have placed over their hearts coverings, lest they understand it, and in their ears deafness. And if you invite them to guidance - they will never be guided, then - ever.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:36
item.description: And your Lord is the Forgiving, full of mercy. If He were to impose blame upon them for what they earned, He would have hastened for them the punishment. Rather, for them is an appointment from which they will never find an escape.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:37
item.description: And those cities - We destroyed them when they wronged, and We made for their destruction an appointed time.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:38
item.description: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot their fish, and it took its course into the sea, slipping away.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:39
item.description: And they found a servant from among Our servants to whom we had given mercy from us and had taught him from Us a [certain] knowledge.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:40
item.description: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working at sea. So I intended to cause defect in it as there was after them a king who seized every [good] ship by force.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:41
item.description: And as for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared that he would overburden them by transgression and disbelief.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:42
item.description: So we intended that their Lord should substitute for them one better than him in purity and nearer to mercy.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:43
item.description: Indeed We established him upon the earth, and We gave him to everything a way.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:44
item.description: So he followed a way

item.title: Al-Quran-18:45
item.description: Then he followed a way

item.title: Al-Quran-18:46
item.description: Until, when he came to the rising of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not made against it any shield.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:47
item.description: Thus. And We had encompassed [all] that he had in knowledge.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:48
item.description: Then he followed a way

item.title: Al-Quran-18:49
item.description: Until, when he reached [a pass] between two mountains, he found beside them a people who could hardly understand [his] speech.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:50
item.description: So Gog and Magog were unable to pass over it, nor were they able [to effect] in it any penetration.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:51
item.description: And We will leave them that day surging over each other, and [then] the Horn will be blown, and We will assemble them in [one] assembly.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:52
item.description: And We will present Hell that Day to the Disbelievers, on display -

item.title: Al-Quran-18:53
item.description: Those whose eyes had been within a cover [removed] from My remembrance, and they were not able to hear.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:54
item.description: Then do those who disbelieve think that they can take My servants instead of Me as allies? Indeed, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers as a lodging.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:55
item.description: Those are the ones who disbelieve in the verses of their Lord and in [their] meeting Him, so their deeds have become worthless; and We will not assign to them on the Day of Resurrection any importance.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:56
item.description: That is their recompense - Hell - for what they denied and [because] they took My signs and My messengers in ridicule.

item.title: Al-Quran-18:57
item.description: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - they will have the Gardens of Paradise as a lodging,

item.title: Al-Quran-18:58
item.description: Wherein they abide eternally. They will not desire from it any transfer.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:1
item.description: Kaf, Ha, Ya, 'Ayn, Sad.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:2
item.description: [This is] a mention of the mercy of your Lord to His servant Zechariah

item.title: Al-Quran-19:3
item.description: When he called to his Lord a private supplication.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:4
item.description: And indeed, I fear the successors after me, and my wife has been barren, so give me from Yourself an heir

item.title: Al-Quran-19:5
item.description: [An angel] said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, for I created you before, while you were nothing.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-19:6
item.description: So he came out to his people from the prayer chamber and signaled to them to exalt [Allah] in the morning and afternoon.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:7
item.description: And affection from Us and purity, and he was fearing of Allah

item.title: Al-Quran-19:8
item.description: And dutiful to his parents, and he was not a disobedient tyrant.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:9
item.description: And peace be upon him the day he was born and the day he dies and the day he is raised alive.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:10
item.description: And mention, [O Muhammad], in the Book [the story of] Mary, when she withdrew from her family to a place toward the east.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:11
item.description: And she took, in seclusion from them, a screen. Then We sent to her Our Angel, and he represented himself to her as a well-proportioned man.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:12
item.description: He said, "Thus [it will be]; your Lord says, 'It is easy for Me, and We will make him a sign to the people and a mercy from Us. And it is a matter [already] decreed.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-19:13
item.description: So she conceived him, and she withdrew with him to a remote place.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:14
item.description: And shake toward you the trunk of the palm tree; it will drop upon you ripe, fresh dates.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:15
item.description: So eat and drink and be contented. And if you see from among humanity anyone, say, 'Indeed, I have vowed to the Most Merciful abstention, so I will not speak today to [any] man.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-19:16
item.description: And He has made me blessed wherever I am and has enjoined upon me prayer and zakah as long as I remain alive

item.title: Al-Quran-19:17
item.description: And [made me] dutiful to my mother, and He has not made me a wretched tyrant.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:18
item.description: That is Jesus, the son of Mary - the word of truth about which they are in dispute.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:19
item.description: Then the factions differed [concerning Jesus] from among them, so woe to those who disbelieved - from the scene of a tremendous Day.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:20
item.description: How [clearly] they will hear and see the Day they come to Us, but the wrongdoers today are in clear error.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:21
item.description: And warn them, [O Muhammad], of the Day of Regret, when the matter will be concluded; and [yet], they are in [a state of] heedlessness, and they do not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:22
item.description: Indeed, it is We who will inherit the earth and whoever is on it, and to Us they will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:23
item.description: And mention in the Book [the story of] Abraham. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:24
item.description: O my father, indeed there has come to me of knowledge that which has not come to you, so follow me; I will guide you to an even path.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:25
item.description: O my father, do not worship Satan. Indeed Satan has ever been, to the Most Merciful, disobedient.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:26
item.description: So when he had left them and those they worshipped other than Allah, We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and each [of them] We made a prophet.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:27
item.description: And We gave them of Our mercy, and we made for them a reputation of high honor.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:28
item.description: And mention in the Book, Moses. Indeed, he was chosen, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:29
item.description: And We called him from the side of the mount at [his] right and brought him near, confiding [to him].

item.title: Al-Quran-19:30
item.description: And We gave him out of Our mercy his brother Aaron as a prophet.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:31
item.description: And mention in the Book, Ishmael. Indeed, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger and a prophet.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:32
item.description: And he used to enjoin on his people prayer and zakah and was to his Lord pleasing.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:33
item.description: And mention in the Book, Idrees. Indeed, he was a man of truth and a prophet.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:34
item.description: And We raised him to a high station.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:35
item.description: Those were the ones upon whom Allah bestowed favor from among the prophets of the descendants of Adam and of those We carried [in the ship] with Noah, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those whom We guided and chose. When the verses of the Most Merciful were recited to them, they fell in prostration and weeping.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:36
item.description: But there came after them successors who neglected prayer and pursued desires; so they are going to meet evil -

item.title: Al-Quran-19:37
item.description: Except those who repent, believe and do righteousness; for those will enter Paradise and will not be wronged at all.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:38
item.description: [Therein are] gardens of perpetual residence which the Most Merciful has promised His servants in the unseen. Indeed, His promise has ever been coming.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:39
item.description: They will not hear therein any ill speech - only [greetings of] peace - and they will have their provision therein, morning and afternoon.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:40
item.description: That is Paradise, which We give as inheritance to those of Our servants who were fearing of Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:41
item.description: Does man not remember that We created him before, while he was nothing?

item.title: Al-Quran-19:42
item.description: So by your Lord, We will surely gather them and the devils; then We will bring them to be present around Hell upon their knees.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:43
item.description: Then We will surely extract from every sect those of them who were worst against the Most Merciful in insolence.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:44
item.description: Then, surely it is We who are most knowing of those most worthy of burning therein.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:45
item.description: And there is none of you except he will come to it. This is upon your Lord an inevitability decreed.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:46
item.description: Then We will save those who feared Allah and leave the wrongdoers within it, on their knees.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:47
item.description: And how many a generation have We destroyed before them who were better in possessions and [outward] appearance?

item.title: Al-Quran-19:48
item.description: And Allah increases those who were guided, in guidance, and the enduring good deeds are better to your Lord for reward and better for recourse.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:49
item.description: Has he looked into the unseen, or has he taken from the Most Merciful a promise?

item.title: Al-Quran-19:50
item.description: No! We will record what he says and extend for him from the punishment extensively.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:51
item.description: And We will inherit him [in] what he mentions, and he will come to Us alone.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:52
item.description: And they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that they would be for them [a source of] honor.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:53
item.description: Do you not see that We have sent the devils upon the disbelievers, inciting them to [evil] with [constant] incitement?

item.title: Al-Quran-19:54
item.description: So be not impatient over them. We only count out to them a [limited] number.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:55
item.description: On the Day We will gather the righteous to the Most Merciful as a delegation

item.title: Al-Quran-19:56
item.description: And will drive the criminals to Hell in thirst

item.title: Al-Quran-19:57
item.description: None will have [power of] intercession except he who had taken from the Most Merciful a covenant.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:58
item.description: You have done an atrocious thing.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:59
item.description: The heavens almost rupture therefrom and the earth splits open and the mountains collapse in devastation

item.title: Al-Quran-19:60
item.description: That they attribute to the Most Merciful a son.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:61
item.description: And it is not appropriate for the Most Merciful that He should take a son.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:62
item.description: There is no one in the heavens and earth but that he comes to the Most Merciful as a servant.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:63
item.description: He has enumerated them and counted them a [full] counting.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:64
item.description: And all of them are coming to Him on the Day of Resurrection alone.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:65
item.description: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds - the Most Merciful will appoint for them affection.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:66
item.description: So, [O Muhammad], We have only made Qur'an easy in the Arabic language that you may give good tidings thereby to the righteous and warn thereby a hostile people.

item.title: Al-Quran-19:67
item.description: And how many have We destroyed before them of generations? Do you perceive of them anyone or hear from them a sound?

item.title: Al-Quran-20:1
item.description: Ta, Ha.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:2
item.description: We have not sent down to you the Qur'an that you be distressed

item.title: Al-Quran-20:3
item.description: But only as a reminder for those who fear [Allah] -

item.title: Al-Quran-20:4
item.description: A revelation from He who created the earth and highest heavens,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:5
item.description: The Most Merciful [who is] above the Throne established.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:6
item.description: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth and what is between them and what is under the soil.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:7
item.description: And if you speak aloud - then indeed, He knows the secret and what is [even] more hidden.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:8
item.description: Allah - there is no deity except Him. To Him belong the best names.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:9
item.description: And has the story of Moses reached you? -

item.title: Al-Quran-20:10
item.description: Indeed, I am your Lord, so remove your sandals. Indeed, you are in the sacred valley of Tuwa.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:11
item.description: And I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed [to you].

item.title: Al-Quran-20:12
item.description: Indeed, I am Allah. There is no deity except Me, so worship Me and establish prayer for My remembrance.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:13
item.description: Indeed, the Hour is coming - I almost conceal it - so that every soul may be recompensed according to that for which it strives.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:14
item.description: So do not let one avert you from it who does not believe in it and follows his desire, for you [then] would perish.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:15
item.description: So he threw it down, and thereupon it was a snake, moving swiftly.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:16
item.description: And draw in your hand to your side; it will come out white without disease - another sign,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:17
item.description: That We may show you [some] of Our greater signs.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:18
item.description: And ease for me my task

item.title: Al-Quran-20:19
item.description: And untie the knot from my tongue

item.title: Al-Quran-20:20
item.description: That they may understand my speech.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:21
item.description: And appoint for me a minister from my family -

item.title: Al-Quran-20:22
item.description: Aaron, my brother.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:23
item.description: Increase through him my strength

item.title: Al-Quran-20:24
item.description: And let him share my task

item.title: Al-Quran-20:25
item.description: That we may exalt You much

item.title: Al-Quran-20:26
item.description: And remember You much.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:27
item.description: And We had already conferred favor upon you another time,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:28
item.description: When We inspired to your mother what We inspired,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:29
item.description: [Saying], 'Cast him into the chest and cast it into the river, and the river will throw it onto the bank; there will take him an enemy to Me and an enemy to him.' And I bestowed upon you love from Me that you would be brought up under My eye.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:30
item.description: [And We favored you] when your sister went and said, 'Shall I direct you to someone who will be responsible for him?' So We restored you to your mother that she might be content and not grieve. And you killed someone, but We saved you from retaliation and tried you with a [severe] trial. And you remained [some] years among the people of Madyan. Then you came [here] at the decreed time, O Moses.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:31
item.description: And I produced you for Myself.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:32
item.description: Go, you and your brother, with My signs and do not slacken in My remembrance.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:33
item.description: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:34
item.description: So go to him and say, 'Indeed, we are messengers of your Lord, so send with us the Children of Israel and do not torment them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And peace will be upon he who follows the guidance.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:35
item.description: Indeed, it has been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies and turns away.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-20:36
item.description: [It is He] who has made for you the earth as a bed [spread out] and inserted therein for you roadways and sent down from the sky, rain and produced thereby categories of various plants.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:37
item.description: Eat [therefrom] and pasture your livestock. Indeed, in that are signs for those of intelligence.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:38
item.description: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will extract you another time.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:39
item.description: And We certainly showed Pharaoh Our signs - all of them - but he denied and refused.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:40
item.description: So Pharaoh went away, put together his plan, and then came [to Moses].

item.title: Al-Quran-20:41
item.description: So they disputed over their affair among themselves and concealed their private conversation.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:42
item.description: And he sensed within himself apprehension, did Moses.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:43
item.description: Indeed, whoever comes to his Lord as a criminal - indeed, for him is Hell; he will neither die therein nor live.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:44
item.description: But whoever comes to Him as a believer having done righteous deeds - for those will be the highest degrees [in position]:

item.title: Al-Quran-20:45
item.description: Gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. And that is the reward of one who purifies himself.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:46
item.description: So Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers, and there covered them from the sea that which covered them,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:47
item.description: And Pharaoh led his people astray and did not guide [them].

item.title: Al-Quran-20:48
item.description: O Children of Israel, We delivered you from your enemy, and We made an appointment with you at the right side of the mount, and We sent down to you manna and quails,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:49
item.description: But indeed, I am the Perpetual Forgiver of whoever repents and believes and does righteousness and then continues in guidance.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:50
item.description: Did they not see that it could not return to them any speech and that it did not possess for them any harm or benefit?

item.title: Al-Quran-20:51
item.description: [Aaron] said, "O son of my mother, do not seize [me] by my beard or by my head. Indeed, I feared that you would say, 'You caused division among the Children of Israel, and you did not observe [or await] my word.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-20:52
item.description: [Moses] said, "Then go. And indeed, it is [decreed] for you in [this] life to say, 'No contact.' And indeed, you have an appointment [in the Hereafter] you will not fail to keep. And look at your 'god' to which you remained devoted. We will surely burn it and blow it into the sea with a blast.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:53
item.description: Thus, [O Muhammad], We relate to you from the news of what has preceded. And We have certainly given you from Us the Qur'an.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:54
item.description: Whoever turns away from it - then indeed, he will bear on the Day of Resurrection a burden,

item.title: Al-Quran-20:55
item.description: [Abiding] eternally therein, and evil it is for them on the Day of Resurrection as a load -

item.title: Al-Quran-20:56
item.description: The Day the Horn will be blown. And We will gather the criminals, that Day, blue-eyed.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:57
item.description: And He will leave the earth a level plain;

item.title: Al-Quran-20:58
item.description: That Day, everyone will follow [the call of] the Caller [with] no deviation therefrom, and [all] voices will be stilled before the Most Merciful, so you will not hear except a whisper [of footsteps].

item.title: Al-Quran-20:59
item.description: That Day, no intercession will benefit except [that of] one to whom the Most Merciful has given permission and has accepted his word.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:60
item.description: Allah knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, but they do not encompass it in knowledge.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:61
item.description: And [all] faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of existence. And he will have failed who carries injustice.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:62
item.description: But he who does of righteous deeds while he is a believer - he will neither fear injustice nor deprivation.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:63
item.description: And thus We have sent it down as an Arabic Qur'an and have diversified therein the warnings that perhaps they will avoid [sin] or it would cause them remembrance.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:64
item.description: So high [above all] is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth. And, [O Muhammad], do not hasten with [recitation of] the Qur'an before its revelation is completed to you, and say, "My Lord, increase me in knowledge."

item.title: Al-Quran-20:65
item.description: And We had already taken a promise from Adam before, but he forgot; and We found not in him determination.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:66
item.description: Indeed, it is [promised] for you not to be hungry therein or be unclothed.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:67
item.description: And Adam and his wife ate of it, and their private parts became apparent to them, and they began to fasten over themselves from the leaves of Paradise. And Adam disobeyed his Lord and erred.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:68
item.description: Then his Lord chose him and turned to him in forgiveness and guided [him].

item.title: Al-Quran-20:69
item.description: And thus do We recompense he who transgressed and did not believe in the signs of his Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is more severe and more enduring.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:70
item.description: Then, has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them as they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs for those of intelligence.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:71
item.description: And if not for a word that preceded from your Lord, punishment would have been an obligation [due immediately], and [if not for] a specified term [decreed].

item.title: Al-Quran-20:72
item.description: So be patient over what they say and exalt [Allah] with praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and during periods of the night [exalt Him] and at the ends of the day, that you may be satisfied.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:73
item.description: And do not extend your eyes toward that by which We have given enjoyment to [some] categories of them, [its being but] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them. And the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

item.title: Al-Quran-20:74
item.description: And enjoin prayer upon your family [and people] and be steadfast therein. We ask you not for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] outcome is for [those of] righteousness.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:1
item.description: [The time of] their account has approached for the people, while they are in heedlessness turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:2
item.description: No mention comes to them anew from their Lord except that they listen to it while they are at play

item.title: Al-Quran-21:3
item.description: Not a [single] city which We destroyed believed before them, so will they believe?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:4
item.description: And We sent not before you, [O Muhammad], except men to whom We revealed [the message], so ask the people of the message if you do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:5
item.description: And We did not make the prophets forms not eating food, nor were they immortal [on earth].

item.title: Al-Quran-21:6
item.description: Then We fulfilled for them the promise, and We saved them and whom We willed and destroyed the transgressors.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:7
item.description: We have certainly sent down to you a Book in which is your mention. Then will you not reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:8
item.description: And how many a city which was unjust have We shattered and produced after it another people.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:9
item.description: And when its inhabitants perceived Our punishment, at once they fled from it.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:10
item.description: And that declaration of theirs did not cease until We made them [as] a harvest [mowed down], extinguished [like a fire].

item.title: Al-Quran-21:11
item.description: And We did not create the heaven and earth and that between them in play.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:12
item.description: Had We intended to take a diversion, We could have taken it from [what is] with Us - if [indeed] We were to do so.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:13
item.description: Rather, We dash the truth upon falsehood, and it destroys it, and thereupon it departs. And for you is destruction from that which you describe.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:14
item.description: To Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth. And those near Him are not prevented by arrogance from His worship, nor do they tire.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:15
item.description: They exalt [Him] night and day [and] do not slacken.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:16
item.description: Or have men taken for themselves gods from the earth who resurrect [the dead]?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:17
item.description: Had there been within the heavens and earth gods besides Allah, they both would have been ruined. So exalted is Allah, Lord of the Throne, above what they describe.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:18
item.description: He is not questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:19
item.description: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, [O Muhammad], "Produce your proof. This [Qur'an] is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the truth, so they are turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:20
item.description: They cannot precede Him in word, and they act by His command.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:21
item.description: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they cannot intercede except on behalf of one whom He approves. And they, from fear of Him, are apprehensive.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:22
item.description: Have those who disbelieved not considered that the heavens and the earth were a joined entity, and We separated them and made from water every living thing? Then will they not believe?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:23
item.description: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with them, and We made therein [mountain] passes [as] roads that they might be guided.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:24
item.description: And We made the sky a protected ceiling, but they, from its signs, are turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:25
item.description: And it is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; all [heavenly bodies] in an orbit are swimming.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:26
item.description: And We did not grant to any man before you eternity [on earth]; so if you die - would they be eternal?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:27
item.description: Every soul will taste death. And We test you with evil and with good as trial; and to Us you will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:28
item.description: Man was created of haste. I will show you My signs, so do not impatiently urge Me.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:29
item.description: If those who disbelieved but knew the time when they will not avert the Fire from their faces or from their backs and they will not be aided...

item.title: Al-Quran-21:30
item.description: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:31
item.description: And already were messengers ridiculed before you, but those who mocked them were enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:32
item.description: Or do they have gods to defend them other than Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:33
item.description: But, [on the contrary], We have provided good things for these [disbelievers] and their fathers until life was prolonged for them. Then do they not see that We set upon the land, reducing it from its borders? So it is they who will overcome?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:34
item.description: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so no soul will be treated unjustly at all. And if there is [even] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as accountant.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:35
item.description: And We had already given Moses and Aaron the criterion and a light and a reminder for the righteous

item.title: Al-Quran-21:36
item.description: Who fear their Lord unseen, while they are of the Hour apprehensive.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:37
item.description: And this [Qur'an] is a blessed message which We have sent down. Then are you with it unacquainted?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:38
item.description: And We had certainly given Abraham his sound judgement before, and We were of him well-Knowing

item.title: Al-Quran-21:39
item.description: So he made them into fragments, except a large one among them, that they might return to it [and question].

item.title: Al-Quran-21:40
item.description: And they intended for him harm, but We made them the greatest losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:41
item.description: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:42
item.description: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob in addition, and all [of them] We made righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:43
item.description: And We made them leaders guiding by Our command. And We inspired to them the doing of good deeds, establishment of prayer, and giving of zakah; and they were worshippers of Us.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:44
item.description: And to Lot We gave judgement and knowledge, and We saved him from the city that was committing wicked deeds. Indeed, they were a people of evil, defiantly disobedient.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:45
item.description: And We admitted him into Our mercy. Indeed, he was of the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:46
item.description: And [mention] Noah, when he called [to Allah] before [that time], so We responded to him and saved him and his family from the great flood.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:47
item.description: And We saved him from the people who denied Our signs. Indeed, they were a people of evil, so We drowned them, all together.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:48
item.description: And [mention] David and Solomon, when they judged concerning the field - when the sheep of a people overran it [at night], and We were witness to their judgement.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:49
item.description: And We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave judgement and knowledge. And We subjected the mountains to exalt [Us], along with David and [also] the birds. And We were doing [that].

item.title: Al-Quran-21:50
item.description: And We taught him the fashioning of coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. So will you then be grateful?

item.title: Al-Quran-21:51
item.description: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind, blowing forcefully, proceeding by his command toward the land which We had blessed. And We are ever, of all things, Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:52
item.description: And of the devils were those who dived for him and did work other than that. And We were of them a guardian.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:53
item.description: So We responded to him and removed what afflicted him of adversity. And We gave him [back] his family and the like thereof with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for the worshippers [of Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-21:54
item.description: And [mention] Ishmael and Idrees and Dhul-Kifl; all were of the patient.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:55
item.description: And We admitted them into Our mercy. Indeed, they were of the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:56
item.description: So We responded to him and saved him from the distress. And thus do We save the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:57
item.description: So We responded to him, and We gave to him John, and amended for him his wife. Indeed, they used to hasten to good deeds and supplicate Us in hope and fear, and they were to Us humbly submissive.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:58
item.description: And [mention] the one who guarded her chastity, so We blew into her [garment] through Our angel [Gabriel], and We made her and her son a sign for the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:59
item.description: Indeed this, your religion, is one religion, and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:60
item.description: And [yet] they divided their affair among themselves, [but] all to Us will return.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:61
item.description: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer - no denial will there be for his effort, and indeed We, of it, are recorders.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:62
item.description: And there is prohibition upon [the people of] a city which We have destroyed that they will [ever] return

item.title: Al-Quran-21:63
item.description: Until when [the dam of] Gog and Magog has been opened and they, from every elevation, descend

item.title: Al-Quran-21:64
item.description: Indeed, you [disbelievers] and what you worship other than Allah are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to [enter] it.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:65
item.description: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but all are eternal therein.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:66
item.description: For them therein is heavy sighing, and they therein will not hear.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:67
item.description: Indeed, those for whom the best [reward] has preceded from Us - they are from it far removed.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:68
item.description: They will not hear its sound, while they are, in that which their souls desire, abiding eternally.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:69
item.description: The Day when We will fold the heaven like the folding of a [written] sheet for the records. As We began the first creation, We will repeat it. [That is] a promise binding upon Us. Indeed, We will do it.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:70
item.description: And We have already written in the book [of Psalms] after the [previous] mention that the land [of Paradise] is inherited by My righteous servants.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:71
item.description: Indeed, in this [Qur'an] is notification for a worshipping people.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:72
item.description: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a mercy to the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-21:73
item.description: Indeed, He knows what is declared of speech, and He knows what you conceal.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:1
item.description: O mankind, fear your Lord. Indeed, the convulsion of the [final] Hour is a terrible thing.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:2
item.description: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from that [child] she was nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will see the people [appearing] intoxicated while they are not intoxicated; but the punishment of Allah is severe.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:3
item.description: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge and follows every rebellious devil.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:4
item.description: It has been decreed for every devil that whoever turns to him - he will misguide him and will lead him to the punishment of the Blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:5
item.description: O People, if you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] indeed, We created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then from a clinging clot, and then from a lump of flesh, formed and unformed - that We may show you. And We settle in the wombs whom We will for a specified term, then We bring you out as a child, and then [We develop you] that you may reach your [time of] maturity. And among you is he who is taken in [early] death, and among you is he who is returned to the most decrepit [old] age so that he knows, after [once having] knowledge, nothing. And you see the earth barren, but when We send down upon it rain, it quivers and swells and grows [something] of every beautiful kind.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:6
item.description: That is because Allah is the Truth and because He gives life to the dead and because He is over all things competent

item.title: Al-Quran-22:7
item.description: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming - no doubt about it - and that Allah will resurrect those in the graves.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:8
item.description: And of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening book [from Him],

item.title: Al-Quran-22:9
item.description: Twisting his neck [in arrogance] to mislead [people] from the way of Allah. For him in the world is disgrace, and We will make him taste on the Day of Resurrection the punishment of the Burning Fire [while it is said],

item.title: Al-Quran-22:10
item.description: And of the people is he who worships Allah on an edge. If he is touched by good, he is reassured by it; but if he is struck by trial, he turns on his face [to the other direction]. He has lost [this] world and the Hereafter. That is what is the manifest loss.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:11
item.description: He invokes instead of Allah that which neither harms him nor benefits him. That is what is the extreme error.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:12
item.description: He invokes one whose harm is closer than his benefit - how wretched the protector and how wretched the associate.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:13
item.description: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. Indeed, Allah does what He intends.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:14
item.description: Whoever should think that Allah will not support [Prophet Muhammad] in this world and the Hereafter - let him extend a rope to the ceiling, then cut off [his breath], and let him see: will his effort remove that which enrages [him]?

item.title: Al-Quran-22:15
item.description: And thus have We sent the Qur'an down as verses of clear evidence and because Allah guides whom He intends.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:16
item.description: Indeed, those who have believed and those who were Jews and the Sabeans and the Christians and the Magians and those who associated with Allah - Allah will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allah is, over all things, Witness.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:17
item.description: Do you not see that to Allah prostrates whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many of the people? But upon many the punishment has been justified. And he whom Allah humiliates - for him there is no bestower of honor. Indeed, Allah does what He wills.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:18
item.description: These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But those who disbelieved will have cut out for them garments of fire. Poured upon their heads will be scalding water

item.title: Al-Quran-22:19
item.description: By which is melted that within their bellies and [their] skins.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:20
item.description: And for [striking] them are maces of iron.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:21
item.description: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to gardens beneath which rivers flow. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearl, and their garments therein will be silk.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:22
item.description: And they had been guided [in worldly life] to good speech, and they were guided to the path of the Praiseworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:23
item.description: Indeed, those who have disbelieved and avert [people] from the way of Allah and [from] al-Masjid al-Haram, which We made for the people - equal are the resident therein and one from outside; and [also] whoever intends [a deed] therein of deviation [in religion] or wrongdoing - We will make him taste of a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:24
item.description: And proclaim to the people the Hajj [pilgrimage]; they will come to you on foot and on every lean camel; they will come from every distant pass -

item.title: Al-Quran-22:25
item.description: That they may witness benefits for themselves and mention the name of Allah on known days over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:26
item.description: That [has been commanded], and whoever honors the sacred ordinances of Allah - it is best for him in the sight of his Lord. And permitted to you are the grazing livestock, except what is recited to you. So avoid the uncleanliness of idols and avoid false statement,

item.title: Al-Quran-22:27
item.description: Inclining [only] to Allah, not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates with Allah - it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:28
item.description: That [is so]. And whoever honors the symbols of Allah - indeed, it is from the piety of hearts.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:29
item.description: For you the animals marked for sacrifice are benefits for a specified term; then their place of sacrifice is at the ancient House.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:30
item.description: And for all religion We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] that they may mention the name of Allah over what He has provided for them of [sacrificial] animals. For your god is one God, so to Him submit. And, [O Muhammad], give good tidings to the humble [before their Lord]

item.title: Al-Quran-22:31
item.description: Who, when Allah is mentioned, their hearts are fearful, and [to] the patient over what has afflicted them, and the establishers of prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:32
item.description: And the camels and cattle We have appointed for you as among the symbols of Allah; for you therein is good. So mention the name of Allah upon them when lined up [for sacrifice]; and when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy and the beggar. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:33
item.description: Their meat will not reach Allah, nor will their blood, but what reaches Him is piety from you. Thus have We subjected them to you that you may glorify Allah for that [to] which He has guided you; and give good tidings to the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:34
item.description: Indeed, Allah defends those who have believed. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:35
item.description: Permission [to fight] has been given to those who are being fought, because they were wronged. And indeed, Allah is competent to give them victory.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:36
item.description: [And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer and give zakah and enjoin what is right and forbid what is wrong. And to Allah belongs the outcome of [all] matters.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:37
item.description: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - so, before them, did the people of Noah and 'Aad and Thamud deny [their prophets],

item.title: Al-Quran-22:38
item.description: And the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

item.title: Al-Quran-22:39
item.description: And the inhabitants of Madyan. And Moses was denied, so I prolonged enjoyment for the disbelievers; then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:40
item.description: And how many a city did We destroy while it was committing wrong - so it is [now] fallen into ruin - and [how many] an abandoned well and [how many] a lofty palace.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:41
item.description: So have they not traveled through the earth and have hearts by which to reason and ears by which to hear? For indeed, it is not eyes that are blinded, but blinded are the hearts which are within the breasts.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:42
item.description: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. But Allah will never fail in His promise. And indeed, a day with your Lord is like a thousand years of those which you count.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:43
item.description: And for how many a city did I prolong enjoyment while it was committing wrong. Then I seized it, and to Me is the [final] destination.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:44
item.description: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and noble provision.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:45
item.description: But the ones who strove against Our verses, [seeking] to cause failure - those are the companions of Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:46
item.description: And We did not send before you any messenger or prophet except that when he spoke [or recited], Satan threw into it [some misunderstanding]. But Allah abolishes that which Satan throws in; then Allah makes precise His verses. And Allah is Knowing and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:47
item.description: [That is] so He may make what Satan throws in a trial for those within whose hearts is disease and those hard of heart. And indeed, the wrongdoers are in extreme dissension.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:48
item.description: And so those who were given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord and [therefore] believe in it, and their hearts humbly submit to it. And indeed is Allah the Guide of those who have believed to a straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:49
item.description: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt of it until the Hour comes upon them unexpectedly or there comes to them the punishment of a barren Day.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:50
item.description: [All] sovereignty that Day is for Allah; He will judge between them. So they who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Pleasure.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:51
item.description: And they who disbelieved and denied Our signs - for those there will be a humiliating punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:52
item.description: And those who emigrated for the cause of Allah and then were killed or died - Allah will surely provide for them a good provision. And indeed, it is Allah who is the best of providers.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:53
item.description: He will surely cause them to enter an entrance with which they will be pleased, and indeed, Allah is Knowing and Forbearing.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:54
item.description: That [is so]. And whoever responds [to injustice] with the equivalent of that with which he was harmed and then is tyrannized - Allah will surely aid him. Indeed, Allah is Pardoning and Forgiving.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:55
item.description: That is because Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and because Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:56
item.description: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that which they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:57
item.description: Do you not see that Allah has sent down rain from the sky and the earth becomes green? Indeed, Allah is Subtle and Acquainted.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:58
item.description: To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:59
item.description: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is on the earth and the ships which run through the sea by His command? And He restrains the sky from falling upon the earth, unless by His permission. Indeed Allah, to the people, is Kind and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:60
item.description: And He is the one who gave you life; then He causes you to die and then will [again] give you life. Indeed, mankind is ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:61
item.description: For every religion We have appointed rites which they perform. So, [O Muhammad], let the disbelievers not contend with you over the matter but invite them to your Lord. Indeed, you are upon straight guidance.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:62
item.description: Do you not know that Allah knows what is in the heaven and earth? Indeed, that is in a Record. Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:63
item.description: And they worship besides Allah that for which He has not sent down authority and that of which they have no knowledge. And there will not be for the wrongdoers any helper.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:64
item.description: O people, an example is presented, so listen to it. Indeed, those you invoke besides Allah will never create [as much as] a fly, even if they gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly should steal away from them a [tiny] thing, they could not recover it from him. Weak are the pursuer and pursued.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:65
item.description: They have not appraised Allah with true appraisal. Indeed, Allah is Powerful and Exalted in Might.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:66
item.description: Allah chooses from the angels messengers and from the people. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:67
item.description: He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them. And to Allah will be returned [all] matters.

item.title: Al-Quran-22:68
item.description: O you who have believed, bow and prostrate and worship your Lord and do good - that you may succeed.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:1
item.description: Certainly will the believers have succeeded:

item.title: Al-Quran-23:2
item.description: They who are during their prayer humbly submissive

item.title: Al-Quran-23:3
item.description: And they who turn away from ill speech

item.title: Al-Quran-23:4
item.description: And they who are observant of zakah

item.title: Al-Quran-23:5
item.description: And they who guard their private parts

item.title: Al-Quran-23:6
item.description: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they will not be blamed -

item.title: Al-Quran-23:7
item.description: But whoever seeks beyond that, then those are the transgressors -

item.title: Al-Quran-23:8
item.description: And they who are to their trusts and their promises attentive

item.title: Al-Quran-23:9
item.description: And they who carefully maintain their prayers -

item.title: Al-Quran-23:10
item.description: Those are the inheritors

item.title: Al-Quran-23:11
item.description: Who will inherit al-Firdaus. They will abide therein eternally.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:12
item.description: And certainly did We create man from an extract of clay.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:13
item.description: Then We placed him as a sperm-drop in a firm lodging.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:14
item.description: Then We made the sperm-drop into a clinging clot, and We made the clot into a lump [of flesh], and We made [from] the lump, bones, and We covered the bones with flesh; then We developed him into another creation. So blessed is Allah, the best of creators.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:15
item.description: Then indeed, after that you are to die.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:16
item.description: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, will be resurrected.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:17
item.description: And We have created above you seven layered heavens, and never have We been of [Our] creation unaware.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:18
item.description: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and settled it in the earth. And indeed, We are Able to take it away.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:19
item.description: And We brought forth for you thereby gardens of palm trees and grapevines in which for you are abundant fruits and from which you eat.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:20
item.description: And [We brought forth] a tree issuing from Mount Sinai which produces oil and food for those who eat.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:21
item.description: And indeed, for you in livestock is a lesson. We give you drink from that which is in their bellies, and for you in them are numerous benefits, and from them you eat.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:22
item.description: And upon them and on ships you are carried.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:23
item.description: And when you have boarded the ship, you and those with you, then say, 'Praise to Allah who has saved us from the wrongdoing people.'

item.title: Al-Quran-23:24
item.description: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, and You are the best to accommodate [us].' "

item.title: Al-Quran-23:25
item.description: Indeed in that are signs, and indeed, We are ever testing [Our servants].

item.title: Al-Quran-23:26
item.description: Then We produced after them a generation of others.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:27
item.description: And if you should obey a man like yourselves, indeed, you would then be losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:28
item.description: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [once more]?

item.title: Al-Quran-23:29
item.description: How far, how far, is that which you are promised.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:30
item.description: Life is not but our worldly life - we die and live, but we will not be resurrected.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:31
item.description: So the shriek seized them in truth, and We made them as [plant] stubble. Then away with the wrongdoing people.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:32
item.description: Then We produced after them other generations.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:33
item.description: No nation will precede its time [of termination], nor will they remain [thereafter].

item.title: Al-Quran-23:34
item.description: Then We sent Our messengers in succession. Every time there came to a nation its messenger, they denied him, so We made them follow one another [to destruction], and We made them narrations. So away with a people who do not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:35
item.description: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

item.title: Al-Quran-23:36
item.description: To Pharaoh and his establishment, but they were arrogant and were a haughty people.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:37
item.description: So they denied them and were of those destroyed.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:38
item.description: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture that perhaps they would be guided.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:39
item.description: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign and sheltered them within a high ground having level [areas] and flowing water.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:40
