item.description: But the people divided their religion among them into sects - each faction, in what it has, rejoicing.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:41
item.description: So leave them in their confusion for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:42
item.description: Do they think that what We extend to them of wealth and children

item.title: Al-Quran-23:43
item.description: Is [because] We hasten for them good things? Rather, they do not perceive.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:44
item.description: Indeed, they who are apprehensive from fear of their Lord

item.title: Al-Quran-23:45
item.description: And they who believe in the signs of their Lord

item.title: Al-Quran-23:46
item.description: And they who do not associate anything with their Lord

item.title: Al-Quran-23:47
item.description: And they who give what they give while their hearts are fearful because they will be returning to their Lord -

item.title: Al-Quran-23:48
item.description: It is those who hasten to good deeds, and they outstrip [others] therein.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:49
item.description: And We charge no soul except [with that within] its capacity, and with Us is a record which speaks with truth; and they will not be wronged.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:50
item.description: But their hearts are covered with confusion over this, and they have [evil] deeds besides disbelief which they are doing,

item.title: Al-Quran-23:51
item.description: Until when We seize their affluent ones with punishment, at once they are crying [to Allah] for help.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:52
item.description: Do not cry out today. Indeed, by Us you will not be helped.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:53
item.description: My verses had already been recited to you, but you were turning back on your heels

item.title: Al-Quran-23:54
item.description: In arrogance regarding it, conversing by night, speaking evil.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:55
item.description: Then have they not reflected over the Qur'an, or has there come to them that which had not come to their forefathers?

item.title: Al-Quran-23:56
item.description: Or did they not know their Messenger, so they are toward him disacknowledging?

item.title: Al-Quran-23:57
item.description: But if the Truth had followed their inclinations, the heavens and the earth and whoever is in them would have been ruined. Rather, We have brought them their message, but they, from their message, are turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:58
item.description: Or do you, [O Muhammad], ask them for payment? But the reward of your Lord is best, and He is the best of providers.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:59
item.description: And indeed, you invite them to a straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:60
item.description: But indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter are deviating from the path.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:61
item.description: And even if We gave them mercy and removed what was upon them of affliction, they would persist in their transgression, wandering blindly.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:62
item.description: And We had gripped them with suffering [as a warning], but they did not yield to their Lord, nor did they humbly supplicate, [and will continue thus]

item.title: Al-Quran-23:63
item.description: Until when We have opened before them a door of severe punishment, immediately they will be therein in despair.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:64
item.description: And it is He who produced for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:65
item.description: And it is He who has multiplied you throughout the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:66
item.description: And it is He who gives life and causes death, and His is the alternation of the night and the day. Then will you not reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-23:67
item.description: Rather, they say like what the former peoples said.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:68
item.description: Rather, We have brought them the truth, and indeed they are liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:69
item.description: Allah has not taken any son, nor has there ever been with Him any deity. [If there had been], then each deity would have taken what it created, and some of them would have sought to overcome others. Exalted is Allah above what they describe [concerning Him].

item.title: Al-Quran-23:70
item.description: [He is] Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, so high is He above what they associate [with Him].

item.title: Al-Quran-23:71
item.description: And indeed, We are able to show you what We have promised them.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:72
item.description: Repel, by [means of] what is best, [their] evil. We are most knowing of what they describe.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:73
item.description: So when the Horn is blown, no relationship will there be among them that Day, nor will they ask about one another.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:74
item.description: And those whose scales are heavy [with good deeds] - it is they who are the successful.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:75
item.description: But those whose scales are light - those are the ones who have lost their souls, [being] in Hell, abiding eternally.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:76
item.description: The Fire will sear their faces, and they therein will have taut smiles.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:77
item.description: Indeed, there was a party of My servants who said, 'Our Lord, we have believed, so forgive us and have mercy upon us, and You are the best of the merciful.'

item.title: Al-Quran-23:78
item.description: But you took them in mockery to the point that they made you forget My remembrance, and you used to laugh at them.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:79
item.description: So exalted is Allah, the Sovereign, the Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne.

item.title: Al-Quran-23:80
item.description: And whoever invokes besides Allah another deity for which he has no proof - then his account is only with his Lord. Indeed, the disbelievers will not succeed.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:1
item.description: [This is] a surah which We have sent down and made [that within it] obligatory and revealed therein verses of clear evidence that you might remember.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:2
item.description: The [unmarried] woman or [unmarried] man found guilty of sexual intercourse - lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not be taken by pity for them in the religion of Allah, if you should believe in Allah and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:3
item.description: The fornicator does not marry except a [female] fornicator or polytheist, and none marries her except a fornicator or a polytheist, and that has been made unlawful to the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:4
item.description: And those who accuse chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses - lash them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. And those are the defiantly disobedient,

item.title: Al-Quran-24:5
item.description: Except for those who repent thereafter and reform, for indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:6
item.description: And those who accuse their wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves - then the witness of one of them [shall be] four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the truthful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:7
item.description: And the fifth [oath will be] that the curse of Allah be upon him if he should be among the liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:8
item.description: But it will prevent punishment from her if she gives four testimonies [swearing] by Allah that indeed, he is of the liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:9
item.description: And the fifth [oath will be] that the wrath of Allah be upon her if he was of the truthful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:10
item.description: And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Accepting of repentance and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:11
item.description: Indeed, those who came with falsehood are a group among you. Do not think it bad for you; rather it is good for you. For every person among them is what [punishment] he has earned from the sin, and he who took upon himself the greater portion thereof - for him is a great punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:12
item.description: Why did they [who slandered] not produce for it four witnesses? And when they do not produce the witnesses, then it is they, in the sight of Allah, who are the liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:13
item.description: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have been touched for that [lie] in which you were involved by a great punishment

item.title: Al-Quran-24:14
item.description: When you received it with your tongues and said with your mouths that of which you had no knowledge and thought it was insignificant while it was, in the sight of Allah, tremendous.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:15
item.description: Allah warns you against returning to the likes of this [conduct], ever, if you should be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:16
item.description: And Allah makes clear to you the verses, and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:17
item.description: Indeed, those who like that immorality should be spread [or publicized] among those who have believed will have a painful punishment in this world and the Hereafter. And Allah knows and you do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:18
item.description: And if it had not been for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy... and because Allah is Kind and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:19
item.description: O you who have believed, do not follow the footsteps of Satan. And whoever follows the footsteps of Satan - indeed, he enjoins immorality and wrongdoing. And if not for the favor of Allah upon you and His mercy, not one of you would have been pure, ever, but Allah purifies whom He wills, and Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:20
item.description: And let not those of virtue among you and wealth swear not to give [aid] to their relatives and the needy and the emigrants for the cause of Allah, and let them pardon and overlook. Would you not like that Allah should forgive you? And Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:21
item.description: Indeed, those who [falsely] accuse chaste, unaware and believing women are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; and they will have a great punishment

item.title: Al-Quran-24:22
item.description: On a Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them as to what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:23
item.description: That Day, Allah will pay them in full their deserved recompense, and they will know that it is Allah who is the perfect in justice.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:24
item.description: Evil words are for evil men, and evil men are [subjected] to evil words. And good words are for good men, and good men are [an object] of good words. Those [good people] are declared innocent of what the slanderers say. For them is forgiveness and noble provision.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:25
item.description: O you who have believed, do not enter houses other than your own houses until you ascertain welcome and greet their inhabitants. That is best for you; perhaps you will be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:26
item.description: There is no blame upon you for entering houses not inhabited in which there is convenience for you. And Allah knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:27
item.description: Tell the believing men to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts. That is purer for them. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with what they do.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:28
item.description: And tell the believing women to reduce [some] of their vision and guard their private parts and not expose their adornment except that which [necessarily] appears thereof and to wrap [a portion of] their headcovers over their chests and not expose their adornment except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their women, that which their right hands possess, or those male attendants having no physical desire, or children who are not yet aware of the private aspects of women. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their adornment. And turn to Allah in repentance, all of you, O believers, that you might succeed.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:29
item.description: And marry the unmarried among you and the righteous among your male slaves and female slaves. If they should be poor, Allah will enrich them from His bounty, and Allah is all-Encompassing and Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:30
item.description: But let them who find not [the means for] marriage abstain [from sexual relations] until Allah enriches them from His bounty. And those who seek a contract [for eventual emancipation] from among whom your right hands possess - then make a contract with them if you know there is within them goodness and give them from the wealth of Allah which He has given you. And do not compel your slave girls to prostitution, if they desire chastity, to seek [thereby] the temporary interests of worldly life. And if someone should compel them, then indeed, Allah is [to them], after their compulsion, Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:31
item.description: And We have certainly sent down to you distinct verses and examples from those who passed on before you and an admonition for those who fear Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:32
item.description: Allah is the Light of the heavens and the earth. The example of His light is like a niche within which is a lamp, the lamp is within glass, the glass as if it were a pearly [white] star lit from [the oil of] a blessed olive tree, neither of the east nor of the west, whose oil would almost glow even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. Allah guides to His light whom He wills. And Allah presents examples for the people, and Allah is Knowing of all things.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:33
item.description: [Such niches are] in mosques which Allah has ordered to be raised and that His name be mentioned therein; exalting Him within them in the morning and the evenings

item.title: Al-Quran-24:34
item.description: [Are] men whom neither commerce nor sale distracts from the remembrance of Allah and performance of prayer and giving of zakah. They fear a Day in which the hearts and eyes will [fearfully] turn about -

item.title: Al-Quran-24:35
item.description: That Allah may reward them [according to] the best of what they did and increase them from His bounty. And Allah gives provision to whom He wills without account.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:36
item.description: But those who disbelieved - their deeds are like a mirage in a lowland which a thirsty one thinks is water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing but finds Allah before Him, and He will pay him in full his due; and Allah is swift in account.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:37
item.description: Or [they are] like darknesses within an unfathomable sea which is covered by waves, upon which are waves, over which are clouds - darknesses, some of them upon others. When one puts out his hand [therein], he can hardly see it. And he to whom Allah has not granted light - for him there is no light.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:38
item.description: Do you not see that Allah is exalted by whomever is within the heavens and the earth and [by] the birds with wings spread [in flight]? Each [of them] has known his [means of] prayer and exalting [Him], and Allah is Knowing of what they do.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:39
item.description: And to Allah belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to Allah is the destination.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:40
item.description: Do you not see that Allah drives clouds? Then He brings them together, then He makes them into a mass, and you see the rain emerge from within it. And He sends down from the sky, mountains [of clouds] within which is hail, and He strikes with it whom He wills and averts it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost takes away the eyesight.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:41
item.description: Allah alternates the night and the day. Indeed in that is a lesson for those who have vision.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:42
item.description: Allah has created every [living] creature from water. And of them are those that move on their bellies, and of them are those that walk on two legs, and of them are those that walk on four. Allah creates what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:43
item.description: We have certainly sent down distinct verses. And Allah guides whom He wills to a straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:44
item.description: And when they are called to [the words of] Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, at once a party of them turns aside [in refusal].

item.title: Al-Quran-24:45
item.description: But if the right is theirs, they come to him in prompt obedience.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:46
item.description: Is there disease in their hearts? Or have they doubted? Or do they fear that Allah will be unjust to them, or His Messenger? Rather, it is they who are the wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:47
item.description: And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and is conscious of Him - it is those who are the attainers.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:48
item.description: And they swear by Allah their strongest oaths that if you ordered them, they would go forth [in Allah 's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is known. Indeed, Allah is Acquainted with that which you do."

item.title: Al-Quran-24:49
item.description: Allah has promised those who have believed among you and done righteous deeds that He will surely grant them succession [to authority] upon the earth just as He granted it to those before them and that He will surely establish for them [therein] their religion which He has preferred for them and that He will surely substitute for them, after their fear, security, [for] they worship Me, not associating anything with Me. But whoever disbelieves after that - then those are the defiantly disobedient.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:50
item.description: And establish prayer and give zakah and obey the Messenger - that you may receive mercy.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:51
item.description: Never think that the disbelievers are causing failure [to Allah] upon the earth. Their refuge will be the Fire - and how wretched the destination.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:52
item.description: O you who have believed, let those whom your right hands possess and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering] at three times: before the dawn prayer and when you put aside your clothing [for rest] at noon and after the night prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. There is no blame upon you nor upon them beyond these [periods], for they continually circulate among you - some of you, among others. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:53
item.description: And when the children among you reach puberty, let them ask permission [at all times] as those before them have done. Thus does Allah make clear to you His verses; and Allah is Knowing and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:54
item.description: And women of post-menstrual age who have no desire for marriage - there is no blame upon them for putting aside their outer garments [but] not displaying adornment. But to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them. And Allah is Hearing and Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:55
item.description: There is not upon the blind [any] constraint nor upon the lame constraint nor upon the ill constraint nor upon yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers or the houses of your mothers or the houses of your brothers or the houses of your sisters or the houses of your father's brothers or the houses of your father's sisters or the houses of your mother's brothers or the houses of your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess or [from the house] of your friend. There is no blame upon you whether you eat together or separately. But when you enter houses, give greetings of peace upon each other - a greeting from Allah, blessed and good. Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of ordinance] that you may understand.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:56
item.description: The believers are only those who believe in Allah and His Messenger and, when they are [meeting] with him for a matter of common interest, do not depart until they have asked his permission. Indeed, those who ask your permission, [O Muhammad] - those are the ones who believe in Allah and His Messenger. So when they ask your permission for something of their affairs, then give permission to whom you will among them and ask forgiveness for them of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:57
item.description: Do not make [your] calling of the Messenger among yourselves as the call of one of you to another. Already Allah knows those of you who slip away, concealed by others. So let those beware who dissent from the Prophet's order, lest fitnah strike them or a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-24:58
item.description: Unquestionably, to Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Already He knows that upon which you [stand] and [knows] the Day when they will be returned to Him and He will inform them of what they have done. And Allah is Knowing of all things.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:1
item.description: Blessed is He who sent down the Criterion upon His Servant that he may be to the worlds a warner -

item.title: Al-Quran-25:2
item.description: He to whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and who has not taken a son and has not had a partner in dominion and has created each thing and determined it with [precise] determination.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:3
item.description: But they have taken besides Him gods which create nothing, while they are created, and possess not for themselves any harm or benefit and possess not [power to cause] death or life or resurrection.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:4
item.description: And those who disbelieve say, "This [Qur'an] is not except a falsehood he invented, and another people assisted him in it." But they have committed an injustice and a lie.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:5
item.description: Look how they strike for you comparisons; but they have strayed, so they cannot [find] a way.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:6
item.description: Blessed is He who, if He willed, could have made for you [something] better than that - gardens beneath which rivers flow - and could make for you palaces.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:7
item.description: But they have denied the Hour, and We have prepared for those who deny the Hour a Blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:8
item.description: When the Hellfire sees them from a distant place, they will hear its fury and roaring.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:9
item.description: And when they are thrown into a narrow place therein bound in chains, they will cry out thereupon for destruction.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:10
item.description: For them therein is whatever they wish, [while] abiding eternally. It is ever upon your Lord a promise [worthy to be] requested.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:11
item.description: So they will deny you, [disbelievers], in what you say, and you cannot avert [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you - We will make him taste a great punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:12
item.description: And We did not send before you, [O Muhammad], any of the messengers except that they ate food and walked in the markets. And We have made some of you [people] as trial for others - will you have patience? And ever is your Lord, Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:13
item.description: And We will regard what they have done of deeds and make them as dust dispersed.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:14
item.description: The companions of Paradise, that Day, are [in] a better settlement and better resting place.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:15
item.description: And [mention] the Day when the heaven will split open with [emerging] clouds, and the angels will be sent down in successive descent.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:16
item.description: True sovereignty, that Day, is for the Most Merciful. And it will be upon the disbelievers a difficult Day.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:17
item.description: Oh, woe to me! I wish I had not taken that one as a friend.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:18
item.description: And the Messenger has said, "O my Lord, indeed my people have taken this Qur'an as [a thing] abandoned."

item.title: Al-Quran-25:19
item.description: And thus have We made for every prophet an enemy from among the criminals. But sufficient is your Lord as a guide and a helper.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:20
item.description: And those who disbelieve say, "Why was the Qur'an not revealed to him all at once?" Thus [it is] that We may strengthen thereby your heart. And We have spaced it distinctly.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:21
item.description: And they do not come to you with an argument except that We bring you the truth and the best explanation.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:22
item.description: The ones who are gathered on their faces to Hell - those are the worst in position and farthest astray in [their] way.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:23
item.description: And We had certainly given Moses the Scripture and appointed with him his brother Aaron as an assistant.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:24
item.description: And the people of Noah - when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them for mankind a sign. And We have prepared for the wrongdoers a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:25
item.description: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud and the companions of the well and many generations between them.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:26
item.description: And for each We presented examples [as warnings], and each We destroyed with [total] destruction.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:27
item.description: And they have already come upon the town which was showered with a rain of evil. So have they not seen it? But they are not expecting resurrection.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:28
item.description: Have you seen the one who takes as his god his own desire? Then would you be responsible for him?

item.title: Al-Quran-25:29
item.description: Or do you think that most of them hear or reason? They are not except like livestock. Rather, they are [even] more astray in [their] way.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:30
item.description: Have you not considered your Lord - how He extends the shadow, and if He willed, He could have made it stationary? Then We made the sun for it an indication.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:31
item.description: Then We hold it in hand for a brief grasp.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:32
item.description: And it is He who has made the night for you as clothing and sleep [a means for] rest and has made the day a resurrection.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:33
item.description: And it is He who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy, and We send down from the sky pure water

item.title: Al-Quran-25:34
item.description: That We may bring to life thereby a dead land and give it as drink to those We created of numerous livestock and men.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:35
item.description: And We have certainly distributed it among them that they might be reminded, but most of the people refuse except disbelief.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:36
item.description: And if We had willed, We could have sent into every city a warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:37
item.description: So do not obey the disbelievers, and strive against them with the Qur'an a great striving.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:38
item.description: And it is He who has released [simultaneously] the two seas, one fresh and sweet and one salty and bitter, and He placed between them a barrier and prohibiting partition.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:39
item.description: And it is He who has created from water a human being and made him [a relative by] lineage and marriage. And ever is your Lord competent [concerning creation].

item.title: Al-Quran-25:40
item.description: But they worship rather than Allah that which does not benefit them or harm them, and the disbeliever is ever, against his Lord, an assistant [to Satan].

item.title: Al-Quran-25:41
item.description: And We have not sent you, [O Muhammad], except as a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:42
item.description: And rely upon the Ever-Living who does not die, and exalt [Allah] with His praise. And sufficient is He to be, with the sins of His servants, Acquainted -

item.title: Al-Quran-25:43
item.description: He who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six days and then established Himself above the Throne - the Most Merciful, so ask about Him one well informed.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:44
item.description: Blessed is He who has placed in the sky great stars and placed therein a [burning] lamp and luminous moon.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:45
item.description: And it is He who has made the night and the day in succession for whoever desires to remember or desires gratitude.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:46
item.description: And the servants of the Most Merciful are those who walk upon the earth easily, and when the ignorant address them [harshly], they say [words of] peace,

item.title: Al-Quran-25:47
item.description: And those who spend [part of] the night to their Lord prostrating and standing [in prayer]

item.title: Al-Quran-25:48
item.description: And [they are] those who, when they spend, do so not excessively or sparingly but are ever, between that, [justly] moderate

item.title: Al-Quran-25:49
item.description: And those who do not invoke with Allah another deity or kill the soul which Allah has forbidden [to be killed], except by right, and do not commit unlawful sexual intercourse. And whoever should do that will meet a penalty.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:50
item.description: Multiplied for him is the punishment on the Day of Resurrection, and he will abide therein humiliated -

item.title: Al-Quran-25:51
item.description: Except for those who repent, believe and do righteous work. For them Allah will replace their evil deeds with good. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:52
item.description: And he who repents and does righteousness does indeed turn to Allah with [accepted] repentance.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:53
item.description: And [they are] those who do not testify to falsehood, and when they pass near ill speech, they pass by with dignity.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:54
item.description: And those who, when reminded of the verses of their Lord, do not fall upon them deaf and blind.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:55
item.description: Those will be awarded the Chamber for what they patiently endured, and they will be received therein with greetings and [words of] peace.

item.title: Al-Quran-25:56
item.description: Abiding eternally therein. Good is the settlement and residence.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:1
item.description: Ta, Seen, Meem.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:2
item.description: These are the verses of the clear Book.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:3
item.description: Perhaps, [O Muhammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:4
item.description: If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:5
item.description: And no revelation comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:6
item.description: For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:7
item.description: Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:8
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:9
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:10
item.description: And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:11
item.description: Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers of the Lord of the worlds,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:12
item.description: [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"

item.title: Al-Quran-26:13
item.description: So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me wisdom and prophethood and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:14
item.description: [Pharaoh] said, "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

item.title: Al-Quran-26:15
item.description: So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:16
item.description: And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:17
item.description: So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:18
item.description: Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:19
item.description: So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-26:20
item.description: Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers

item.title: Al-Quran-26:21
item.description: And indeed, they are enraging us,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:22
item.description: So We removed them from gardens and springs

item.title: Al-Quran-26:23
item.description: And treasures and honorable station -

item.title: Al-Quran-26:24
item.description: Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:25
item.description: So they pursued them at sunrise.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:26
item.description: And We advanced thereto the pursuers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:27
item.description: And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:28
item.description: Then We drowned the others.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:29
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:30
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:31
item.description: And recite to them the news of Abraham,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:32
item.description: You and your ancient forefathers?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:33
item.description: Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:34
item.description: Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:35
item.description: And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:36
item.description: And when I am ill, it is He who cures me

item.title: Al-Quran-26:37
item.description: And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life

item.title: Al-Quran-26:38
item.description: And grant me a reputation of honor among later generations.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:39
item.description: And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:40
item.description: And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:41
item.description: And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -

item.title: Al-Quran-26:42
item.description: The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

item.title: Al-Quran-26:43
item.description: And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:44
item.description: And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:45
item.description: So they will be overturned into Hellfire, they and the deviators

item.title: Al-Quran-26:46
item.description: And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:47
item.description: They will say while they dispute therein,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:48
item.description: When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:49
item.description: And no one misguided us except the criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:50
item.description: So now we have no intercessors

item.title: Al-Quran-26:51
item.description: And not a devoted friend.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:52
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:53
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:54
item.description: The people of Noah denied the messengers

item.title: Al-Quran-26:55
item.description: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:56
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:57
item.description: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:58
item.description: Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:59
item.description: And I am not one to drive away the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:60
item.description: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:61
item.description: Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:62
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:63
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:64
item.description: 'Aad denied the messengers

item.title: Al-Quran-26:65
item.description: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:66
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:67
item.description: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:68
item.description: Do you construct on every elevation a sign, amusing yourselves,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:69
item.description: And take for yourselves palaces and fortresses that you might abide eternally?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:70
item.description: And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:71
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:72
item.description: And fear He who provided you with that which you know,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:73
item.description: Provided you with grazing livestock and children

item.title: Al-Quran-26:74
item.description: And gardens and springs.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:75
item.description: This is not but the custom of the former peoples,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:76
item.description: And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:77
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:78
item.description: Thamud denied the messengers

item.title: Al-Quran-26:79
item.description: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:80
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:81
item.description: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:82
item.description: Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],

item.title: Al-Quran-26:83
item.description: Within gardens and springs

item.title: Al-Quran-26:84
item.description: And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:85
item.description: And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:86
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:87
item.description: And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:88
item.description: But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:89
item.description: And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:90
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:91
item.description: The people of Lot denied the messengers

item.title: Al-Quran-26:92
item.description: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:93
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:94
item.description: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:95
item.description: Do you approach males among the worlds

item.title: Al-Quran-26:96
item.description: So We saved him and his family, all,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:97
item.description: Except an old woman among those who remained behind.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:98
item.description: Then We destroyed the others.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:99
item.description: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:100
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:101
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:102
item.description: The companions of the thicket denied the messengers

item.title: Al-Quran-26:103
item.description: When Shu'ayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allah?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:104
item.description: Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:105
item.description: So fear Allah and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:106
item.description: And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:107
item.description: Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:108
item.description: And weigh with an even balance.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:109
item.description: And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:110
item.description: You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:111
item.description: And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:112
item.description: Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:113
item.description: And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:114
item.description: And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:115
item.description: The Trustworthy Spirit has brought it down

item.title: Al-Quran-26:116
item.description: Upon your heart, [O Muhammad] - that you may be of the warners -

item.title: Al-Quran-26:117
item.description: In a clear Arabic language.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:118
item.description: And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:119
item.description: And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:120
item.description: And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners

item.title: Al-Quran-26:121
item.description: And he had recited it to them [perfectly], they would [still] not have been believers in it.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:122
item.description: Thus have We inserted disbelief into the hearts of the criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:123
item.description: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:124
item.description: And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:125
item.description: So for Our punishment are they impatient?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:126
item.description: Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years

item.title: Al-Quran-26:127
item.description: And then there came to them that which they were promised?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:128
item.description: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:129
item.description: And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners

item.title: Al-Quran-26:130
item.description: As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:131
item.description: And the devils have not brought the revelation down.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:132
item.description: It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:133
item.description: Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:134
item.description: So do not invoke with Allah another deity and [thus] be among the punished.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:135
item.description: And warn, [O Muhammad], your closest kindred.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:136
item.description: And lower your wing to those who follow you of the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:137
item.description: And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

item.title: Al-Quran-26:138
item.description: Who sees you when you arise

item.title: Al-Quran-26:139
item.description: And your movement among those who prostrate.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:140
item.description: Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:141
item.description: Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?

item.title: Al-Quran-26:142
item.description: They descend upon every sinful liar.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:143
item.description: They pass on what is heard, and most of them are liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-26:144
item.description: And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them;

item.title: Al-Quran-26:145
item.description: Do you not see that in every valley they roam

item.title: Al-Quran-26:146
item.description: And that they say what they do not do? -

item.title: Al-Quran-26:147
item.description: Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allah often and defend [the Muslims] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:1
item.description: Ta, Seen. These are the verses of the Qur'an and a clear Book

item.title: Al-Quran-27:2
item.description: As guidance and good tidings for the believers

item.title: Al-Quran-27:3
item.description: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and of the Hereafter they are certain [in faith].

item.title: Al-Quran-27:4
item.description: Indeed, for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have made pleasing to them their deeds, so they wander blindly.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:5
item.description: Those are the ones for whom there will be the worst of punishment, and in the Hereafter they are the greatest losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:6
item.description: And indeed, [O Muhammad], you receive the Qur'an from one Wise and Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:7
item.description: Otherwise, he who wrongs, then substitutes good after evil - indeed, I am Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:8
item.description: And they rejected them, while their [inner] selves were convinced thereof, out of injustice and haughtiness. So see how was the end of the corrupters.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:9
item.description: And gathered for Solomon were his soldiers of the jinn and men and birds, and they were [marching] in rows.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:10
item.description: Indeed, I found [there] a woman ruling them, and she has been given of all things, and she has a great throne.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:11
item.description: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah, and Satan has made their deeds pleasing to them and averted them from [His] way, so they are not guided,

item.title: Al-Quran-27:12
item.description: [And] so they do not prostrate to Allah, who brings forth what is hidden within the heavens and the earth and knows what you conceal and what you declare -

item.title: Al-Quran-27:13
item.description: Indeed, it is from Solomon, and indeed, it reads: 'In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful,

item.title: Al-Quran-27:14
item.description: Be not haughty with me but come to me in submission [as Muslims].' "

item.title: Al-Quran-27:15
item.description: And there were in the city nine family heads causing corruption in the land and not amending [its affairs].

item.title: Al-Quran-27:16
item.description: They said, "Take a mutual oath by Allah that we will kill him by night, he and his family. Then we will say to his executor, 'We did not witness the destruction of his family, and indeed, we are truthful.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-27:17
item.description: And they planned a plan, and We planned a plan, while they perceived not.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:18
item.description: Then look how was the outcome of their plan - that We destroyed them and their people, all.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:19
item.description: So those are their houses, desolate because of the wrong they had done. Indeed in that is a sign for people who know.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:20
item.description: And We saved those who believed and used to fear Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:21
item.description: So We saved him and his family, except for his wife; We destined her to be of those who remained behind.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:22
item.description: And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:23
item.description: [More precisely], is He [not best] who created the heavens and the earth and sent down for you rain from the sky, causing to grow thereby gardens of joyful beauty which you could not [otherwise] have grown the trees thereof? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but they are a people who ascribe equals [to Him].

item.title: Al-Quran-27:24
item.description: Is He [not best] who made the earth a stable ground and placed within it rivers and made for it firmly set mountains and placed between the two seas a barrier? Is there a deity with Allah? [No], but most of them do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:25
item.description: Is He [not best] who responds to the desperate one when he calls upon Him and removes evil and makes you inheritors of the earth? Is there a deity with Allah? Little do you remember.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:26
item.description: Is He [not best] who guides you through the darknesses of the land and sea and who sends the winds as good tidings before His mercy? Is there a deity with Allah? High is Allah above whatever they associate with Him.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:27
item.description: Rather, their knowledge is arrested concerning the Hereafter. Rather, they are in doubt about it. Rather, they are, concerning it, blind.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:28
item.description: And grieve not over them or be in distress from what they conspire.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:29
item.description: And indeed, your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:30
item.description: And there is nothing concealed within the heaven and the earth except that it is in a clear Register.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:31
item.description: Indeed, this Qur'an relates to the Children of Israel most of that over which they disagree.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:32
item.description: And indeed, it is guidance and mercy for the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:33
item.description: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them by His [wise] judgement. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:34
item.description: So rely upon Allah; indeed, you are upon the clear truth.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:35
item.description: Indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they have turned their backs retreating.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:36
item.description: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [submitting to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-27:37
item.description: And when the word befalls them, We will bring forth for them a creature from the earth speaking to them, [saying] that the people were, of Our verses, not certain [in faith].

item.title: Al-Quran-27:38
item.description: And [warn of] the Day when We will gather from every nation a company of those who deny Our signs, and they will be [driven] in rows

item.title: Al-Quran-27:39
item.description: And the decree will befall them for the wrong they did, and they will not [be able to] speak.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:40
item.description: Do they not see that We made the night that they may rest therein and the day giving sight? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:41
item.description: And [warn of] the Day the Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and whoever is on the earth will be terrified except whom Allah wills. And all will come to Him humbled.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:42
item.description: And you see the mountains, thinking them rigid, while they will pass as the passing of clouds. [It is] the work of Allah, who perfected all things. Indeed, He is Acquainted with that which you do.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:43
item.description: Whoever comes [at Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it, and they, from the terror of that Day, will be safe.

item.title: Al-Quran-27:44
item.description: And to recite the Qur'an." And whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] himself; and whoever strays - say, "I am only [one] of the warners."

item.title: Al-Quran-28:1
item.description: Ta, Seen, Meem.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:2
item.description: These are the verses of the clear Book.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:3
item.description: We recite to you from the news of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:4
item.description: Indeed, Pharaoh exalted himself in the land and made its people into factions, oppressing a sector among them, slaughtering their [newborn] sons and keeping their females alive. Indeed, he was of the corrupters.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:5
item.description: And We wanted to confer favor upon those who were oppressed in the land and make them leaders and make them inheritors

item.title: Al-Quran-28:6
item.description: And establish them in the land and show Pharaoh and [his minister] Haman and their soldiers through them that which they had feared.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:7
item.description: And the family of Pharaoh picked him up [out of the river] so that he would become to them an enemy and a [cause of] grief. Indeed, Pharaoh and Haman and their soldiers were deliberate sinners.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:8
item.description: And the heart of Moses' mother became empty [of all else]. She was about to disclose [the matter concerning] him had We not bound fast her heart that she would be of the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:9
item.description: So We restored him to his mother that she might be content and not grieve and that she would know that the promise of Allah is true. But most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:10
item.description: And when he attained his full strength and was [mentally] mature, We bestowed upon him judgement and knowledge. And thus do We reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:11
item.description: And he was arrogant, he and his soldiers, in the land, without right, and they thought that they would not be returned to Us.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:12
item.description: So We took him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. So see how was the end of the wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:13
item.description: And We made them leaders inviting to the Fire, and on the Day of Resurrection they will not be helped.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:14
item.description: And We caused to overtake them in this world a curse, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be of the despised.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:15
item.description: And We gave Moses the Scripture, after We had destroyed the former generations, as enlightenment for the people and guidance and mercy that they might be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:16
item.description: And you, [O Muhammad], were not on the western side [of the mount] when We revealed to Moses the command, and you were not among the witnesses [to that].

item.title: Al-Quran-28:17
item.description: But We produced [many] generations [after Moses], and prolonged was their duration. And you were not a resident among the people of Madyan, reciting to them Our verses, but We were senders [of this message].

item.title: Al-Quran-28:18
item.description: And you were not at the side of the mount when We called [Moses] but [were sent] as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner had come before you that they might be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:19
item.description: But if they do not respond to you - then know that they only follow their [own] desires. And who is more astray than one who follows his desire without guidance from Allah? Indeed, Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:20
item.description: And We have [repeatedly] conveyed to them the Qur'an that they might be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:21
item.description: Those to whom We gave the Scripture before it - they are believers in it.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:22
item.description: Those will be given their reward twice for what they patiently endured and [because] they avert evil through good, and from what We have provided them they spend.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:23
item.description: Indeed, [O Muhammad], you do not guide whom you like, but Allah guides whom He wills. And He is most knowing of the [rightly] guided.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:24
item.description: And how many a city have We destroyed that was insolent in its [way of] living, and those are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them except briefly. And it is We who were the inheritors.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:25
item.description: And never would your Lord have destroyed the cities until He had sent to their mother a messenger reciting to them Our verses. And We would not destroy the cities except while their people were wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:26
item.description: And whatever thing you [people] have been given - it is [only for] the enjoyment of worldly life and its adornment. And what is with Allah is better and more lasting; so will you not use reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-28:27
item.description: Then is he whom We have promised a good promise which he will obtain like he for whom We provided enjoyment of worldly life [but] then he is, on the Day of Resurrection, among those presented [for punishment in Hell]?

item.title: Al-Quran-28:28
item.description: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are My 'partners' which you used to claim?"

item.title: Al-Quran-28:29
item.description: And it will be said, "Invoke your 'partners' " and they will invoke them; but they will not respond to them, and they will see the punishment. If only they had followed guidance!

item.title: Al-Quran-28:30
item.description: But the information will be unapparent to them that Day, so they will not [be able to] ask one another.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:31
item.description: But as for one who had repented, believed, and done righteousness, it is promised by Allah that he will be among the successful.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:32
item.description: And your Lord creates what He wills and chooses; not for them was the choice. Exalted is Allah and high above what they associate with Him.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:33
item.description: And your Lord knows what their breasts conceal and what they declare.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:34
item.description: And He is Allah; there is no deity except Him. To Him is [due all] praise in the first [life] and the Hereafter. And His is the [final] decision, and to Him you will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:35
item.description: And out of His mercy He made for you the night and the day that you may rest therein and [by day] seek from His bounty and [that] perhaps you will be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:36
item.description: And [warn of] the Day He will call them and say, "Where are my 'partners' which you used to claim?"

item.title: Al-Quran-28:37
item.description: And We caused the earth to swallow him and his home. And there was for him no company to aid him other than Allah, nor was he of those who [could] defend themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:38
item.description: That home of the Hereafter We assign to those who do not desire exaltedness upon the earth or corruption. And the [best] outcome is for the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:39
item.description: Whoever comes [on the Day of Judgement] with a good deed will have better than it; and whoever comes with an evil deed - then those who did evil deeds will not be recompensed except [as much as] what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:40
item.description: Indeed, [O Muhammad], He who imposed upon you the Qur'an will take you back to a place of return. Say, "My Lord is most knowing of who brings guidance and who is in clear error."

item.title: Al-Quran-28:41
item.description: And you were not expecting that the Book would be conveyed to you, but [it is] a mercy from your Lord. So do not be an assistant to the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:42
item.description: And never let them avert you from the verses of Allah after they have been revealed to you. And invite [people] to your Lord. And never be of those who associate others with Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-28:43
item.description: And do not invoke with Allah another deity. There is no deity except Him. Everything will be destroyed except His Face. His is the judgement, and to Him you will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Meem

item.title: Al-Quran-29:2
item.description: But We have certainly tried those before them, and Allah will surely make evident those who are truthful, and He will surely make evident the liars.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:3
item.description: Or do those who do evil deeds think they can outrun Us? Evil is what they judge.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:4
item.description: Whoever should hope for the meeting with Allah - indeed, the term decreed by Allah is coming. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:5
item.description: And whoever strives only strives for [the benefit of] himself. Indeed, Allah is free from need of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:6
item.description: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely remove from them their misdeeds and will surely reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:7
item.description: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to parents. But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them. To Me is your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:8
item.description: And those who believe and do righteous deeds - We will surely admit them among the righteous [into Paradise].

item.title: Al-Quran-29:9
item.description: And Allah will surely make evident those who believe, and He will surely make evident the hypocrites.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:10
item.description: But they will surely carry their [own] burdens and [other] burdens along with their burdens, and they will surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection about what they used to invent.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:11
item.description: And We certainly sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them a thousand years minus fifty years, and the flood seized them while they were wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:12
item.description: But We saved him and the companions of the ship, and We made it a sign for the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:13
item.description: And if you [people] deny [the message] - already nations before you have denied. And there is not upon the Messenger except [the duty of] clear notification.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:14
item.description: Have they not considered how Allah begins creation and then repeats it? Indeed that, for Allah, is easy.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:15
item.description: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy upon whom He wills, and to Him you will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:16
item.description: And you will not cause failure [to Allah] upon the earth or in the heaven. And you have not other than Allah any protector or any helper.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:17
item.description: And the ones who disbelieve in the signs of Allah and the meeting with Him - those have despaired of My mercy, and they will have a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:18
item.description: And the answer of Abraham's people was not but that they said, "Kill him or burn him," but Allah saved him from the fire. Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:19
item.description: And We gave to Him Isaac and Jacob and placed in his descendants prophethood and scripture. And We gave him his reward in this world, and indeed, he is in the Hereafter among the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:20
item.description: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, "Indeed, we will destroy the people of that Lot's city. Indeed, its people have been wrongdoers."

item.title: Al-Quran-29:21
item.description: And We have certainly left of it a sign as clear evidence for a people who use reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:22
item.description: And to Madyan [We sent] their brother Shu'ayb, and he said, "O my people, worship Allah and expect the Last Day and do not commit abuse on the earth, spreading corruption."

item.title: Al-Quran-29:23
item.description: But they denied him, so the earthquake seized them, and they became within their home [corpses] fallen prone.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:24
item.description: And [We destroyed] 'Aad and Thamud, and it has become clear to you from their [ruined] dwellings. And Satan had made pleasing to them their deeds and averted them from the path, and they were endowed with perception.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:25
item.description: And [We destroyed] Qarun and Pharaoh and Haman. And Moses had already come to them with clear evidences, and they were arrogant in the land, but they were not outrunners [of Our punishment].

item.title: Al-Quran-29:26
item.description: So each We seized for his sin; and among them were those upon whom We sent a storm of stones, and among them were those who were seized by the blast [from the sky], and among them were those whom We caused the earth to swallow, and among them were those whom We drowned. And Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who were wronging themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:27
item.description: The example of those who take allies other than Allah is like that of the spider who takes a home. And indeed, the weakest of homes is the home of the spider, if they only knew.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:28
item.description: Indeed, Allah knows whatever thing they call upon other than Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:29
item.description: And these examples We present to the people, but none will understand them except those of knowledge.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:30
item.description: Allah created the heavens and the earth in truth. Indeed in that is a sign for the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:31
item.description: Recite, [O Muhammad], what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, prayer prohibits immorality and wrongdoing, and the remembrance of Allah is greater. And Allah knows that which you do.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:32
item.description: And thus We have sent down to you the Qur'an. And those to whom We [previously] gave the Scripture believe in it. And among these [people of Makkah] are those who believe in it. And none reject Our verses except the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:33
item.description: And you did not recite before it any scripture, nor did you inscribe one with your right hand. Otherwise the falsifiers would have had [cause for] doubt.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:34
item.description: Rather, the Qur'an is distinct verses [preserved] within the breasts of those who have been given knowledge. And none reject Our verses except the wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:35
item.description: And is it not sufficient for them that We revealed to you the Book which is recited to them? Indeed in that is a mercy and reminder for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:36
item.description: And they urge you to hasten the punishment. And if not for [the decree of] a specified term, punishment would have reached them. But it will surely come to them suddenly while they perceive not.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:37
item.description: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And indeed, Hell will be encompassing of the disbelievers

item.title: Al-Quran-29:38
item.description: O My servants who have believed, indeed My earth is spacious, so worship only Me.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:39
item.description: Every soul will taste death. Then to Us will you be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:40
item.description: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - We will surely assign to them of Paradise [elevated] chambers beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Excellent is the reward of the [righteous] workers

item.title: Al-Quran-29:41
item.description: Who have been patient and upon their Lord rely.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:42
item.description: And how many a creature carries not its [own] provision. Allah provides for it and for you. And He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:43
item.description: Allah extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts for him. Indeed Allah is, of all things, Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:44
item.description: And this worldly life is not but diversion and amusement. And indeed, the home of the Hereafter - that is the [eternal] life, if only they knew.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:45
item.description: And when they board a ship, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, at once they associate others with Him

item.title: Al-Quran-29:46
item.description: So that they will deny what We have granted them, and they will enjoy themselves. But they are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-29:47
item.description: Have they not seen that We made [Makkah] a safe sanctuary, while people are being taken away all around them? Then in falsehood do they believe, and in the favor of Allah they disbelieve?

item.title: Al-Quran-29:48
item.description: And who is more unjust than one who invents a lie about Allah or denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a [sufficient] residence for the disbelievers?

item.title: Al-Quran-29:49
item.description: And those who strive for Us - We will surely guide them to Our ways. And indeed, Allah is with the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Meem.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:2
item.description: The Byzantines have been defeated

item.title: Al-Quran-30:3
item.description: In the nearest land. But they, after their defeat, will overcome.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:4
item.description: Within three to nine years. To Allah belongs the command before and after. And that day the believers will rejoice

item.title: Al-Quran-30:5
item.description: In the victory of Allah. He gives victory to whom He wills, and He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:6
item.description: [It is] the promise of Allah. Allah does not fail in His promise, but most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:7
item.description: They know what is apparent of the worldly life, but they, of the Hereafter, are unaware.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:8
item.description: Do they not contemplate within themselves? Allah has not created the heavens and the earth and what is between them except in truth and for a specified term. And indeed, many of the people, in [the matter of] the meeting with their Lord, are disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:9
item.description: Have they not traveled through the earth and observed how was the end of those before them? They were greater than them in power, and they plowed the earth and built it up more than they have built it up, and their messengers came to them with clear evidences. And Allah would not ever have wronged them, but they were wronging themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:10
item.description: Then the end of those who did evil was the worst [consequence] because they denied the signs of Allah and used to ridicule them.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:11
item.description: Allah begins creation; then He will repeat it; then to Him you will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:12
item.description: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will be in despair.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:13
item.description: And there will not be for them among their [alleged] partners any intercessors, and they will [then] be disbelievers in their partners.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:14
item.description: And the Day the Hour appears - that Day they will become separated.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:15
item.description: And as for those who had believed and done righteous deeds, they will be in a garden [of Paradise], delighted.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:16
item.description: But as for those who disbelieved and denied Our verses and the meeting of the Hereafter, those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

item.title: Al-Quran-30:17
item.description: So exalted is Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:18
item.description: And to Him is [due all] praise throughout the heavens and the earth. And [exalted is He] at night and when you are at noon.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:19
item.description: He brings the living out of the dead and brings the dead out of the living and brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. And thus will you be brought out.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:20
item.description: And of His signs is that He created you from dust; then, suddenly you were human beings dispersing [throughout the earth].

item.title: Al-Quran-30:21
item.description: And of His signs is that He created for you from yourselves mates that you may find tranquillity in them; and He placed between you affection and mercy. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:22
item.description: And of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your languages and your colors. Indeed in that are signs for those of knowledge.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:23
item.description: And of His signs is your sleep by night and day and your seeking of His bounty. Indeed in that are signs for a people who listen.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:24
item.description: And of His signs is [that] He shows you the lightning [causing] fear and aspiration, and He sends down rain from the sky by which He brings to life the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed in that are signs for a people who use reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:25
item.description: And of His signs is that the heaven and earth remain by His command. Then when He calls you with a [single] call from the earth, immediately you will come forth.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:26
item.description: And to Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and earth. All are to Him devoutly obedient.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:27
item.description: And it is He who begins creation; then He repeats it, and that is [even] easier for Him. To Him belongs the highest attribute in the heavens and earth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:28
item.description: He presents to you an example from yourselves. Do you have among those whom your right hands possess any partners in what We have provided for you so that you are equal therein [and] would fear them as your fear of one another [within a partnership]? Thus do We detail the verses for a people who use reason.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:29
item.description: But those who wrong follow their [own] desires without knowledge. Then who can guide one whom Allah has sent astray? And for them there are no helpers.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:30
item.description: So direct your face toward the religion, inclining to truth. [Adhere to] the fitrah of Allah upon which He has created [all] people. No change should there be in the creation of Allah. That is the correct religion, but most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:31
item.description: [Adhere to it], turning in repentance to Him, and fear Him and establish prayer and do not be of those who associate others with Allah

item.title: Al-Quran-30:32
item.description: [Or] of those who have divided their religion and become sects, every faction rejoicing in what it has.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:33
item.description: And when adversity touches the people, they call upon their Lord, turning in repentance to Him. Then when He lets them taste mercy from Him, at once a party of them associate others with their Lord,

item.title: Al-Quran-30:34
item.description: So that they will deny what We have granted them. Then enjoy yourselves, for you are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:35
item.description: Or have We sent down to them an authority, and it speaks of what they were associating with Him?

item.title: Al-Quran-30:36
item.description: And when We let the people taste mercy, they rejoice therein, but if evil afflicts them for what their hands have put forth, immediately they despair.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:37
item.description: Do they not see that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed, in that are signs for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:38
item.description: So give the relative his right, as well as the needy and the traveler. That is best for those who desire the countenance of Allah, and it is they who will be the successful.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:39
item.description: And whatever you give for interest to increase within the wealth of people will not increase with Allah. But what you give in zakah, desiring the countenance of Allah - those are the multipliers.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:40
item.description: Corruption has appeared throughout the land and sea by [reason of] what the hands of people have earned so He may let them taste part of [the consequence of] what they have done that perhaps they will return [to righteousness].

item.title: Al-Quran-30:41
item.description: So direct your face toward the correct religion before a Day comes from Allah of which there is no repelling. That Day, they will be divided.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:42
