item.description: Whoever disbelieves - upon him is [the consequence of] his disbelief. And whoever does righteousness - they are for themselves preparing,

item.title: Al-Quran-30:43
item.description: That He may reward those who have believed and done righteous deeds out of His bounty. Indeed, He does not like the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:44
item.description: And of His signs is that He sends the winds as bringers of good tidings and to let you taste His mercy and so the ships may sail at His command and so you may seek of His bounty, and perhaps you will be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:45
item.description: And We have already sent messengers before you to their peoples, and they came to them with clear evidences; then We took retribution from those who committed crimes, and incumbent upon Us was support of the believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:46
item.description: It is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds and spread them in the sky however He wills, and He makes them fragments so you see the rain emerge from within them. And when He causes it to fall upon whom He wills of His servants, immediately they rejoice

item.title: Al-Quran-30:47
item.description: Although they were, before it was sent down upon them - before that, in despair.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:48
item.description: So observe the effects of the mercy of Allah - how He gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. Indeed, that [same one] will give life to the dead, and He is over all things competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:49
item.description: But if We should send a [bad] wind and they saw [their crops] turned yellow, they would remain thereafter disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:50
item.description: So indeed, you will not make the dead hear, nor will you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs, retreating.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:51
item.description: And you cannot guide the blind away from their error. You will only make hear those who believe in Our verses so they are Muslims [in submission to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-30:52
item.description: Allah is the one who created you from weakness, then made after weakness strength, then made after strength weakness and white hair. He creates what He wills, and He is the Knowing, the Competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:53
item.description: And the Day the Hour appears the criminals will swear they had remained but an hour. Thus they were deluded.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:54
item.description: But those who were given knowledge and faith will say, "You remained the extent of Allah 's decree until the Day of Resurrection, and this is the Day of Resurrection, but you did not used to know."

item.title: Al-Quran-30:55
item.description: So that Day, their excuse will not benefit those who wronged, nor will they be asked to appease [Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-30:56
item.description: And We have certainly presented to the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example. But, [O Muhammad], if you should bring them a sign, the disbelievers will surely say, "You [believers] are but falsifiers."

item.title: Al-Quran-30:57
item.description: Thus does Allah seal the hearts of those who do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-30:58
item.description: So be patient. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth. And let them not disquiet you who are not certain [in faith].

item.title: Al-Quran-31:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Meem.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:2
item.description: These are verses of the wise Book,

item.title: Al-Quran-31:3
item.description: As guidance and mercy for the doers of good

item.title: Al-Quran-31:4
item.description: Who establish prayer and give zakah, and they, of the Hereafter, are certain [in faith].

item.title: Al-Quran-31:5
item.description: Those are on [right] guidance from their Lord, and it is those who are the successful.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:6
item.description: And of the people is he who buys the amusement of speech to mislead [others] from the way of Allah without knowledge and who takes it in ridicule. Those will have a humiliating punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:7
item.description: And when our verses are recited to him, he turns away arrogantly as if he had not heard them, as if there was in his ears deafness. So give him tidings of a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:8
item.description: Indeed, those who believe and do righteous deeds - for them are the Gardens of Pleasure.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:9
item.description: Wherein they abide eternally; [it is] the promise of Allah [which is] truth. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:10
item.description: He created the heavens without pillars that you see and has cast into the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shift with you, and dispersed therein from every creature. And We sent down rain from the sky and made grow therein [plants] of every noble kind.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:11
item.description: This is the creation of Allah. So show Me what those other than Him have created. Rather, the wrongdoers are in clear error.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:12
item.description: And We have enjoined upon man [care] for his parents. His mother carried him, [increasing her] in weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:13
item.description: But if they endeavor to make you associate with Me that of which you have no knowledge, do not obey them but accompany them in [this] world with appropriate kindness and follow the way of those who turn back to Me [in repentance]. Then to Me will be your return, and I will inform you about what you used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:14
item.description: O my son, establish prayer, enjoin what is right, forbid what is wrong, and be patient over what befalls you. Indeed, [all] that is of the matters [requiring] determination.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:15
item.description: And do not turn your cheek [in contempt] toward people and do not walk through the earth exultantly. Indeed, Allah does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:16
item.description: Do you not see that Allah has made subject to you whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth and amply bestowed upon you His favors, [both] apparent and unapparent? But of the people is he who disputes about Allah without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book [from Him].

item.title: Al-Quran-31:17
item.description: And whoever submits his face to Allah while he is a doer of good - then he has grasped the most trustworthy handhold. And to Allah will be the outcome of [all] matters.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:18
item.description: And whoever has disbelieved - let not his disbelief grieve you. To Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of that within the breasts.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:19
item.description: We grant them enjoyment for a little; then We will force them to a massive punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:20
item.description: To Allah belongs whatever is in the heavens and earth. Indeed, Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:21
item.description: And if whatever trees upon the earth were pens and the sea [was ink], replenished thereafter by seven [more] seas, the words of Allah would not be exhausted. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:22
item.description: Your creation and your resurrection will not be but as that of a single soul. Indeed, Allah is Hearing and Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:23
item.description: Do you not see that Allah causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term, and that Allah, with whatever you do, is Acquainted?

item.title: Al-Quran-31:24
item.description: That is because Allah is the Truth, and that what they call upon other than Him is falsehood, and because Allah is the Most High, the Grand.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:25
item.description: Do you not see that ships sail through the sea by the favor of Allah that He may show you of His signs? Indeed in that are signs for everyone patient and grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:26
item.description: And when waves come over them like canopies, they supplicate Allah, sincere to Him in religion. But when He delivers them to the land, there are [some] of them who are moderate [in faith]. And none rejects Our signs except everyone treacherous and ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:27
item.description: O mankind, fear your Lord and fear a Day when no father will avail his son, nor will a son avail his father at all. Indeed, the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.

item.title: Al-Quran-31:28
item.description: Indeed, Allah [alone] has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:1
item.description: Alif, Lam, Meem.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:2
item.description: [This is] the revelation of the Book about which there is no doubt from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:3
item.description: It is Allah who created the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them in six days; then He established Himself above the Throne. You have not besides Him any protector or any intercessor; so will you not be reminded?

item.title: Al-Quran-32:4
item.description: He arranges [each] matter from the heaven to the earth; then it will ascend to Him in a Day, the extent of which is a thousand years of those which you count.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:5
item.description: That is the Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

item.title: Al-Quran-32:6
item.description: Who perfected everything which He created and began the creation of man from clay.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:7
item.description: Then He made his posterity out of the extract of a liquid disdained.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:8
item.description: Then He proportioned him and breathed into him from His [created] soul and made for you hearing and vision and hearts; little are you grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:9
item.description: Only those believe in Our verses who, when they are reminded by them, fall down in prostration and exalt [Allah] with praise of their Lord, and they are not arrogant.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:10
item.description: They arise from [their] beds; they supplicate their Lord in fear and aspiration, and from what We have provided them, they spend.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:11
item.description: And no soul knows what has been hidden for them of comfort for eyes as reward for what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:12
item.description: Then is one who was a believer like one who was defiantly disobedient? They are not equal.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:13
item.description: As for those who believed and did righteous deeds, for them will be the Gardens of Refuge as accommodation for what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:14
item.description: And we will surely let them taste the nearer punishment short of the greater punishment that perhaps they will repent.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:15
item.description: And who is more unjust than one who is reminded of the verses of his Lord; then he turns away from them? Indeed We, from the criminals, will take retribution.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:16
item.description: And We certainly gave Moses the Scripture, so do not be in doubt over his meeting. And we made the Torah guidance for the Children of Israel.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:17
item.description: And We made from among them leaders guiding by Our command when they were patient and [when] they were certain of Our signs.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:18
item.description: Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

item.title: Al-Quran-32:19
item.description: Has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them, [as] they walk among their dwellings? Indeed in that are signs; then do they not hear?

item.title: Al-Quran-32:20
item.description: Have they not seen that We drive the water [in clouds] to barren land and bring forth thereby crops from which their livestock eat and [they] themselves? Then do they not see?

item.title: Al-Quran-32:21
item.description: So turn away from them and wait. Indeed, they are waiting.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:1
item.description: O Prophet, fear Allah and do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:2
item.description: And follow that which is revealed to you from your Lord. Indeed Allah is ever, with what you do, Acquainted.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:3
item.description: And rely upon Allah; and sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:4
item.description: Allah has not made for a man two hearts in his interior. And He has not made your wives whom you declare unlawful your mothers. And he has not made your adopted sons your [true] sons. That is [merely] your saying by your mouths, but Allah says the truth, and He guides to the [right] way.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:5
item.description: Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of Allah. But if you do not know their fathers - then they are [still] your brothers in religion and those entrusted to you. And there is no blame upon you for that in which you have erred but [only for] what your hearts intended. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:6
item.description: The Prophet is more worthy of the believers than themselves, and his wives are [in the position of] their mothers. And those of [blood] relationship are more entitled [to inheritance] in the decree of Allah than the [other] believers and the emigrants, except that you may do to your close associates a kindness [through bequest]. That was in the Book inscribed.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:7
item.description: And [mention, O Muhammad], when We took from the prophets their covenant and from you and from Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, the son of Mary; and We took from them a solemn covenant.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:8
item.description: That He may question the truthful about their truth. And He has prepared for the disbelievers a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:9
item.description: O you who have believed, remember the favor of Allah upon you when armies came to [attack] you and We sent upon them a wind and armies [of angels] you did not see. And ever is Allah, of what you do, Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:10
item.description: [Remember] when they came at you from above you and from below you, and when eyes shifted [in fear], and hearts reached the throats and you assumed about Allah [various] assumptions.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:11
item.description: There the believers were tested and shaken with a severe shaking.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:12
item.description: And if they had been entered upon from all its [surrounding] regions and fitnah had been demanded of them, they would have done it and not hesitated over it except briefly.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:13
item.description: And they had already promised Allah before not to turn their backs and flee. And ever is the promise to Allah [that about which one will be] questioned.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:14
item.description: Indisposed toward you. And when fear comes, you see them looking at you, their eyes revolving like one being overcome by death. But when fear departs, they lash you with sharp tongues, indisposed toward [any] good. Those have not believed, so Allah has rendered their deeds worthless, and ever is that, for Allah, easy.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:15
item.description: They think the companies have not [yet] withdrawn. And if the companies should come [again], they would wish they were in the desert among the bedouins, inquiring [from afar] about your news. And if they should be among you, they would not fight except for a little.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:16
item.description: There has certainly been for you in the Messenger of Allah an excellent pattern for anyone whose hope is in Allah and the Last Day and [who] remembers Allah often.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:17
item.description: Among the believers are men true to what they promised Allah. Among them is he who has fulfilled his vow [to the death], and among them is he who awaits [his chance]. And they did not alter [the terms of their commitment] by any alteration -

item.title: Al-Quran-33:18
item.description: That Allah may reward the truthful for their truth and punish the hypocrites if He wills or accept their repentance. Indeed, Allah is ever Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:19
item.description: And Allah repelled those who disbelieved, in their rage, not having obtained any good. And sufficient was Allah for the believers in battle, and ever is Allah Powerful and Exalted in Might.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:20
item.description: And He brought down those who supported them among the People of the Scripture from their fortresses and cast terror into their hearts [so that] a party you killed, and you took captive a party.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:21
item.description: And He caused you to inherit their land and their homes and their properties and a land which you have not trodden. And ever is Allah, over all things, competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:22
item.description: O wives of the Prophet, whoever of you should commit a clear immorality - for her the punishment would be doubled two fold, and ever is that, for Allah, easy.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:23
item.description: And whoever of you devoutly obeys Allah and His Messenger and does righteousness - We will give her her reward twice; and We have prepared for her a noble provision.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:24
item.description: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like anyone among women. If you fear Allah, then do not be soft in speech [to men], lest he in whose heart is disease should covet, but speak with appropriate speech.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:25
item.description: And abide in your houses and do not display yourselves as [was] the display of the former times of ignorance. And establish prayer and give zakah and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah intends only to remove from you the impurity [of sin], O people of the [Prophet's] household, and to purify you with [extensive] purification.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:26
item.description: And remember what is recited in your houses of the verses of Allah and wisdom. Indeed, Allah is ever Subtle and Acquainted [with all things].

item.title: Al-Quran-33:27
item.description: Indeed, the Muslim men and Muslim women, the believing men and believing women, the obedient men and obedient women, the truthful men and truthful women, the patient men and patient women, the humble men and humble women, the charitable men and charitable women, the fasting men and fasting women, the men who guard their private parts and the women who do so, and the men who remember Allah often and the women who do so - for them Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:28
item.description: It is not for a believing man or a believing woman, when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter, that they should [thereafter] have any choice about their affair. And whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly strayed into clear error.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:29
item.description: There is not to be upon the Prophet any discomfort concerning that which Allah has imposed upon him. [This is] the established way of Allah with those [prophets] who have passed on before. And ever is the command of Allah a destiny decreed.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:30
item.description: [Allah praises] those who convey the messages of Allah and fear Him and do not fear anyone but Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Accountant.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:31
item.description: Muhammad is not the father of [any] one of your men, but [he is] the Messenger of Allah and last of the prophets. And ever is Allah, of all things, Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:32
item.description: O you who have believed, remember Allah with much remembrance

item.title: Al-Quran-33:33
item.description: And exalt Him morning and afternoon.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:34
item.description: It is He who confers blessing upon you, and His angels [ask Him to do so] that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And ever is He, to the believers, Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:35
item.description: O Prophet, indeed We have sent you as a witness and a bringer of good tidings and a warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:36
item.description: And one who invites to Allah, by His permission, and an illuminating lamp.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:37
item.description: And give good tidings to the believers that they will have from Allah great bounty.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:38
item.description: And do not obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites but do not harm them, and rely upon Allah. And sufficient is Allah as Disposer of affairs.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:39
item.description: O You who have believed, when you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is not for you any waiting period to count concerning them. So provide for them and give them a gracious release.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:40
item.description: O Prophet, indeed We have made lawful to you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation and those your right hand possesses from what Allah has returned to you [of captives] and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman if she gives herself to the Prophet [and] if the Prophet wishes to marry her, [this is] only for you, excluding the [other] believers. We certainly know what We have made obligatory upon them concerning their wives and those their right hands possess, [but this is for you] in order that there will be upon you no discomfort. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:41
item.description: You, [O Muhammad], may put aside whom you will of them or take to yourself whom you will. And any that you desire of those [wives] from whom you had [temporarily] separated - there is no blame upon you [in returning her]. That is more suitable that they should be content and not grieve and that they should be satisfied with what you have given them - all of them. And Allah knows what is in your hearts. And ever is Allah Knowing and Forbearing.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:42
item.description: Not lawful to you, [O Muhammad], are [any additional] women after [this], nor [is it] for you to exchange them for [other] wives, even if their beauty were to please you, except what your right hand possesses. And ever is Allah, over all things, an Observer.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:43
item.description: O you who have believed, do not enter the houses of the Prophet except when you are permitted for a meal, without awaiting its readiness. But when you are invited, then enter; and when you have eaten, disperse without seeking to remain for conversation. Indeed, that [behavior] was troubling the Prophet, and he is shy of [dismissing] you. But Allah is not shy of the truth. And when you ask [his wives] for something, ask them from behind a partition. That is purer for your hearts and their hearts. And it is not [conceivable or lawful] for you to harm the Messenger of Allah or to marry his wives after him, ever. Indeed, that would be in the sight of Allah an enormity.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:44
item.description: Whether you reveal a thing or conceal it, indeed Allah is ever, of all things, Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:45
item.description: There is no blame upon women concerning their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their brothers' sons or their sisters' sons or their women or those their right hands possess. And fear Allah. Indeed Allah is ever, over all things, Witness.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:46
item.description: Indeed, Allah confers blessing upon the Prophet, and His angels [ask Him to do so]. O you who have believed, ask [Allah to confer] blessing upon him and ask [Allah to grant him] peace.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:47
item.description: Indeed, those who abuse Allah and His Messenger - Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter and prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:48
item.description: And those who harm believing men and believing women for [something] other than what they have earned have certainly born upon themselves a slander and manifest sin.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:49
item.description: O Prophet, tell your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. That is more suitable that they will be known and not be abused. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:50
item.description: If the hypocrites and those in whose hearts is disease and those who spread rumors in al-Madinah do not cease, We will surely incite you against them; then they will not remain your neighbors therein except for a little.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:51
item.description: Accursed wherever they are found, [being] seized and massacred completely.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:52
item.description: [This is] the established way of Allah with those who passed on before; and you will not find in the way of Allah any change.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:53
item.description: Indeed, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and prepared for them a Blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:54
item.description: Abiding therein forever, they will not find a protector or a helper.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:55
item.description: O you who have believed, be not like those who abused Moses; then Allah cleared him of what they said. And he, in the sight of Allah, was distinguished.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:56
item.description: O you who have believed, fear Allah and speak words of appropriate justice.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:57
item.description: He will [then] amend for you your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:58
item.description: Indeed, we offered the Trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, and they declined to bear it and feared it; but man [undertook to] bear it. Indeed, he was unjust and ignorant.

item.title: Al-Quran-33:59
item.description: [It was] so that Allah may punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women and the men and women who associate others with Him and that Allah may accept repentance from the believing men and believing women. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:1
item.description: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. And He is the Wise, the Acquainted.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:2
item.description: He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:3
item.description: But those who disbelieve say, "The Hour will not come to us." Say, "Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. [Allah is] the Knower of the unseen." Not absent from Him is an atom's weight within the heavens or within the earth or [what is] smaller than that or greater, except that it is in a clear register -

item.title: Al-Quran-34:4
item.description: That He may reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. Those will have forgiveness and noble provision.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:5
item.description: But those who strive against Our verses [seeking] to cause failure - for them will be a painful punishment of foul nature.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:6
item.description: And those who have been given knowledge see that what is revealed to you from your Lord is the truth, and it guides to the path of the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:7
item.description: Then, do they not look at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We should will, We could cause the earth to swallow them or [could] let fall upon them fragments from the sky. Indeed in that is a sign for every servant turning back [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-34:8
item.description: And to Solomon [We subjected] the wind - its morning [journey was that of] a month - and its afternoon [journey was that of] a month, and We made flow for him a spring of [liquid] copper. And among the jinn were those who worked for him by the permission of his Lord. And whoever deviated among them from Our command - We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:9
item.description: And when We decreed for Solomon death, nothing indicated to the jinn his death except a creature of the earth eating his staff. But when he fell, it became clear to the jinn that if they had known the unseen, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:10
item.description: There was for [the tribe of] Saba' in their dwelling place a sign: two [fields of] gardens on the right and on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord and be grateful to Him. A good land [have you], and a forgiving Lord."

item.title: Al-Quran-34:11
item.description: But they turned away [refusing], so We sent upon them the flood of the dam, and We replaced their two [fields of] gardens with gardens of bitter fruit, tamarisks and something of sparse lote trees.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:12
item.description: [By] that We repaid them because they disbelieved. And do We [thus] repay except the ungrateful?

item.title: Al-Quran-34:13
item.description: And Iblees had already confirmed through them his assumption, so they followed him, except for a party of believers.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:14
item.description: And he had over them no authority except [it was decreed] that We might make evident who believes in the Hereafter from who is thereof in doubt. And your Lord, over all things, is Guardian.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:15
item.description: Say, [O Muhammad], "Invoke those you claim [as deities] besides Allah." They do not possess an atom's weight [of ability] in the heavens or on the earth, and they do not have therein any partnership [with Him], nor is there for Him from among them any assistant.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:16
item.description: And We have not sent you except comprehensively to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:17
item.description: And those who disbelieve say, "We will never believe in this Qur'an nor in that before it." But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting each other's words... Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If not for you, we would have been believers."

item.title: Al-Quran-34:18
item.description: And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but it is [by being] one who has believed and done righteousness. For them there will be the double reward for what they did, and they will be in the upper chambers [of Paradise], safe [and secure].

item.title: Al-Quran-34:19
item.description: And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].

item.title: Al-Quran-34:20
item.description: And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Muhammad], any warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:21
item.description: And those before them denied, and the people of Makkah have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But the former peoples denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:22
item.description: And if you could see when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:23
item.description: And they had already disbelieved in it before and would assault the unseen from a place far away.

item.title: Al-Quran-34:24
item.description: And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting denial.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:1
item.description: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:2
item.description: Whatever Allah grants to people of mercy - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:3
item.description: O mankind, remember the favor of Allah upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?

item.title: Al-Quran-35:4
item.description: And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:5
item.description: O mankind, indeed the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:6
item.description: Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:7
item.description: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:8
item.description: Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, Allah sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:9
item.description: And it is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:10
item.description: Whoever desires honor [through power] - then to Allah belongs all honor. To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it. But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:11
item.description: And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for Allah is easy.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:12
item.description: And not alike are the two bodies of water. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:13
item.description: He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:14
item.description: If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association. And none can inform you like [one] Acquainted [with all matters].

item.title: Al-Quran-35:15
item.description: O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:16
item.description: If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:17
item.description: And that is for Allah not difficult.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:18
item.description: And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to Allah is the [final] destination.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:19
item.description: Not equal are the blind and the seeing,

item.title: Al-Quran-35:20
item.description: Nor are the darknesses and the light,

item.title: Al-Quran-35:21
item.description: Nor are the shade and the heat,

item.title: Al-Quran-35:22
item.description: And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allah causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:23
item.description: You, [O Muhammad], are not but a warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:24
item.description: Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:25
item.description: And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:26
item.description: Then I seized the ones who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:27
item.description: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:28
item.description: And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear Allah, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:29
item.description: Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allah and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a profit that will never perish -

item.title: Al-Quran-35:30
item.description: That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:31
item.description: And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed, Allah, of His servants, is Acquainted and Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:32
item.description: Then we caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants; and among them is he who wrongs himself, and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allah. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:33
item.description: [For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:34
item.description: And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do we recompense every ungrateful one.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:35
item.description: Indeed, Allah is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:36
item.description: It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:37
item.description: Say, "Have you considered your 'partners' whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."

item.title: Al-Quran-35:38
item.description: Indeed, Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:39
item.description: And they swore by Allah their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:40
item.description: [Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of Allah any change, and you will never find in the way of Allah any alteration.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:41
item.description: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But Allah is not to be caused failure by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.

item.title: Al-Quran-35:42
item.description: And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allah has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:1
item.description: Ya, Seen.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:2
item.description: By the wise Qur'an.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:3
item.description: Indeed you, [O Muhammad], are from among the messengers,

item.title: Al-Quran-36:4
item.description: On a straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:5
item.description: [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,

item.title: Al-Quran-36:6
item.description: That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:7
item.description: Already the word has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:8
item.description: Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:9
item.description: And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:10
item.description: And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:11
item.description: You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:12
item.description: Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:13
item.description: And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -

item.title: Al-Quran-36:14
item.description: Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:15
item.description: And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:16
item.description: Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:17
item.description: Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:18
item.description: And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:19
item.description: It was not but one shout, and immediately they were extinguished.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:20
item.description: How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:21
item.description: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them will not return?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:22
item.description: And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:23
item.description: And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:24
item.description: And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -

item.title: Al-Quran-36:25
item.description: That they may eat of His fruit. And their hands have not produced it, so will they not be grateful?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:26
item.description: Exalted is He who created all pairs - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:27
item.description: And a sign for them is the night. We remove from it [the light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:28
item.description: And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:29
item.description: And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:30
item.description: It is not allowable for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:31
item.description: And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers in a laden ship.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:32
item.description: And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:33
item.description: And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved

item.title: Al-Quran-36:34
item.description: Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:35
item.description: And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they are from it turning away.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:36
item.description: They do not await except one blast which will seize them while they are disputing.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:37
item.description: And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:38
item.description: And the Horn will be blown; and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:39
item.description: It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:40
item.description: So today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:41
item.description: Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -

item.title: Al-Quran-36:42
item.description: They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:43
item.description: For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]

item.title: Al-Quran-36:44
item.description: Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -

item.title: Al-Quran-36:45
item.description: And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:46
item.description: And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:47
item.description: This is the Hellfire which you were promised.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:48
item.description: That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:49
item.description: And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:50
item.description: And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:51
item.description: And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation; so will they not understand?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:52
item.description: And We did not give Prophet Muhammad, knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur'an

item.title: Al-Quran-36:53
item.description: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:54
item.description: Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:55
item.description: And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:56
item.description: And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:57
item.description: But they have taken besides Allah [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:58
item.description: They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:59
item.description: So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:60
item.description: Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once he is a clear adversary?

item.title: Al-Quran-36:61
item.description: [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:62
item.description: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.

item.title: Al-Quran-36:63
item.description: So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:1
item.description: By those [angels] lined up in rows

item.title: Al-Quran-37:2
item.description: And those who drive [the clouds]

item.title: Al-Quran-37:3
item.description: And those who recite the message,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:4
item.description: Indeed, your God is One,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:5
item.description: Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:6
item.description: Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars

item.title: Al-Quran-37:7
item.description: And as protection against every rebellious devil

item.title: Al-Quran-37:8
item.description: [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:9
item.description: Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:10
item.description: Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:11
item.description: But you wonder, while they mock,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:12
item.description: And when they are reminded, they remember not.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:13
item.description: And when they see a sign, they ridicule

item.title: Al-Quran-37:14
item.description: When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:15
item.description: It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:16
item.description: Other than Allah, and guide them to the path of Hellfire

item.title: Al-Quran-37:17
item.description: But they, that Day, are in surrender.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:18
item.description: And they will approach one another blaming each other.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:19
item.description: And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:20
item.description: So the word of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:21
item.description: So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:22
item.description: Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:23
item.description: Rather, the Prophet has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:24
item.description: Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:25
item.description: And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -

item.title: Al-Quran-37:26
item.description: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:27
item.description: Those will have a provision determined -

item.title: Al-Quran-37:28
item.description: Fruits; and they will be honored

item.title: Al-Quran-37:29
item.description: In gardens of pleasure

item.title: Al-Quran-37:30
item.description: On thrones facing one another.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:31
item.description: There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:32
item.description: White and delicious to the drinkers;

item.title: Al-Quran-37:33
item.description: No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:34
item.description: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances, with large, [beautiful] eyes,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:35
item.description: As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:36
item.description: And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:37
item.description: Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe

item.title: Al-Quran-37:38
item.description: That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"

item.title: Al-Quran-37:39
item.description: And he will look and see him in the midst of the Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:40
item.description: If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:41
item.description: Then, are we not to die

item.title: Al-Quran-37:42
item.description: Indeed, this is the great attainment.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:43
item.description: For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:44
item.description: Is Paradise a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqum?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:45
item.description: Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:46
item.description: Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:47
item.description: Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:48
item.description: And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:49
item.description: Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:50
item.description: Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:51
item.description: Indeed they found their fathers astray.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:52
item.description: So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:53
item.description: And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:54
item.description: And We had already sent among them warners.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:55
item.description: Then look how was the end of those who were warned -

item.title: Al-Quran-37:56
item.description: But not the chosen servants of Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:57
item.description: And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:58
item.description: And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:59
item.description: And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]

item.title: Al-Quran-37:60
item.description: And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

item.title: Al-Quran-37:61
item.description: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:62
item.description: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:63
item.description: Then We drowned the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:64
item.description: And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:65
item.description: When he came to his Lord with a sound heart

item.title: Al-Quran-37:66
item.description: Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allah you desire?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:67
item.description: And he cast a look at the stars

item.title: Al-Quran-37:68
item.description: So they turned away from him, departing.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:69
item.description: And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:70
item.description: Then the people came toward him, hastening.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:71
item.description: And they intended for him a plan, but We made them the most debased.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:72
item.description: So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:73
item.description: And when they had both submitted and he put him down upon his forehead,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:74
item.description: Indeed, this was the clear trial.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:75
item.description: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:76
item.description: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

item.title: Al-Quran-37:77
item.description: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:78
item.description: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:79
item.description: And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:80
item.description: And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:81
item.description: And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:82
item.description: And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:83
item.description: And We supported them so it was they who overcame.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:84
item.description: And We gave them the explicit Scripture,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:85
item.description: And We guided them on the straight path.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:86
item.description: And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:

item.title: Al-Quran-37:87
item.description: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:88
item.description: Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:89
item.description: And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:90
item.description: Do you call upon Ba'l and leave the best of creators -

item.title: Al-Quran-37:91
item.description: And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],

item.title: Al-Quran-37:92
item.description: Except the chosen servants of Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:93
item.description: And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

item.title: Al-Quran-37:94
item.description: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:95
item.description: Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:96
item.description: And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:97
item.description: [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:98
item.description: Except his wife among those who remained [with the evildoers].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:99
item.description: Then We destroyed the others.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:100
item.description: And indeed, you pass by them in the morning

item.title: Al-Quran-37:101
item.description: And at night. Then will you not use reason?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:102
item.description: And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:103
item.description: [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:104
item.description: And he drew lots and was among the losers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:105
item.description: Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:106
item.description: And had he not been of those who exalt Allah,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:107
item.description: He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:108
item.description: But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:109
item.description: And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:110
item.description: And We sent him to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:111
item.description: And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:112
item.description: Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:113
item.description: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:114
item.description: What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:115
item.description: Then will you not be reminded?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:116
item.description: Or do you have a clear authority?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:117
item.description: Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:118
item.description: And they have claimed between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought to [punishment].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:119
item.description: Exalted is Allah above what they describe,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:120
item.description: Except the chosen servants of Allah [who do not share in that sin].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:121
item.description: So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:122
item.description: You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him

item.title: Al-Quran-37:123
item.description: Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:124
item.description: And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].

item.title: Al-Quran-37:125
item.description: And indeed, the disbelievers used to say,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:126
item.description: But they disbelieved in it, so they are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:127
item.description: And Our word has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,

item.title: Al-Quran-37:128
item.description: [That] indeed, they would be those given victory

item.title: Al-Quran-37:129
item.description: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:130
item.description: So, [O Muhammad], leave them for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:131
item.description: And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:132
item.description: Then for Our punishment are they impatient?

item.title: Al-Quran-37:133
item.description: But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:134
item.description: And leave them for a time.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:135
item.description: And see, for they are going to see.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:136
item.description: Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:137
item.description: And peace upon the messengers.

item.title: Al-Quran-37:138
item.description: And praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:1
item.description: Sad. By the Qur'an containing reminder...

item.title: Al-Quran-38:2
item.description: But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:3
item.description: How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:4
item.description: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This is not but a fabrication.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:5
item.description: Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?

item.title: Al-Quran-38:6
item.description: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:7
item.description: [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].

item.title: Al-Quran-38:8
item.description: The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] 'Aad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,

item.title: Al-Quran-38:9
item.description: And [the tribe of] Thamud and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket. Those are the companies.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:10
item.description: Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:11
item.description: And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:12
item.description: Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-38:13
item.description: Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allah] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:14
item.description: And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].

item.title: Al-Quran-38:15
item.description: And We strengthened his kingdom and gave him wisdom and discernment in speech.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:16
item.description: And has there come to you the news of the adversaries, when they climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber -

item.title: Al-Quran-38:17
item.description: Indeed this, my brother, has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe; so he said, 'Entrust her to me,' and he overpowered me in speech."

item.title: Al-Quran-38:18
item.description: So We forgave him that; and indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:19
item.description: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and that between them aimlessly. That is the assumption of those who disbelieve, so woe to those who disbelieve from the Fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:20
item.description: Or should we treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like corrupters in the land? Or should We treat those who fear Allah like the wicked?

item.title: Al-Quran-38:21
item.description: [This is] a blessed Book which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:22
item.description: And to David We gave Solomon. An excellent servant, indeed he was one repeatedly turning back [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-38:23
item.description: [Mention] when there were exhibited before him in the afternoon the poised [standing] racehorses.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:24
item.description: And We certainly tried Solomon and placed on his throne a body; then he returned.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:25
item.description: So We subjected to him the wind blowing by his command, gently, wherever he directed,

item.title: Al-Quran-38:26
item.description: And [also] the devils [of jinn] - every builder and diver

item.title: Al-Quran-38:27
item.description: And others bound together in shackles.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:28
item.description: And indeed, for him is nearness to Us and a good place of return.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:29
item.description: And We granted him his family and a like [number] with them as mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:30
item.description: And remember Our servants, Abraham, Isaac and Jacob - those of strength and [religious] vision.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:31
item.description: Indeed, We chose them for an exclusive quality: remembrance of the home [of the Hereafter].

item.title: Al-Quran-38:32
item.description: And indeed they are, to Us, among the chosen and outstanding.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:33
item.description: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, and all are among the outstanding.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:34
item.description: This is a reminder. And indeed, for the righteous is a good place of return

item.title: Al-Quran-38:35
item.description: Gardens of perpetual residence, whose doors will be opened to them.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:36
item.description: Reclining within them, they will call therein for abundant fruit and drink.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:37
item.description: And with them will be women limiting [their] glances and of equal age.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:38
item.description: This is what you, [the righteous], are promised for the Day of Account.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:39
item.description: Indeed, this is Our provision; for it there is no depletion.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:40
item.description: This [is so]. But indeed, for the transgressors is an evil place of return -

item.title: Al-Quran-38:41
item.description: Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the resting place.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:42
item.description: This - so let them taste it - is scalding water and [foul] purulence.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:43
item.description: And other [punishments] of its type [in various] kinds.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:44
item.description: Indeed, that is truth - the quarreling of the people of the Fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:45
item.description: From which you turn away.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:46
item.description: I had no knowledge of the exalted assembly [of angels] when they were disputing [the creation of Adam].

item.title: Al-Quran-38:47
item.description: So the angels prostrated - all of them entirely.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:48
item.description: Except Iblees; he was arrogant and became among the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-38:49
item.description: Say, [O Muhammad], "I do not ask you for the Qur'an any payment, and I am not of the pretentious

item.title: Al-Quran-38:50
item.description: It is but a reminder to the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:1
item.description: The revelation of the Qur'an is from Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:2
item.description: Indeed, We have sent down to you the Book, [O Muhammad], in truth. So worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:3
item.description: If Allah had intended to take a son, He could have chosen from what He creates whatever He willed. Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:4
item.description: He created the heavens and earth in truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. Unquestionably, He is the Exalted in Might, the Perpetual Forgiver.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:5
item.description: He created you from one soul. Then He made from it its mate, and He produced for you from the grazing livestock eight mates. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation, within three darknesses. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs dominion. There is no deity except Him, so how are you averted?

item.title: Al-Quran-39:6
item.description: If you disbelieve - indeed, Allah is Free from need of you. And He does not approve for His servants disbelief. And if you are grateful, He approves it for you; and no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. Then to your Lord is your return, and He will inform you about what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:7
item.description: They will have canopies of fire above them and below them, canopies. By that Allah threatens His servants. O My servants, then fear Me.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:8
item.description: But those who have avoided Taghut, lest they worship it, and turned back to Allah - for them are good tidings. So give good tidings to My servants

item.title: Al-Quran-39:9
item.description: Who listen to speech and follow the best of it. Those are the ones Allah has guided, and those are people of understanding.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:10
item.description: Then, is one who has deserved the decree of punishment [to be guided]? Then, can you save one who is in the Fire?

item.title: Al-Quran-39:11
item.description: But those who have feared their Lord - for them are chambers, above them chambers built high, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] the promise of Allah. Allah does not fail in [His] promise.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:12
item.description: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky and makes it flow as springs [and rivers] in the earth; then He produces thereby crops of varying colors; then they dry and you see them turned yellow; then He makes them [scattered] debris. Indeed in that is a reminder for those of understanding.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:13
item.description: So is one whose breast Allah has expanded to [accept] Islam and he is upon a light from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects it]? Then woe to those whose hearts are hardened against the remembrance of Allah. Those are in manifest error.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:14
item.description: Allah has sent down the best statement: a consistent Book wherein is reiteration. The skins shiver therefrom of those who fear their Lord; then their skins and their hearts relax at the remembrance of Allah. That is the guidance of Allah by which He guides whom He wills. And one whom Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:15
item.description: Those before them denied, and punishment came upon them from where they did not perceive.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:16
item.description: So Allah made them taste disgrace in worldly life. But the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:17
item.description: And We have certainly presented for the people in this Qur'an from every [kind of] example - that they might remember.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:18
item.description: [It is] an Arabic Qur'an, without any deviance that they might become righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:19
item.description: Allah presents an example: a slave owned by quarreling partners and another belonging exclusively to one man - are they equal in comparison? Praise be to Allah! But most of them do not know.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:20
item.description: Indeed, you are to die, and indeed, they are to die.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:21
item.description: Then indeed you, on the Day of Resurrection, before your Lord, will dispute.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:22
item.description: So who is more unjust than one who lies about Allah and denies the truth when it has come to him? Is there not in Hell a residence for the disbelievers?

item.title: Al-Quran-39:23
item.description: And the one who has brought the truth and [they who] believed in it - those are the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:24
item.description: They will have whatever they desire with their Lord. That is the reward of the doers of good -

item.title: Al-Quran-39:25
item.description: That Allah may remove from them the worst of what they did and reward them their due for the best of what they used to do.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:26
item.description: Is not Allah sufficient for His Servant [Prophet Muhammad]? And [yet], they threaten you with those [they worship] other than Him. And whoever Allah leaves astray - for him there is no guide.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:27
item.description: And whoever Allah guides - for him there is no misleader. Is not Allah Exalted in Might and Owner of Retribution?

item.title: Al-Quran-39:28
item.description: Indeed, We sent down to you the Book for the people in truth. So whoever is guided - it is for [the benefit of] his soul; and whoever goes astray only goes astray to its detriment. And you are not a manager over them.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:29
item.description: Allah takes the souls at the time of their death, and those that do not die [He takes] during their sleep. Then He keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others for a specified term. Indeed in that are signs for a people who give thought.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:30
item.description: And when Allah is mentioned alone, the hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with aversion, but when those [worshipped] other than Him are mentioned, immediately they rejoice.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:31
item.description: And if those who did wrong had all that is in the earth entirely and the like of it with it, they would [attempt to] ransom themselves thereby from the worst of the punishment on the Day of Resurrection. And there will appear to them from Allah that which they had not taken into account.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:32
item.description: And there will appear to them the evils they had earned, and they will be enveloped by what they used to ridicule.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:33
item.description: Those before them had already said it, but they were not availed by what they used to earn.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:34
item.description: And the evil consequences of what they earned struck them. And those who have wronged of these [people] will be afflicted by the evil consequences of what they earned; and they will not cause failure.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:35
item.description: Do they not know that Allah extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it]? Indeed in that are signs for a people who believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:36
item.description: And return [in repentance] to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you; then you will not be helped.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:37
item.description: And follow the best of what was revealed to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly while you do not perceive,

item.title: Al-Quran-39:38
item.description: But yes, there had come to you My verses, but you denied them and were arrogant, and you were among the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-39:39
