item.description: And as for 'Aad, they were destroyed by a screaming, violent wind

item.title: Al-Quran-69:7
item.description: Which Allah imposed upon them for seven nights and eight days in succession, so you would see the people therein fallen as if they were hollow trunks of palm trees.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:8
item.description: Then do you see of them any remains?

item.title: Al-Quran-69:9
item.description: And there came Pharaoh and those before him and the overturned cities with sin.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:10
item.description: And they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with a seizure exceeding [in severity].

item.title: Al-Quran-69:11
item.description: Indeed, when the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship

item.title: Al-Quran-69:12
item.description: That We might make it for you a reminder and [that] a conscious ear would be conscious of it.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:13
item.description: Then when the Horn is blown with one blast

item.title: Al-Quran-69:14
item.description: And the earth and the mountains are lifted and leveled with one blow -

item.title: Al-Quran-69:15
item.description: Then on that Day, the Resurrection will occur,

item.title: Al-Quran-69:16
item.description: And the heaven will split [open], for that Day it is infirm.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:17
item.description: And the angels are at its edges. And there will bear the Throne of your Lord above them, that Day, eight [of them].

item.title: Al-Quran-69:18
item.description: That Day, you will be exhibited [for judgement]; not hidden among you is anything concealed.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:19
item.description: So he will be in a pleasant life -

item.title: Al-Quran-69:20
item.description: In an elevated garden,

item.title: Al-Quran-69:21
item.description: Its [fruit] to be picked hanging near.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:22
item.description: And had not known what is my account.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:23
item.description: I wish my death had been the decisive one.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:24
item.description: My wealth has not availed me.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:25
item.description: Then into Hellfire drive him.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:26
item.description: Indeed, he did not used to believe in Allah, the Most Great,

item.title: Al-Quran-69:27
item.description: Nor did he encourage the feeding of the poor.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:28
item.description: So there is not for him here this Day any devoted friend

item.title: Al-Quran-69:29
item.description: Nor any food except from the discharge of wounds;

item.title: Al-Quran-69:30
item.description: None will eat it except the sinners.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:31
item.description: So I swear by what you see

item.title: Al-Quran-69:32
item.description: And what you do not see

item.title: Al-Quran-69:33
item.description: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is the word of a noble Messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:34
item.description: And it is not the word of a poet; little do you believe.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:35
item.description: Nor the word of a soothsayer; little do you remember.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:36
item.description: [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:37
item.description: And if Muhammad had made up about Us some [false] sayings,

item.title: Al-Quran-69:38
item.description: We would have seized him by the right hand;

item.title: Al-Quran-69:39
item.description: Then We would have cut from him the aorta.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:40
item.description: And there is no one of you who could prevent [Us] from him.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:41
item.description: And indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder for the righteous.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:42
item.description: And indeed, We know that among you are deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:43
item.description: And indeed, it will be [a cause of] regret upon the disbelievers.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:44
item.description: And indeed, it is the truth of certainty.

item.title: Al-Quran-69:45
item.description: So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:1
item.description: A supplicant asked for a punishment bound to happen

item.title: Al-Quran-70:2
item.description: To the disbelievers; of it there is no preventer.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:3
item.description: [It is] from Allah, owner of the ways of ascent.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:4
item.description: The angels and the Spirit will ascend to Him during a Day the extent of which is fifty thousand years.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:5
item.description: So be patient with gracious patience.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:6
item.description: Indeed, they see it [as] distant,

item.title: Al-Quran-70:7
item.description: But We see it [as] near.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:8
item.description: On the Day the sky will be like murky oil,

item.title: Al-Quran-70:9
item.description: And the mountains will be like wool,

item.title: Al-Quran-70:10
item.description: And no friend will ask [anything of] a friend,

item.title: Al-Quran-70:11
item.description: They will be shown each other. The criminal will wish that he could be ransomed from the punishment of that Day by his children

item.title: Al-Quran-70:12
item.description: And his wife and his brother

item.title: Al-Quran-70:13
item.description: And his nearest kindred who shelter him

item.title: Al-Quran-70:14
item.description: And whoever is on earth entirely [so] then it could save him.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:15
item.description: No! Indeed, it is the Flame [of Hell],

item.title: Al-Quran-70:16
item.description: A remover of exteriors.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:17
item.description: It invites he who turned his back [on truth] and went away [from obedience]

item.title: Al-Quran-70:18
item.description: And collected [wealth] and hoarded.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:19
item.description: Indeed, mankind was created anxious:

item.title: Al-Quran-70:20
item.description: When evil touches him, impatient,

item.title: Al-Quran-70:21
item.description: And when good touches him, withholding [of it],

item.title: Al-Quran-70:22
item.description: Except the observers of prayer -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:23
item.description: Those who are constant in their prayer

item.title: Al-Quran-70:24
item.description: And those within whose wealth is a known right

item.title: Al-Quran-70:25
item.description: For the petitioner and the deprived -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:26
item.description: And those who believe in the Day of Recompense

item.title: Al-Quran-70:27
item.description: And those who are fearful of the punishment of their Lord -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:28
item.description: Indeed, the punishment of their Lord is not that from which one is safe -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:29
item.description: And those who guard their private parts

item.title: Al-Quran-70:30
item.description: Except from their wives or those their right hands possess, for indeed, they are not to be blamed -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:31
item.description: But whoever seeks beyond that, then they are the transgressors -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:32
item.description: And those who are to their trusts and promises attentive

item.title: Al-Quran-70:33
item.description: And those who are in their testimonies upright

item.title: Al-Quran-70:34
item.description: And those who [carefully] maintain their prayer:

item.title: Al-Quran-70:35
item.description: They will be in gardens, honored.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:36
item.description: So what is [the matter] with those who disbelieve, hastening [from] before you, [O Muhammad],

item.title: Al-Quran-70:37
item.description: [To sit] on [your] right and [your] left in separate groups?

item.title: Al-Quran-70:38
item.description: Does every person among them aspire to enter a garden of pleasure?

item.title: Al-Quran-70:39
item.description: No! Indeed, We have created them from that which they know.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:40
item.description: So I swear by the Lord of [all] risings and settings that indeed We are able

item.title: Al-Quran-70:41
item.description: To replace them with better than them; and We are not to be outdone.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:42
item.description: So leave them to converse vainly and amuse themselves until they meet their Day which they are promised -

item.title: Al-Quran-70:43
item.description: The Day they will emerge from the graves rapidly as if they were, toward an erected idol, hastening.

item.title: Al-Quran-70:44
item.description: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. That is the Day which they had been promised.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:1
item.description: [Saying], 'Worship Allah, fear Him and obey me.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:2
item.description: Allah will forgive you of your sins and delay you for a specified term. Indeed, the time [set by] Allah, when it comes, will not be delayed, if you only knew.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-71:3
item.description: But my invitation increased them not except in flight.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:4
item.description: And indeed, every time I invited them that You may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, covered themselves with their garments, persisted, and were arrogant with [great] arrogance.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:5
item.description: Then I invited them publicly.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:6
item.description: Then I announced to them and [also] confided to them secretly

item.title: Al-Quran-71:7
item.description: And said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. Indeed, He is ever a Perpetual Forgiver.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:8
item.description: He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in [continuing] showers

item.title: Al-Quran-71:9
item.description: And give you increase in wealth and children and provide for you gardens and provide for you rivers.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:10
item.description: What is [the matter] with you that you do not attribute to Allah [due] grandeur

item.title: Al-Quran-71:11
item.description: While He has created you in stages?

item.title: Al-Quran-71:12
item.description: Do you not consider how Allah has created seven heavens in layers

item.title: Al-Quran-71:13
item.description: And made the moon therein a [reflected] light and made the sun a burning lamp?

item.title: Al-Quran-71:14
item.description: And Allah has caused you to grow from the earth a [progressive] growth.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:15
item.description: Then He will return you into it and extract you [another] extraction.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:16
item.description: And Allah has made for you the earth an expanse

item.title: Al-Quran-71:17
item.description: That you may follow therein roads of passage.' "

item.title: Al-Quran-71:18
item.description: And they conspired an immense conspiracy.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:19
item.description: And said, 'Never leave your gods and never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:20
item.description: Because of their sins they were drowned and put into the Fire, and they found not for themselves besides Allah [any] helpers.

item.title: Al-Quran-71:21
item.description: Indeed, if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and not beget except [every] wicked one and [confirmed] disbeliever.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:1
item.description: Say, [O Muhammad], "It has been revealed to me that a group of the jinn listened and said, 'Indeed, we have heard an amazing Qur'an.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:2
item.description: It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:3
item.description: And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son

item.title: Al-Quran-72:4
item.description: And that our foolish one has been saying about Allah an excessive transgression.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:5
item.description: And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allah a lie.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:6
item.description: And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:7
item.description: And they had thought, as you thought, that Allah would never send anyone [as a messenger].

item.title: Al-Quran-72:8
item.description: And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:9
item.description: And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing, but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:10
item.description: And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:11
item.description: And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:12
item.description: And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allah upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:13
item.description: And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:14
item.description: And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allah], and among us are the unjust. And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:15
item.description: But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'

item.title: Al-Quran-72:16
item.description: And [Allah revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant provision

item.title: Al-Quran-72:17
item.description: So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord He will put into arduous punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:18
item.description: And [He revealed] that the masjids are for Allah, so do not invoke with Allah anyone.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:19
item.description: [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.

item.title: Al-Quran-72:20
item.description: [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone

item.title: Al-Quran-72:21
item.description: Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before each messenger and behind him observers

item.title: Al-Quran-72:22
item.description: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:1
item.description: O you who wraps himself [in clothing],

item.title: Al-Quran-73:2
item.description: Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -

item.title: Al-Quran-73:3
item.description: Half of it - or subtract from it a little

item.title: Al-Quran-73:4
item.description: Or add to it, and recite the Qur'an with measured recitation.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:5
item.description: Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:6
item.description: Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue] and more suitable for words.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:7
item.description: Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:8
item.description: And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:9
item.description: [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:10
item.description: And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:11
item.description: And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:12
item.description: Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire

item.title: Al-Quran-73:13
item.description: And food that chokes and a painful punishment -

item.title: Al-Quran-73:14
item.description: On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:15
item.description: Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:16
item.description: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:17
item.description: Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white- haired?

item.title: Al-Quran-73:18
item.description: The heaven will break apart therefrom; ever is His promise fulfilled.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:19
item.description: Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.

item.title: Al-Quran-73:20
item.description: Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muhammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allah determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur'an. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allah and others fighting for the cause of Allah. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakah and loan Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allah. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allah. Indeed, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:1
item.description: O you who covers himself [with a garment],

item.title: Al-Quran-74:2
item.description: Arise and warn

item.title: Al-Quran-74:3
item.description: And your Lord glorify

item.title: Al-Quran-74:4
item.description: And your clothing purify

item.title: Al-Quran-74:5
item.description: And uncleanliness avoid

item.title: Al-Quran-74:6
item.description: And do not confer favor to acquire more

item.title: Al-Quran-74:7
item.description: But for your Lord be patient.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:8
item.description: And when the trumpet is blown,

item.title: Al-Quran-74:9
item.description: That Day will be a difficult day

item.title: Al-Quran-74:10
item.description: For the disbelievers - not easy.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:11
item.description: Leave Me with the one I created alone

item.title: Al-Quran-74:12
item.description: And to whom I granted extensive wealth

item.title: Al-Quran-74:13
item.description: And children present [with him]

item.title: Al-Quran-74:14
item.description: And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].

item.title: Al-Quran-74:15
item.description: Then he desires that I should add more.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:16
item.description: No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:17
item.description: I will cover him with arduous torment.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:18
item.description: Indeed, he thought and deliberated.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:19
item.description: So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:20
item.description: Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:21
item.description: Then he considered [again];

item.title: Al-Quran-74:22
item.description: Then he frowned and scowled;

item.title: Al-Quran-74:23
item.description: Then he turned back and was arrogant

item.title: Al-Quran-74:24
item.description: I will drive him into Saqar.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:25
item.description: And what can make you know what is Saqar?

item.title: Al-Quran-74:26
item.description: It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],

item.title: Al-Quran-74:27
item.description: Blackening the skins.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:28
item.description: Over it are nineteen [angels].

item.title: Al-Quran-74:29
item.description: No! By the moon

item.title: Al-Quran-74:30
item.description: And [by] the night when it departs

item.title: Al-Quran-74:31
item.description: And [by] the morning when it brightens,

item.title: Al-Quran-74:32
item.description: Indeed, the Fire is of the greatest [afflictions]

item.title: Al-Quran-74:33
item.description: As a warning to humanity -

item.title: Al-Quran-74:34
item.description: To whoever wills among you to proceed or stay behind.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:35
item.description: Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained

item.title: Al-Quran-74:36
item.description: Except the companions of the right,

item.title: Al-Quran-74:37
item.description: [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other

item.title: Al-Quran-74:38
item.description: About the criminals,

item.title: Al-Quran-74:39
item.description: Nor did we used to feed the poor.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:40
item.description: And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],

item.title: Al-Quran-74:41
item.description: And we used to deny the Day of Recompense

item.title: Al-Quran-74:42
item.description: So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:43
item.description: Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away

item.title: Al-Quran-74:44
item.description: As if they were alarmed donkeys

item.title: Al-Quran-74:45
item.description: Fleeing from a lion?

item.title: Al-Quran-74:46
item.description: Rather, every person among them desires that he would be given scriptures spread about.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:47
item.description: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:48
item.description: No! Indeed, the Qur'an is a reminder

item.title: Al-Quran-74:49
item.description: Then whoever wills will remember it.

item.title: Al-Quran-74:50
item.description: And they will not remember except that Allah wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:1
item.description: I swear by the Day of Resurrection

item.title: Al-Quran-75:2
item.description: And I swear by the reproaching soul [to the certainty of resurrection].

item.title: Al-Quran-75:3
item.description: Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?

item.title: Al-Quran-75:4
item.description: Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:5
item.description: But man desires to continue in sin.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:6
item.description: So when vision is dazzled

item.title: Al-Quran-75:7
item.description: And the moon darkens

item.title: Al-Quran-75:8
item.description: And the sun and the moon are joined,

item.title: Al-Quran-75:9
item.description: No! There is no refuge.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:10
item.description: To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:11
item.description: Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead and kept back.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:12
item.description: Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,

item.title: Al-Quran-75:13
item.description: Even if he presents his excuses.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:14
item.description: Move not your tongue with it, [O Muhammad], to hasten with recitation of the Qur'an.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:15
item.description: Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:16
item.description: So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:17
item.description: Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].

item.title: Al-Quran-75:18
item.description: No! But you love the immediate

item.title: Al-Quran-75:19
item.description: And leave the Hereafter.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:20
item.description: [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,

item.title: Al-Quran-75:21
item.description: Looking at their Lord.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:22
item.description: And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,

item.title: Al-Quran-75:23
item.description: Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:24
item.description: No! When the soul has reached the collar bones

item.title: Al-Quran-75:25
item.description: And the dying one is certain that it is the [time of] separation

item.title: Al-Quran-75:26
item.description: And the leg is wound about the leg,

item.title: Al-Quran-75:27
item.description: To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:28
item.description: And the disbeliever had not believed, nor had he prayed.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:29
item.description: But [instead], he denied and turned away.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:30
item.description: And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].

item.title: Al-Quran-75:31
item.description: Woe to you, and woe!

item.title: Al-Quran-75:32
item.description: Then woe to you, and woe!

item.title: Al-Quran-75:33
item.description: Does man think that he will be left neglected?

item.title: Al-Quran-75:34
item.description: Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?

item.title: Al-Quran-75:35
item.description: Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allah] created [his form] and proportioned [him]

item.title: Al-Quran-75:36
item.description: And made of him two mates, the male and the female.

item.title: Al-Quran-75:37
item.description: Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?

item.title: Al-Quran-76:1
item.description: Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?

item.title: Al-Quran-76:2
item.description: Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:3
item.description: Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:4
item.description: Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:5
item.description: Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kafur,

item.title: Al-Quran-76:6
item.description: A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allah will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].

item.title: Al-Quran-76:7
item.description: They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:8
item.description: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,

item.title: Al-Quran-76:9
item.description: So Allah will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness

item.title: Al-Quran-76:10
item.description: And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].

item.title: Al-Quran-76:11
item.description: [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:12
item.description: And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:13
item.description: And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],

item.title: Al-Quran-76:14
item.description: Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:15
item.description: And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger

item.title: Al-Quran-76:16
item.description: [From] a fountain within Paradise named Salsabeel.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:17
item.description: There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:18
item.description: And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:19
item.description: Upon the inhabitants will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:20
item.description: Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muhammad], the Qur'an progressively.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:21
item.description: So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].

item.title: Al-Quran-76:22
item.description: And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening

item.title: Al-Quran-76:23
item.description: And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt Him a long [part of the] night.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:24
item.description: Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them a grave Day.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:25
item.description: We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:26
item.description: Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:27
item.description: And you do not will except that Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is ever Knowing and Wise.

item.title: Al-Quran-76:28
item.description: He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:1
item.description: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts

item.title: Al-Quran-77:2
item.description: And the winds that blow violently

item.title: Al-Quran-77:3
item.description: And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]

item.title: Al-Quran-77:4
item.description: And those [angels] who bring criterion

item.title: Al-Quran-77:5
item.description: And those [angels] who deliver a message

item.title: Al-Quran-77:6
item.description: As justification or warning,

item.title: Al-Quran-77:7
item.description: Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:8
item.description: So when the stars are obliterated

item.title: Al-Quran-77:9
item.description: And when the heaven is opened

item.title: Al-Quran-77:10
item.description: And when the mountains are blown away

item.title: Al-Quran-77:11
item.description: And when the messengers' time has come...

item.title: Al-Quran-77:12
item.description: For what Day was it postponed?

item.title: Al-Quran-77:13
item.description: For the Day of Judgement.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:14
item.description: And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?

item.title: Al-Quran-77:15
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:16
item.description: Did We not destroy the former peoples?

item.title: Al-Quran-77:17
item.description: Then We will follow them with the later ones.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:18
item.description: Thus do We deal with the criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:19
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:20
item.description: Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?

item.title: Al-Quran-77:21
item.description: And We placed it in a firm lodging

item.title: Al-Quran-77:22
item.description: For a known extent.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:23
item.description: And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:24
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:25
item.description: Have We not made the earth a container

item.title: Al-Quran-77:26
item.description: Of the living and the dead?

item.title: Al-Quran-77:27
item.description: And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:28
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:29
item.description: Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns

item.title: Al-Quran-77:30
item.description: Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,

item.title: Al-Quran-77:31
item.description: As if they were yellowish [black] camels.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:32
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:33
item.description: This is a Day they will not speak,

item.title: Al-Quran-77:34
item.description: Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:35
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:36
item.description: This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:37
item.description: So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:38
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:39
item.description: Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs

item.title: Al-Quran-77:40
item.description: And fruits from whatever they desire,

item.title: Al-Quran-77:41
item.description: Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:42
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:43
item.description: [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:44
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:45
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers.

item.title: Al-Quran-77:46
item.description: Then in what statement after the Qur'an will they believe?

item.title: Al-Quran-78:1
item.description: About what are they asking one another?

item.title: Al-Quran-78:2
item.description: About the great news -

item.title: Al-Quran-78:3
item.description: That over which they are in disagreement.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:4
item.description: No! They are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:5
item.description: Then, no! They are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:6
item.description: Have We not made the earth a resting place?

item.title: Al-Quran-78:7
item.description: And the mountains as stakes?

item.title: Al-Quran-78:8
item.description: And We created you in pairs

item.title: Al-Quran-78:9
item.description: And made your sleep [a means for] rest

item.title: Al-Quran-78:10
item.description: And made the night as clothing

item.title: Al-Quran-78:11
item.description: And made the day for livelihood

item.title: Al-Quran-78:12
item.description: And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]

item.title: Al-Quran-78:13
item.description: And made [therein] a burning lamp

item.title: Al-Quran-78:14
item.description: And sent down, from the rain clouds, pouring water

item.title: Al-Quran-78:15
item.description: That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation

item.title: Al-Quran-78:16
item.description: And gardens of entwined growth.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:17
item.description: Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -

item.title: Al-Quran-78:18
item.description: The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes

item.title: Al-Quran-78:19
item.description: And the heaven is opened and will become gateways

item.title: Al-Quran-78:20
item.description: And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:21
item.description: Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait

item.title: Al-Quran-78:22
item.description: For the transgressors, a place of return,

item.title: Al-Quran-78:23
item.description: In which they will remain for ages [unending].

item.title: Al-Quran-78:24
item.description: They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink

item.title: Al-Quran-78:25
item.description: Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -

item.title: Al-Quran-78:26
item.description: An appropriate recompense.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:27
item.description: Indeed, they were not expecting an account

item.title: Al-Quran-78:28
item.description: And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:29
item.description: But all things We have enumerated in writing.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:30
item.description: Indeed, for the righteous is attainment -

item.title: Al-Quran-78:31
item.description: Gardens and grapevines

item.title: Al-Quran-78:32
item.description: And full-breasted [companions] of equal age

item.title: Al-Quran-78:33
item.description: And a full cup.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:34
item.description: No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -

item.title: Al-Quran-78:35
item.description: [As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,

item.title: Al-Quran-78:36
item.description: [From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:37
item.description: The Day that the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.

item.title: Al-Quran-78:38
item.description: That is the True Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:1
item.description: By those [angels] who extract with violence

item.title: Al-Quran-79:2
item.description: And [by] those who remove with ease

item.title: Al-Quran-79:3
item.description: And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming

item.title: Al-Quran-79:4
item.description: And those who race each other in a race

item.title: Al-Quran-79:5
item.description: And those who arrange [each] matter,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:6
item.description: On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],

item.title: Al-Quran-79:7
item.description: There will follow it the subsequent [one].

item.title: Al-Quran-79:8
item.description: Hearts, that Day, will tremble,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:9
item.description: Their eyes humbled.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:10
item.description: Even if we should be decayed bones?

item.title: Al-Quran-79:11
item.description: Indeed, it will be but one shout,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:12
item.description: And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:13
item.description: Has there reached you the story of Moses? -

item.title: Al-Quran-79:14
item.description: When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:15
item.description: And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself

item.title: Al-Quran-79:16
item.description: And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"

item.title: Al-Quran-79:17
item.description: And he showed him the greatest sign,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:18
item.description: But Pharaoh denied and disobeyed.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:19
item.description: Then he turned his back, striving.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:20
item.description: And he gathered [his people] and called out

item.title: Al-Quran-79:21
item.description: So Allah seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].

item.title: Al-Quran-79:22
item.description: Indeed in that is a warning for whoever would fear [Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-79:23
item.description: Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? Allah constructed it.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:24
item.description: He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:25
item.description: And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:26
item.description: And after that He spread the earth.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:27
item.description: He extracted from it its water and its pasture,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:28
item.description: And the mountains He set firmly

item.title: Al-Quran-79:29
item.description: As provision for you and your grazing livestock.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:30
item.description: But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity -

item.title: Al-Quran-79:31
item.description: The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:32
item.description: And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -

item.title: Al-Quran-79:33
item.description: So as for he who transgressed

item.title: Al-Quran-79:34
item.description: And preferred the life of the world,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:35
item.description: Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:36
item.description: But as for he who feared the position of his Lord and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,

item.title: Al-Quran-79:37
item.description: Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:38
item.description: They ask you, [O Muhammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?

item.title: Al-Quran-79:39
item.description: In what [position] are you that you should mention it?

item.title: Al-Quran-79:40
item.description: To your Lord is its finality.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:41
item.description: You are only a warner for those who fear it.

item.title: Al-Quran-79:42
item.description: It will be, on the Day they see it, as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:1
item.description: The Prophet frowned and turned away

item.title: Al-Quran-80:2
item.description: Because there came to him the blind man, [interrupting].

item.title: Al-Quran-80:3
item.description: But what would make you perceive, [O Muhammad], that perhaps he might be purified

item.title: Al-Quran-80:4
item.description: Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?

item.title: Al-Quran-80:5
item.description: As for he who thinks himself without need,

item.title: Al-Quran-80:6
item.description: To him you give attention.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:7
item.description: And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:8
item.description: But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]

item.title: Al-Quran-80:9
item.description: While he fears [Allah],

item.title: Al-Quran-80:10
item.description: From him you are distracted.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:11
item.description: No! Indeed, these verses are a reminder;

item.title: Al-Quran-80:12
item.description: So whoever wills may remember it.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:13
item.description: [It is recorded] in honored sheets,

item.title: Al-Quran-80:14
item.description: Exalted and purified,

item.title: Al-Quran-80:15
item.description: [Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,

item.title: Al-Quran-80:16
item.description: Noble and dutiful.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:17
item.description: Cursed is man; how disbelieving is he.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:18
item.description: From what substance did He create him?

item.title: Al-Quran-80:19
item.description: From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;

item.title: Al-Quran-80:20
item.description: Then He eased the way for him;

item.title: Al-Quran-80:21
item.description: Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:22
item.description: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:23
item.description: No! Man has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:24
item.description: Then let mankind look at his food -

item.title: Al-Quran-80:25
item.description: How We poured down water in torrents,

item.title: Al-Quran-80:26
item.description: Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],

item.title: Al-Quran-80:27
item.description: And caused to grow within it grain

item.title: Al-Quran-80:28
item.description: And grapes and herbage

item.title: Al-Quran-80:29
item.description: And olive and palm trees

item.title: Al-Quran-80:30
item.description: And gardens of dense shrubbery

item.title: Al-Quran-80:31
item.description: And fruit and grass -

item.title: Al-Quran-80:32
item.description: [As] enjoyment for you and your grazing livestock.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:33
item.description: But when there comes the Deafening Blast

item.title: Al-Quran-80:34
item.description: On the Day a man will flee from his brother

item.title: Al-Quran-80:35
item.description: And his mother and his father

item.title: Al-Quran-80:36
item.description: And his wife and his children,

item.title: Al-Quran-80:37
item.description: For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:38
item.description: [Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -

item.title: Al-Quran-80:39
item.description: Laughing, rejoicing at good news.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:40
item.description: And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:41
item.description: Blackness will cover them.

item.title: Al-Quran-80:42
item.description: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.

item.title: Al-Quran-81:1
item.description: When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]

item.title: Al-Quran-81:2
item.description: And when the stars fall, dispersing,

item.title: Al-Quran-81:3
item.description: And when the mountains are removed

item.title: Al-Quran-81:4
item.description: And when full-term she-camels are neglected

item.title: Al-Quran-81:5
item.description: And when the wild beasts are gathered

item.title: Al-Quran-81:6
item.description: And when the seas are filled with flame

item.title: Al-Quran-81:7
item.description: And when the souls are paired

item.title: Al-Quran-81:8
item.description: And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked

item.title: Al-Quran-81:9
item.description: For what sin she was killed

item.title: Al-Quran-81:10
item.description: And when the pages are made public

item.title: Al-Quran-81:11
item.description: And when the sky is stripped away

item.title: Al-Quran-81:12
item.description: And when Hellfire is set ablaze

item.title: Al-Quran-81:13
item.description: And when Paradise is brought near,

item.title: Al-Quran-81:14
item.description: A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].

item.title: Al-Quran-81:15
item.description: So I swear by the retreating stars -

item.title: Al-Quran-81:16
item.description: Those that run [their courses] and disappear -

item.title: Al-Quran-81:17
item.description: And by the night as it closes in

item.title: Al-Quran-81:18
item.description: And by the dawn when it breathes

item.title: Al-Quran-81:19
item.description: [That] indeed, the Qur'an is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger

item.title: Al-Quran-81:20
item.description: [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],

item.title: Al-Quran-81:21
item.description: Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.

item.title: Al-Quran-81:22
item.description: And your companion is not [at all] mad.

item.title: Al-Quran-81:23
item.description: And he has already seen Gabriel in the clear horizon.

item.title: Al-Quran-81:24
item.description: And Muhammad is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.

item.title: Al-Quran-81:25
item.description: And the Qur'an is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].

item.title: Al-Quran-81:26
item.description: So where are you going?

item.title: Al-Quran-81:27
item.description: It is not except a reminder to the worlds

item.title: Al-Quran-81:28
item.description: For whoever wills among you to take a right course.

item.title: Al-Quran-81:29
item.description: And you do not will except that Allah wills - Lord of the worlds.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:1
item.description: When the sky breaks apart

item.title: Al-Quran-82:2
item.description: And when the stars fall, scattering,

item.title: Al-Quran-82:3
item.description: And when the seas are erupted

item.title: Al-Quran-82:4
item.description: And when the [contents of] graves are scattered,

item.title: Al-Quran-82:5
item.description: A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:6
item.description: O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,

item.title: Al-Quran-82:7
item.description: Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?

item.title: Al-Quran-82:8
item.description: In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:9
item.description: No! But you deny the Recompense.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:10
item.description: And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,

item.title: Al-Quran-82:11
item.description: Noble and recording;

item.title: Al-Quran-82:12
item.description: They know whatever you do.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:13
item.description: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,

item.title: Al-Quran-82:14
item.description: And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:15
item.description: They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,

item.title: Al-Quran-82:16
item.description: And never therefrom will they be absent.

item.title: Al-Quran-82:17
item.description: And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?

item.title: Al-Quran-82:18
item.description: Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?

item.title: Al-Quran-82:19
item.description: It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allah.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:1
item.description: Woe to those who give less [than due],

item.title: Al-Quran-83:2
item.description: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:3
item.description: But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:4
item.description: Do they not think that they will be resurrected

item.title: Al-Quran-83:5
item.description: For a tremendous Day -

item.title: Al-Quran-83:6
item.description: The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

item.title: Al-Quran-83:7
item.description: No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:8
item.description: And what can make you know what is sijjeen?

item.title: Al-Quran-83:9
item.description: It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:10
item.description: Woe, that Day, to the deniers,

item.title: Al-Quran-83:11
item.description: Who deny the Day of Recompense.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:12
item.description: And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:13
item.description: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:14
item.description: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:15
item.description: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:16
item.description: No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in 'illiyyun.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:17
item.description: And what can make you know what is 'illiyyun?

item.title: Al-Quran-83:18
item.description: It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed

item.title: Al-Quran-83:19
item.description: Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-83:20
item.description: Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure

item.title: Al-Quran-83:21
item.description: On adorned couches, observing.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:22
item.description: You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:23
item.description: They will be given to drink [pure] wine [which was] sealed.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:24
item.description: The last of it is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:25
item.description: And its mixture is of Tasneem,

item.title: Al-Quran-83:26
item.description: A spring from which those near [to Allah] drink.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:27
item.description: Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:28
item.description: And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:29
item.description: And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:30
item.description: But they had not been sent as guardians over them.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:31
item.description: So Today those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,

item.title: Al-Quran-83:32
item.description: On adorned couches, observing.

item.title: Al-Quran-83:33
item.description: Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?

item.title: Al-Quran-84:1
item.description: When the sky has split [open]

item.title: Al-Quran-84:2
item.description: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]

item.title: Al-Quran-84:3
item.description: And when the earth has been extended

item.title: Al-Quran-84:4
item.description: And has cast out that within it and relinquished [it]

item.title: Al-Quran-84:5
item.description: And has responded to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] -

item.title: Al-Quran-84:6
item.description: O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion and will meet it.

item.title: Al-Quran-84:7
item.description: Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,

item.title: Al-Quran-84:8
item.description: He will be judged with an easy account

item.title: Al-Quran-84:9
item.description: And return to his people in happiness.

item.title: Al-Quran-84:10
item.description: But as for he who is given his record behind his back,

item.title: Al-Quran-84:11
item.description: He will cry out for destruction

item.title: Al-Quran-84:12
item.description: And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.

item.title: Al-Quran-84:13
item.description: Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;

item.title: Al-Quran-84:14
item.description: Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-84:15
item.description: But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever of him, Seeing.

item.title: Al-Quran-84:16
item.description: So I swear by the twilight glow

item.title: Al-Quran-84:17
item.description: And [by] the night and what it envelops

item.title: Al-Quran-84:18
item.description: And [by] the moon when it becomes full

item.title: Al-Quran-84:19
item.description: [That] you will surely experience state after state.

item.title: Al-Quran-84:20
item.description: So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,

item.title: Al-Quran-84:21
item.description: And when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allah]?

item.title: Al-Quran-84:22
item.description: But those who have disbelieved deny,

item.title: Al-Quran-84:23
item.description: And Allah is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.

item.title: Al-Quran-84:24
item.description: So give them tidings of a painful punishment,

item.title: Al-Quran-84:25
item.description: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:1
item.description: By the sky containing great stars

item.title: Al-Quran-85:2
item.description: And [by] the promised Day

item.title: Al-Quran-85:3
item.description: And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,

item.title: Al-Quran-85:4
item.description: Cursed were the companions of the trench

item.title: Al-Quran-85:5
item.description: [Containing] the fire full of fuel,

item.title: Al-Quran-85:6
item.description: When they were sitting near it

item.title: Al-Quran-85:7
item.description: And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:8
item.description: And they resented them not except because they believed in Allah, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,

item.title: Al-Quran-85:9
item.description: To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allah, over all things, is Witness.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:10
item.description: Indeed, those who have tortured the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:11
item.description: Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:12
item.description: Indeed, the vengeance of your Lord is severe.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:13
item.description: Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:14
item.description: And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,

item.title: Al-Quran-85:15
item.description: Honorable Owner of the Throne,

item.title: Al-Quran-85:16
item.description: Effecter of what He intends.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:17
item.description: Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -

item.title: Al-Quran-85:18
item.description: [Those of] Pharaoh and Thamud?

item.title: Al-Quran-85:19
item.description: But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,

item.title: Al-Quran-85:20
item.description: While Allah encompasses them from behind.

item.title: Al-Quran-85:21
item.description: But this is an honored Qur'an

item.title: Al-Quran-85:22
item.description: [Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:1
item.description: By the sky and the night comer -

item.title: Al-Quran-86:2
item.description: And what can make you know what is the night comer?

item.title: Al-Quran-86:3
item.description: It is the piercing star -

item.title: Al-Quran-86:4
item.description: There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:5
item.description: So let man observe from what he was created.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:6
item.description: He was created from a fluid, ejected,

item.title: Al-Quran-86:7
item.description: Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:8
item.description: Indeed, Allah, to return him [to life], is Able.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:9
item.description: The Day when secrets will be put on trial,

item.title: Al-Quran-86:10
item.description: Then man will have no power or any helper.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:11
item.description: By the sky which returns [rain]

item.title: Al-Quran-86:12
item.description: And [by] the earth which cracks open,

item.title: Al-Quran-86:13
item.description: Indeed, the Qur'an is a decisive statement,

item.title: Al-Quran-86:14
item.description: And it is not amusement.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:15
item.description: Indeed, they are planning a plan,

item.title: Al-Quran-86:16
item.description: But I am planning a plan.

item.title: Al-Quran-86:17
item.description: So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:1
item.description: Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,

item.title: Al-Quran-87:2
item.description: Who created and proportioned

item.title: Al-Quran-87:3
item.description: And who destined and [then] guided

item.title: Al-Quran-87:4
item.description: And who brings out the pasture

item.title: Al-Quran-87:5
item.description: And [then] makes it black stubble.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:6
item.description: We will make you recite, [O Muhammad], and you will not forget,

item.title: Al-Quran-87:7
item.description: Except what Allah should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:8
item.description: And We will ease you toward ease.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:9
item.description: So remind, if the reminder should benefit;

item.title: Al-Quran-87:10
item.description: He who fears [Allah] will be reminded.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:11
item.description: But the wretched one will avoid it -

item.title: Al-Quran-87:12
item.description: [He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,

item.title: Al-Quran-87:13
item.description: Neither dying therein nor living.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:14
item.description: He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself

item.title: Al-Quran-87:15
item.description: And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:16
item.description: But you prefer the worldly life,

item.title: Al-Quran-87:17
item.description: While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.

item.title: Al-Quran-87:18
item.description: Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,

item.title: Al-Quran-87:19
item.description: The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:1
item.description: Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?

item.title: Al-Quran-88:2
item.description: [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,

item.title: Al-Quran-88:3
item.description: Working [hard] and exhausted.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:4
item.description: They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:5
item.description: They will be given drink from a boiling spring.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:6
item.description: For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant

item.title: Al-Quran-88:7
item.description: Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:8
item.description: [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:9
item.description: With their effort [they are] satisfied

item.title: Al-Quran-88:10
item.description: In an elevated garden,

item.title: Al-Quran-88:11
item.description: Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:12
item.description: Within it is a flowing spring.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:13
item.description: Within it are couches raised high

item.title: Al-Quran-88:14
item.description: And cups put in place

item.title: Al-Quran-88:15
item.description: And cushions lined up

item.title: Al-Quran-88:16
item.description: And carpets spread around.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:17
item.description: Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?

item.title: Al-Quran-88:18
item.description: And at the sky - how it is raised?

item.title: Al-Quran-88:19
item.description: And at the mountains - how they are erected?

item.title: Al-Quran-88:20
item.description: And at the earth - how it is spread out?

item.title: Al-Quran-88:21
item.description: So remind, [O Muhammad]; you are only a reminder.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:22
item.description: You are not over them a controller.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:23
item.description: However, he who turns away and disbelieves -

item.title: Al-Quran-88:24
item.description: Then Allah will punish him with the greatest punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:25
item.description: Indeed, to Us is their return.

item.title: Al-Quran-88:26
item.description: Then indeed, upon Us is their account.

item.title: Al-Quran-89:1
item.description: By the dawn

item.title: Al-Quran-89:2
item.description: And [by] ten nights

item.title: Al-Quran-89:3
item.description: And [by] the even [number] and the odd

item.title: Al-Quran-89:4
item.description: And [by] the night when it passes,

item.title: Al-Quran-89:5
item.description: Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?

item.title: Al-Quran-89:6
item.description: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with 'Aad -

item.title: Al-Quran-89:7
item.description: [With] Iram - who had lofty pillars,

item.title: Al-Quran-89:8
item.description: The likes of whom had never been created in the land?

item.title: Al-Quran-89:9
item.description: And [with] Thamud, who carved out the rocks in the valley?

item.title: Al-Quran-89:10
item.description: And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes? -

item.title: Al-Quran-89:11
item.description: [All of] whom oppressed within the lands

item.title: Al-Quran-89:12
item.description: And increased therein the corruption.

item.title: Al-Quran-89:13
item.description: So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.

item.title: Al-Quran-89:14
item.description: Indeed, your Lord is in observation.

item.title: Al-Quran-89:15
item.description: No! But you do not honor the orphan

item.title: Al-Quran-89:16
item.description: And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.

item.title: Al-Quran-89:17
item.description: And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,

item.title: Al-Quran-89:18
item.description: And you love wealth with immense love.

item.title: Al-Quran-89:19
item.description: No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed -

item.title: Al-Quran-89:20
item.description: And your Lord has come and the angels, rank upon rank,

item.title: Al-Quran-89:21
item.description: And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but what good to him will be the remembrance?

item.title: Al-Quran-89:22
item.description: So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,

item.title: Al-Quran-89:23
item.description: And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].

item.title: Al-Quran-89:24
item.description: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],

item.title: Al-Quran-89:25
item.description: And enter among My [righteous] servants

item.title: Al-Quran-90:1
item.description: I swear by this city, Makkah -

item.title: Al-Quran-90:2
item.description: And you, [O Muhammad], are free of restriction in this city -

item.title: Al-Quran-90:3
item.description: And [by] the father and that which was born [of him],

item.title: Al-Quran-90:4
item.description: We have certainly created man into hardship.

item.title: Al-Quran-90:5
item.description: Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?

item.title: Al-Quran-90:6
item.description: Does he think that no one has seen him?

item.title: Al-Quran-90:7
item.description: Have We not made for him two eyes?

item.title: Al-Quran-90:8
item.description: And a tongue and two lips?

item.title: Al-Quran-90:9
item.description: And have shown him the two ways?

item.title: Al-Quran-90:10
item.description: But he has not broken through the difficult pass.

item.title: Al-Quran-90:11
item.description: And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?

item.title: Al-Quran-90:12
item.description: It is the freeing of a slave

item.title: Al-Quran-90:13
item.description: Or feeding on a day of severe hunger

item.title: Al-Quran-90:14
item.description: An orphan of near relationship

item.title: Al-Quran-90:15
item.description: Or a needy person in misery

item.title: Al-Quran-90:16
item.description: And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.

item.title: Al-Quran-90:17
item.description: Those are the companions of the right.

item.title: Al-Quran-90:18
item.description: But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.

item.title: Al-Quran-90:19
item.description: Over them will be fire closed in.

item.title: Al-Quran-91:1
item.description: By the sun and its brightness

item.title: Al-Quran-91:2
item.description: And [by] the moon when it follows it

item.title: Al-Quran-91:3
item.description: And [by] the day when it displays it

item.title: Al-Quran-91:4
item.description: And [by] the night when it covers it

item.title: Al-Quran-91:5
item.description: And [by] the sky and He who constructed it

item.title: Al-Quran-91:6
item.description: And [by] the earth and He who spread it

item.title: Al-Quran-91:7
item.description: And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it

item.title: Al-Quran-91:8
item.description: And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,

item.title: Al-Quran-91:9
item.description: He has succeeded who purifies it,

item.title: Al-Quran-91:10
item.description: And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].

item.title: Al-Quran-91:11
item.description: Thamud denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,

item.title: Al-Quran-91:12
item.description: When the most wretched of them was sent forth.

item.title: Al-Quran-91:13
item.description: But they denied him and hamstrung her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].

item.title: Al-Quran-91:14
item.description: And He does not fear the consequence thereof.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:1
item.description: By the night when it covers

item.title: Al-Quran-92:2
item.description: And [by] the day when it appears

item.title: Al-Quran-92:3
item.description: And [by] He who created the male and female,

item.title: Al-Quran-92:4
item.description: Indeed, your efforts are diverse.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:5
item.description: As for he who gives and fears Allah

item.title: Al-Quran-92:6
item.description: And believes in the best [reward],

item.title: Al-Quran-92:7
item.description: We will ease him toward ease.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:8
item.description: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need

item.title: Al-Quran-92:9
item.description: And denies the best [reward],

item.title: Al-Quran-92:10
item.description: We will ease him toward difficulty.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:11
item.description: And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?

item.title: Al-Quran-92:12
item.description: Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:13
item.description: And indeed, to Us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].

item.title: Al-Quran-92:14
item.description: So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:15
item.description: None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:16
item.description: Who had denied and turned away.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:17
item.description: But the righteous one will avoid it -

item.title: Al-Quran-92:18
item.description: [He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself

item.title: Al-Quran-92:19
item.description: And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded

item.title: Al-Quran-92:20
item.description: But only seeking the countenance of his Lord, Most High.

item.title: Al-Quran-92:21
item.description: And he is going to be satisfied.

item.title: Al-Quran-93:1
item.description: By the morning brightness

item.title: Al-Quran-93:2
item.description: And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,

item.title: Al-Quran-93:3
item.description: Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muhammad], nor has He detested [you].

item.title: Al-Quran-93:4
item.description: And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].

item.title: Al-Quran-93:5
item.description: And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.

item.title: Al-Quran-93:6
item.description: Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?

item.title: Al-Quran-93:7
item.description: And He found you lost and guided [you],

item.title: Al-Quran-93:8
item.description: And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.

item.title: Al-Quran-93:9
item.description: So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].

item.title: Al-Quran-93:10
item.description: And as for the petitioner, do not repel [him].

item.title: Al-Quran-93:11
item.description: But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].

item.title: Al-Quran-94:1
item.description: Did We not expand for you, [O Muhammad], your breast?

item.title: Al-Quran-94:2
item.description: And We removed from you your burden

item.title: Al-Quran-94:3
item.description: Which had weighed upon your back

item.title: Al-Quran-94:4
item.description: And raised high for you your repute.

item.title: Al-Quran-94:5
item.description: For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.

item.title: Al-Quran-94:6
item.description: Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.

item.title: Al-Quran-94:7
item.description: So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].

item.title: Al-Quran-94:8
item.description: And to your Lord direct [your] longing.

item.title: Al-Quran-95:1
item.description: By the fig and the olive

item.title: Al-Quran-95:2
item.description: And [by] Mount Sinai

item.title: Al-Quran-95:3
item.description: And [by] this secure city [Makkah],

item.title: Al-Quran-95:4
item.description: We have certainly created man in the best of stature;

item.title: Al-Quran-95:5
item.description: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,

item.title: Al-Quran-95:6
item.description: Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.

item.title: Al-Quran-95:7
item.description: So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?

item.title: Al-Quran-95:8
item.description: Is not Allah the most just of judges?

item.title: Al-Quran-96:1
item.description: Recite in the name of your Lord who created -

item.title: Al-Quran-96:2
item.description: Created man from a clinging substance.

item.title: Al-Quran-96:3
item.description: Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -

item.title: Al-Quran-96:4
item.description: Who taught by the pen -

item.title: Al-Quran-96:5
item.description: Taught man that which he knew not.

item.title: Al-Quran-96:6
item.description: No! [But] indeed, man transgresses

item.title: Al-Quran-96:7
item.description: Because he sees himself self-sufficient.

item.title: Al-Quran-96:8
item.description: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.

item.title: Al-Quran-96:9
item.description: Have you seen the one who forbids

item.title: Al-Quran-96:10
item.description: A servant when he prays?

item.title: Al-Quran-96:11
item.description: Have you seen if he is upon guidance

item.title: Al-Quran-96:12
item.description: Or enjoins righteousness?

item.title: Al-Quran-96:13
item.description: Have you seen if he denies and turns away -

item.title: Al-Quran-96:14
item.description: Does he not know that Allah sees?

item.title: Al-Quran-96:15
item.description: No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock -

item.title: Al-Quran-96:16
item.description: A lying, sinning forelock.

item.title: Al-Quran-96:17
item.description: Then let him call his associates;

item.title: Al-Quran-96:18
item.description: We will call the angels of Hell.

item.title: Al-Quran-96:19
item.description: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allah].

item.title: Al-Quran-97:1
item.description: Indeed, We sent the Qur'an down during the Night of Decree.

item.title: Al-Quran-97:2
item.description: And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?

item.title: Al-Quran-97:3
item.description: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.

item.title: Al-Quran-97:4
item.description: The angels and the Spirit descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.

item.title: Al-Quran-97:5
item.description: Peace it is until the emergence of dawn.

item.title: Al-Quran-98:1
item.description: Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief] until there came to them clear evidence -

item.title: Al-Quran-98:2
item.description: A Messenger from Allah, reciting purified scriptures

item.title: Al-Quran-98:3
item.description: Within which are correct writings.

item.title: Al-Quran-98:4
item.description: Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided until after there had come to them clear evidence.

item.title: Al-Quran-98:5
item.description: And they were not commanded except to worship Allah, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakah. And that is the correct religion.

item.title: Al-Quran-98:6
item.description: Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.

item.title: Al-Quran-98:7
item.description: Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.

item.title: Al-Quran-98:8
item.description: Their reward with Allah will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allah being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.

item.title: Al-Quran-99:1
item.description: When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake

item.title: Al-Quran-99:2
item.description: And the earth discharges its burdens

item.title: Al-Quran-99:3
item.description: That Day, it will report its news

item.title: Al-Quran-99:4
item.description: Because your Lord has commanded it.

item.title: Al-Quran-99:5
item.description: That Day, the people will depart separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.

item.title: Al-Quran-99:6
item.description: So whoever does an atom's weight of good will see it,

item.title: Al-Quran-99:7
item.description: And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.

item.title: Al-Quran-100:1
item.description: By the racers, panting,

item.title: Al-Quran-100:2
item.description: And the producers of sparks [when] striking

item.title: Al-Quran-100:3
item.description: And the chargers at dawn,

item.title: Al-Quran-100:4
item.description: Stirring up thereby [clouds of] dust,

item.title: Al-Quran-100:5
item.description: Arriving thereby in the center collectively,

item.title: Al-Quran-100:6
item.description: Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.

item.title: Al-Quran-100:7
item.description: And indeed, he is to that a witness.

item.title: Al-Quran-100:8
item.description: And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.

item.title: Al-Quran-100:9
item.description: But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered

item.title: Al-Quran-100:10
item.description: And that within the breasts is obtained,

item.title: Al-Quran-100:11
item.description: Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Acquainted.

item.title: Al-Quran-101:1
item.description: The Striking Calamity -

item.title: Al-Quran-101:2
item.description: What is the Striking Calamity?

item.title: Al-Quran-101:3
item.description: And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?

item.title: Al-Quran-101:4
item.description: It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,

item.title: Al-Quran-101:5
item.description: And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.

item.title: Al-Quran-101:6
item.description: Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],

item.title: Al-Quran-101:7
item.description: He will be in a pleasant life.

item.title: Al-Quran-101:8
item.description: But as for one whose scales are light,

item.title: Al-Quran-101:9
item.description: His refuge will be an abyss.

item.title: Al-Quran-101:10
item.description: And what can make you know what that is?

item.title: Al-Quran-101:11
item.description: It is a Fire, intensely hot.

item.title: Al-Quran-102:1
item.description: Competition in [worldly] increase diverts you

item.title: Al-Quran-102:2
item.description: Until you visit the graveyards.

item.title: Al-Quran-102:3
item.description: No! You are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-102:4
item.description: Then no! You are going to know.

item.title: Al-Quran-102:5
item.description: No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...

item.title: Al-Quran-102:6
item.description: You will surely see the Hellfire.

item.title: Al-Quran-102:7
item.description: Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.

item.title: Al-Quran-102:8
item.description: Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.

item.title: Al-Quran-103:1
item.description: By time,

item.title: Al-Quran-103:2
item.description: Indeed, mankind is in loss,

item.title: Al-Quran-103:3
item.description: Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.

item.title: Al-Quran-104:1
item.description: Woe to every scorner and mocker

item.title: Al-Quran-104:2
item.description: Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.

item.title: Al-Quran-104:3
item.description: He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.

item.title: Al-Quran-104:4
item.description: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.

item.title: Al-Quran-104:5
